loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock for a general shop including footwear, batteries, cell phones, scratch cards, and a TV set.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera Ambigo M. is 30 years old.  She is married with three children and lives in the town of Mlolongo that sits along the Mombasa -Nairobi highway.

Sera graduated from one of the largest referral hospitals in East Africa, Kenyatta Medical Training Center, in 1999 and started operating her clinic and pharmacy shop in 2006.  She began the clinic with initial capital from savings she made while employed at the Kenyatta National Hospital as a doctor (USD $1470). 

Equipped with her savings and her technical skills, Sera approached her husband, who is also a qualified doctor, and together they started the clinic and pharmacy shop.  They decided to start their business in Mlolongo because it is a very fast-growing town.  The couple rented two houses to host the clinic and hospital.  The business continues to grow as many patients seek their services.  The town is located along the only highway connecting Mombasa and Nairobi where many medical emergencies occur.  Also, Sera is able to perform labor deliveries, sending any complicated cases to Kenyatta Hospital in Nairobi.

The clinic and pharmacy have saved so many lives that Sera cannot recall the number and she wants to continue with this trend for many years to come.  She wants to add more stock of drugs to her clinic and pharmacy in order to cope with the increasing demand for medicine.  She, therefore, is requesting a loan of $1,175.  With this loan, Sera will be able to purchase drugs and supplies like syrups, tablets, injectables, and bandages.  This will greatly improve the services she is providing, save lives, and also increase her income.  

The repayment period is 10 months.

loans.use: To purchases an assortment of drugs including syrups, tablets and injectables

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en: Christabel A. is 60 years old. She lives with her husband, who is a retired government employee, and two of her remaining children (many of her children died of HIV- and Aids-related illness) in Nyamasaria Kisumu Kenya. She normally puts on a gloomy face as she narrates her story. Christabel takes care of 13 grandchildren, orphaned as a result of the HIV epidemic. She was trained as a Community Health Worker in 1988, and now provides home-based care services to six clients (HIV clients). Besides her community work, she runs three different businesses:  a hotel, which was initiated in 1966, a tailoring business, started in 1972, and a coca-cola kiosk, where she has sold coca-cola products since 2004. She requires US $700 to expand her coca-cola kiosk, and purchase products in bulk.

loans.use: Expand her coca-cola kiosks and purchase soft drinks (coke, fanta, sprite, etc)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mr. Sun V., 28, lives with his wife, 24, and three little kids in Batambong province, Cambodia. To make his living, Sun V. is talented working as a painter and generally earns around $7/day. His wife stays at home cooking and taking care of her children. Mr. Sun V. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to beneficially use for his family’s transportation and the remainder of the loan is to buy painting brushes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his family’s transportation and to buy painting brushes for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase engine parts for a matatu (small bus)

loans.name: Sifaheri

texts.en: Sifaheri is a prospecting young entrepreneur and a resident of the Lumo area in Dar es Salaam. She runs a ladies' salon and a small grocery store. She spends more time in the salon because it pays more than the grocery. She has employed one person in the grocery and one in her salon. She is in need of more resources to help her expand her salon, buy the latest cosmetics and buy more equipment to cater to more customers. She needs $375 to help achieve this.

loans.use: To expand her salon

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a 30-year-old, hardworking mother of two. She runs a shop selling both new and used handbags for ladies and men. She has been doing this business for the past ten years. She also sells kids' clothes in her shop. She buys the bags from the bigger suppliers and sells some in Dar es Salaam and supplies others up-country. She is in need of $900 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: she has repaid off her loan

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en: Zuberi is a 44-year-old father of three and a resident of Bombom in Dar es Salaam. He runs a pharmacy, a business he has been doing for six years. He sells all sorts of common medicines for fever, malaria and other common diseases for women and children. He is in need of $725 to help him expand the stock in his pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en: Theresia is a 44-year-old mother of three and a resident of Buza in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop selling soft drinks, juice and ice cream, a business she has been doing for the past five years. She now wants to expand her shop, buy a bigger refrigerator, and increase her stock. She needs $550 to accomplish all this.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho L. is 28 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 3 children. She specializes in sales of provisions and drinks. This is a business she learned from her aunty and started her own business in 2004. She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of $250 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Osariemen

texts.en: Osariemen J. is 23 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells and rents videocassettes to people living in her community. She is in need of a loan of US$ 475 to buy videocassettes for rent and sale. She thanks you

loans.use: To buy more videocassettes for sale

loans.name: Selemani

texts.en: Selemani S. is a 57-year-old, hard-working father of seven. He runs both a wholesale and a retail shop, two businesses that entirely support his family. At his wholesale shop, he deals in soft drinks (soda). He is a seller of the Coca-Cola Company products in his area. He is in need of $725 to help increase his stock and expand his capital.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Mrs. Soam R., 28, lives with her husband and three young kids in Batambong province, Cambodia. To help with her family’s expenses, she works selling grocery products at her home, earning on average around $6/day. Her husband is self-employed as a motor-taxi driver, making about $3 per day. Mrs. Soam R. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to fulfill her client demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to fulfill her client demands.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 32-year-old mother of two and a resident of Yombo-Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She runs a pharmacy in the Vituka area, a business she has been doing for the past four years. In her pharmacy, she has all sorts of medicine for most of the common diseases in Dar es Salaam. She is in need of $400 to help her expand her stock.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth E. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has 3 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old. She sells drinks and has been in this business since 1994.  Ruth is requesting  a loan of US$ 400 to enable her buy more drinks for sale, which she plans to repay within eight months.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Omua

texts.en: Mrs. Omua O. is a fashion designer by profession. She is 32 years old, married with 2 children, and she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 2002. She requests a loan of $475 to enable her buy more cloth and tailoring material to make clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring material

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Mrs. Bridget O. is 37 years old, married and has 4 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells plastic containers and has been in the business since 1994. She is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to enable her buy more kitchen utensils for sale.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for sale

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose S. is 28-years old. She is one of the active fashion designers in her area and because of that she has numerous customers. She started her business in 1998. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan amount of US$325 to enable her buy more cloth and tailoring supplies to make clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring material

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour is an industrious woman. She has been in the business for over 5 years. Her poly business has brought comfort to her family. She produces polyethylene bags and supply to her customer in her community. She is a LAPO member. She hopes to get the loan amount of US$ 250 to buy more equipment and material for production of bags for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To make more polyethylene bags for sale

loans.name: Omoregie

texts.en: E. Omoregie, 32 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells meat and has been in business since 1998. She hopes to get the loan of $250 to enable her buy more meat for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more meat (beef) for sale

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: Mrs. Thaong O., age 60, works with her husband on their plot of farmland, earning only a meager $1.50 per day from the sales of their crops. She is pictured in her home. They have three children who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a water pump to bring water from their well to irrigate their vegetables. Currently, they pull the water up in a bucket by hand and water the crops manually. A water pump would greatly increase their efficiency as well as allow them to grow a greater quantity of crops to sell, leading to an increase in income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour U. is 34 years old, she is a married woman, and she lives in Benin City of Edo State. She sells newspapers, drinks and snacks and she needs a loan of $325 to buy more newspapers, drinks and snacks for sale. She has been in this business since 2006.

loans.use: To buy newspapers, drinks and snacks for sale

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich L. H., age 56, works with her husband growing rice crops, earning on average about $2.50 each day collectively. They have three children, one who runs a store selling rice and food, and two who are mechanics. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to invest in the growth of her daughter’s store. Her daughter’s business has more growth potential than farming, and by increasing the inventory to meet customer demand, the whole family will benefit.

loans.use: To purchase grocery and food items to expand inventory.

loans.name: Phim

texts.en: Mrs. Phim K. S., age 47, works as a farmer, making only $1.20 per day. Her husband, age 60, is a farmer as well, and also hires out his bull for stud, making $0.50 per day. They have five children, four of whom work at a garment factory and one who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $300 in order to purchase ducks to breed in order to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to start a duck-breeding business.

loans.name: Iwu

texts.en: Iwu I. is 40 years old; she is a married woman and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells rice and beans and has been in the business since 1992. She is in need of a loan of US$ 1,175 to buy more rice and beans for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and beans for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy A. sells vests, cardigans, and school uniforms to schools and churches. She has been in this business since 1999. She is 43 years old, married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City. She has been a LAPO member. She is requesting the loan amount of $800 to enable her buy more material for making the vests, cardigans, and school uniforms for sale.

loans.use: To buy more material for making vests, cardigans, and school uniforms for sale.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy E. is 45 years old; she is married with 6 children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells provisions, cooked food & drinks. She has been in this business for 8 years. She needs the loan of $400 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs & drinks for sale. She is grateful and promises to repay it in 8 months. She will be grateful if a loan of $400 can be given to her.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, cooked food & drinks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Mrs. Patricia E. is 38 years old; she is married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She sells phone accessories, recharge cards and also makes phone calls for people and supplies ice cream. She has been in this business for 4 years. She is in need of a loan of $400 to buy more phone accessories & recharge cards for sale. She is grateful and promises to repay it in 8 months

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories & recharge cards for sale

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Mrs. Rith P. married in 1993 and has three sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor back in 1988. However, she began her weaving business at home in 2002. Her husband, Mr. Chea Vuthy is a blacksmith. He is currently in business welding metal in Phnom Penh city. He does not get to go home very often. He started this metal welding in 1985. With these businesses, all of their children are being sent to local schools. They expect to send their three sons to pursue higher education.

Mrs. P. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and some of it will be used to buy a welding air cylinder.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and buying metal-welding  air cylinder.

loans.name: Silay

texts.en:
Mrs. Silay V. married in 2002 and has one son and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1999 and began her silk production in the same year. She has trained her husband to weave silk as well. Her husband is a construction worker. He sometimes assists his spouse with weaving at home.

Mrs. V. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and setting up another loom for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread; fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and setting up another loom for her husband

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy H. is a widow with two sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor back in 1987 and began her silk production in the same year. She has never attended school. However, she is trying to work hard and sending her eldest son to attend school in the village and her youngest son is in the kindergarten in the same village.

Mrs. Savy H. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of US$ 400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mr. Sophoin Tep married in 1987. He has three children, one son and two daughters. He learned the skill of repairing motorbikes from his friend in Phnom Penh back in 1988. He began his business repairing motorbikes and selling motorbike spare parts in the village one year later. His spouse is at home and sells cooked food. Their eldest daughter is working at a garment factory in Pon-nhea Leu district. Other two children are studying in the local school.

Mr. Tep has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of US$ 1,000. He will use this loan to purchase more motorbike spare parts for expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchasing more motorbike spare parts for expanding his business

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Mr. Peng N. married in 1983 and has 6 children, three sons and 3 daughters. He is a farmer. He began his farming business in 1979. His wife, Mrs. Sorn Chan is planting and selling flowers in the village. Three of their children are currently working in a garment factory in Pon-nhea Leu district and the other three are studying in high school. They hope to expand their business activities so that they can afford to send their children to pursue higher education.

Mr. Peng N. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the third time in the amount of US$ 1,000. He will use the borrowed money to buy 2 two cows for his farming business.

loans.use: Buying 2 cows to use to plow the fields for growing rice

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs.Chantha N. married in 1986 and has two daughters. She started her grocery business in 2003. She attended training for sewing traditional Cambodian clothes, however, she is currently not in the business of sewing clothes. Her husband is currently serving as a police at the Prek Kampes commune. Their two daughters go to high school and they expect to send their children to pursue higher education so it will be easy for them to have a good job.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 200. She will use this loan to purchase more grocery items for her stock in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch S. married in 1993. She has one son and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1990 and began her silk production in the same year. She did not finish primary school. Her husband is a construction contractor. He started his construction business in 1997. Their two children are being sent to attend school in the village and they hope that their children can continue studying in higher education in the future.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, this time in the amount of US$ 350. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms

loans.name: Muny

texts.en:
Mrs. Muny N. married in 1985. She has two sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of selling bananas and flowers since 1997. Two of her children help with her business. The other two are studying at high school in Prek Thmey commune. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition, he is also doing farming. He used to be in the business of repairing motorbikes.

Mrs. N. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $1,000. She will use some of this amount to expand their banana and flower business and some of the amount will be used to purchase a motorbike to transport the products to the market.

loans.use: Expanding agricultural business and buying a motorbike

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy H. married in 1986 and has two sons. She learned to weave silk from her aunt in 2000 and began her silk production in the same year. In 2003 she trained her husband to weave silk as well. He used to be in the military. He has assisted Thavy in the business since 2003. She now wants to set up one more loom for her husband so that they can expand their silk production business. Currently, only one son is studying at the local school. Their other son is severely ill and stays at home.

Mrs. H. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 1,000. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms, and to set up another loom for her husband.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread; fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms and setting up another loom.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mr. Mon S. married in 1973 and has six children, two sons and four daughters. He has been in the business of driving a "remork"(a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) since 1992. He carries people from village to village and transports goods from villages to the market. Before that he was a construction worker. He works very hard in order to support his family and he expects to send his children to do higher education because he wants them to have a better life than he has. His spouse stays at home and looks after the children.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 200. He will use this loan to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi.

loans.use: Purchasing a new carriage for his motor taxi

loans.name: Shokhret

texts.ru:
Shokhret J. was born and lives in the town of Saatli in the Republic of Azerbaijan. She is 37 years old, and she comes from a poor family. She is married and has 3 children. Two years ago, while jobless, she decided to open her own business. Shokhret and her husband (see photo) rented space, bought tables and chairs, dishes and equipment for a cafe. But returns from the business were so low that Shokhret did not have the money to fix up the old cafe and as a result her clients started to leave the business. In order to stop clients from leaving, Shokhret asked for a $500 loan from the Norwegian Microcredit partner of Kiva. She will use the money to renovate the cafe.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Г-жа Шохрет родилась и живет в г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ей 37 лет, она выходец из малообеспеченной семьи. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Два года тому назад, будучи безработной, нужда заставила её в поисках заработка открыть собственное дело. Она с супругом (см. фото) арендовала помещение, купила столы и стулья, посуду и оборудование. Но низкая прибыль не позволяла Шохрет отремонтировать обветшавшее помещение кафе, и, как следствие, клиенты начали уходить. Чтобы прекратить отток клиентов, Шохрет обратилась за получением ссуды в 500 долларов к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру KIVA. Сумму кредита она собирается использовать для обновления помещения.

loans.use: For renovation

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn C. married in 1989. She has four children, three sons and one daughter. She has been in the business of purchasing and reselling longan fruit since 2003. In addition, she grows food crops. Her husband is a construction worker. He sometimes goes far from home. The elder two children are attending primary school and the other two are still at home. Mrs. C. hopes to expand her business so they can afford for their children to pursue higher education.

Mrs. C. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time; she hopes to receive US$ 1,000. She will use some of that amount to buy longan on contract to resell in the market in the city. The rest of the money will be used to change her motorbike so that she can better carry the longan to the market.

loans.use: Buying longan fruit on contract to resell in the market in the city and changing the motorbike she uses to transport the fruit

loans.name: Thurfa

texts.ru:
Thurfa K. lives in the town of Saatli of the Republic of Azerbaijan that is located in the South Caucasus. She is 47 years old, is married and has 3 children. Her family is large and poor, and it is getting more difficult to make ends meet in the conditions of mass unemployment in her town. Thurfa's only hope is the piece of land where she raises some chickens. Her son (on the photo) helps her in this business. He sells birds and eggs at the local supermarket. Part of the earnings must be spent to purchase two month old baby chicks. This purchase takes a serious toll on the family's income. If they had their own eggs and appropriate equipment, they could grow their own baby chicks. Part of them could be sold and another part could be grown. Thurfa approached Norwegian Microcredit that is partnering with Kiva to help her obtain a $500 credit to purchase eggs and special equipment for baby chicks.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Г-жа Турфа живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Ей 47 лет, она замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Семья большая, малообеспеченная и содержать её в условиях безработицы становится всё трудней. Единственная надежда на приусадебный участок где Турфа разводит небольшое количество кур. Ей в её бизнесе помогает её сын (см. фото), который продаёт приц и яйца на местном базаре. Часть заработанных денег они вынуждены тратить для покупки двухмесячных цыплят. Эта покупка уносит ощутимую часть прибыли. Имея свои яйца и соответствующие условия, намного выгоднее самим производить цыплят. Часть из них можно продать, а часть посадить на корм. С этой целью Турфа обратилась с просьбой о получении кредита 500 долларов к Норвежскому Микрокредиту-партнеру КИВА.

loans.use: To buy an incubator.

loans.name: Manzar

texts.ru:
Manzar K. was born and lives in a village near the town of Saatli in the Republic of Azerbaijan. She is 45 and not married. In order to make a living, Manzar together with her brother (on the foto) rented space and refurbished it as a workshop to repair home appliances. Even though Manzar's brother, who is good with repairs, does a lot of the work, she tries to help him. For example, Manzar helps with purchases and deliveries of spare parts, finding new clients and so on. Now, Manzar decided to obtain new equipment and to fix up the studio, in order to improve the work environment and attract more clients. This is why Manzar turned to the Norwegian Microcredit organization to obtain a $600 credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Г-жа Манзар родилась и живёт в деревне около г. Саатлы Азербайджанской Республики. Ей 45, она не замужем. Чтобы как-то зарабатывать на жизнь, Манзар вместе со своим братом арендовали помещение и переоборудовали его под мастерскую для ремонта бытовой техники. Конечно, основную работу делал Манзара брат, который хорошо разбирается в технике. Но и сестра как могла старалась ему помочь, например, в покупке и доставке из города запасных частей, нахождении клиентов и т.д. Сейчас Манзар решила переоборудовать и частично подремонтировать помещение, чтобы сделать условия работы лучше и привлечь больше клиентов. И поэтому Манзар обратилась к Норвежскому Микрокредиту для получения кредита в 600 долларов.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING SMALL PRINTER

loans.name: Febronia

texts.en:
Febronia is a small entrepreneur dealing with livestock keeping. She is a widow and has two children aged 31 and 33 years. She has six years experience in animal keeping and she real enjoys her job and she has a dream to become a successful entrepreneur. She is asking for a loan to buy a heater and feeding equipment for chickens and cows. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Heater and feeding equipment for chickens and cows

payments.comment: Febronia came in on 9/5/2008 and paid off the remainder of her loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CONTAINERS FOR STORAGE OF MILK AND WATER

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUY SHOW CASE AND TABLE

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two children. She runs a small business selling sausage and other meats in the central market of Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She sells a variety of meat products for reasonable prices at her stall. Alla started her venture nine years ago and has achieved stability since then. Currently, she has about $2,000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Alla has many loyal customers. They always come to buy sausage and meat from her, because they know she doesn’t offer any low-quality products in her kiosk. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Alla has decided to open a new vending kiosk in a different market and expand her trade. We believe Alla’s determination and desire to provide only the best-quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling cold drinks and snacks. She is not married and has three children aged 4,11 and 15 years. Mariam is in a battle against poverty so she is a very hard worker and this is her second loan. She is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs and an electronic calculator. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUY TABLES, CHAIRS AND ELECTRONIC CALCULATOR

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a business selling stylish leather purses from a little kiosk at the “rhinok,” or market, in Kahovka, Ukraine. She started her business about two years ago and currently makes about $200 per month in clear profit. Elena is married. She and her husband, Sergei, have two children, a son who is 16 and a daughter who is 12. One of Elena’s goals for her business is to make money to help support her family.

Elena has requested a loan of $800 to give her some additional working capital for her business. She hopes to continue her business development and increase her profits while working to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: To increase her working capital to develop her business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married and has two children. She owns a small business at the central market in Ordzhonikidze, where she sells quality footwear. Her assortment of merchandise is very versatile. Larisa has been in the shoe sales business for 12 years already. Throughout all these years her business has witnessed stable demand. Currently, she has about $3,600 in inventory. Her net profit per month is about $440.

Larisa realizes she needs financial support as her business continues to grow and develop. Today she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory and thereby increase her profits. Larisa is planning to open a new vending facility, and to continue to grow and gain more loyal customers in the future. We believe her communication and managing skills will help Larisa achieve continued stability and success in business.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory and open a new vending facility

loans.name: Elais

texts.en:
Elais is a small entrepreneur who owns a small shop selling charcoal. She is married and has two children ages 5 and 7 years. Elias is a very hard worker, and she believes that one day she can change her family's living standard through business. She is asking for a loan to buy a scale to weigh charcoal. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy a scale to weigh charcoal.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo lives in his own house with his wife and children on Docweeiller Street in the Tacagua zone. He makes his living crafting winter parkas, jackets and other pieces of clothing. He works with his wife. She not only helps him cut and sew the clothing but also sells the products.

The loan Alfredo is requesting will go toward the purchase of a larger sewing machine with more options such as embroidery and other advanced functions that will improve the quality of his products. As a result of his history with IMPRO, we have qualified Alfredo as a preferred client with qualification "1" and full eligibility for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Alfredo vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la calle Docweeiller de la zona de Tacagua; él se dedica a la confección de deportivos, parcas, chamarras y otros.Trabaja con su esposa; ella además de ayudarle a cortar y coser las prendas, vende el producto.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina mas grande que tenga mas opciones como ser bordar, coser overloock y pueda mejorar la calidad de sus prendas. Por su antecedente con Impro podemos calificarlo como cliente preferencial con calificación “1” y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is married and has two children. Her family lives in the small town of Bogorodchany in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of Ukraine. After Lesya was laid off from her previous job, she had to find some other way to provide for her family. That is how she became a market vendor. Today Lesya sells women’s clothing, footwear, and purses in a small retail store in downtown Bogorodchany. Her prices are always reasonable. Moreover, Lesya is the only entrepreneur selling this type of inventory in that area of the city. She has been in business for five years. Financial assistance has helped her business grow and expand. Currently, she has about $6,000 in inventory, and her monthly income is about $600.

Lesya is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase 15 pairs of pants wholesale to sell over this Christmas season. Her business is the only source of income for her family. That is why she is determined to work 24/7 to provide for their needs and stimulate the growth of her trade. One of her plans is to open a new vending facility in the local market and hire an employee to help her run the business. We believe her natural liveliness and enthusiasm will help Lesya achieve her goals and continue as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy 15 pairs of women’s pants to sell at her store

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya and her family live in the small city of Kahovka, located on the Dnepro River in southern Ukraine. She has a little kiosk at the busy city market where she sells a selection of towels and bedding supplies. Natalya started selling at the market about three years ago. She makes around $350 per month from her business. She likes what she does and is glad to be able to help support her family. Natalya and her husband, Uriy, have one daughter who is 14.

Natalya has requested a loan of $1,000 to purchase new inventory items. Because of the type of products she sells, Natalya experiences a high inventory turnover rate. This loan will help her buy a new supply of inventory so she will be able to meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina has a small grocery sales business that she operates from a space under a covered pavilion at the busy city market in Kahovka, Ukraine. Valentina is a very experienced market vendor, having been in business over ten years. She works many long hours in a week to make a good income. Her profit for a typical month is about $300, a valuable source of income for her and her husband, Alexander.

Valentina would like to continue the success of her business and has requested a loan of $500 to help purchase food inventory to sell. We are happy for this opportunity to provide financial assistance for Valentina as she works to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Lauteria Frías

texts.en:
Lauteria, 38, is an active, experienced, goal-oriented and committed businesswoman. She has a degree in Education Sciences. She has two children, a 19-year-old girl and a boy, age 11. The girl goes to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital, and the boy attends school in the community. Her husband is a mechanical engineer. Six years ago, Lauteria took out a loan from our organization to open a cafeteria. She invested the funds in some frying pans, an oven, a gas tank and ingredients to prepare food. She says that God has helped her operate the business wisely so that she could manage to have profits. She is now able to improve her children's education and pay transport for her daughter to go to Santo Domingo to the university three times a week.

Now she is looking forward to doing things even better and running business in a way that better satisfies her customers’ needs and earns new clients. She plans to rent a small site for the cafeteria and not have to operate the business within her house. She also wants to introduce new dishes into the menu.

She has applied for a second loan to invest in the rent of the new site and ingredients to keep operating the business. That way, Lauteria will continue producing food for her clientele and keep on improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a small site for her cafeteria and buy ingredients

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia has a booth in the Feria 16 de Julio (street fair) where she sells food. During the holiday season she also sells toys of medium quality; her husband finds work as a bricklayer when he can. These activities are the sources of income used to support their two children. She lives in the Zona Mariscal Sucre Camino a Copacabana in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to buy new merchandise (toys for the holidays), in order to increase the family income.

This is her second loan with IMPRO, and our assessment allows us to approve Julia’s loan. The first loan was paid off in its entirety.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia tiene un puesto en la Feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto donde comercializa comida. Por las fiestas de fin de año también comercializa juguetes de mediana calidad; el esposo es albañil eventual. Estas actividades son sus fuentes de ingresos con que mantiene a sus dos hijos; vive en la Zona Mariscal Sucre Camino a Copacabana de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería (juguetes para las fiesta de fin de año), de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos familiares.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitad por Julia. El primer crédito fue cancelado en tu totalidad.

loans.use: Buying new merchandise - toys.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose is a craftsman in metal workings; he makes metal troughs used to wash clothes which he sells all over the City of El Alto as travelling street vendor. His wife also helps by selling the troughs in her booth at the Feria 16 de Julio (street fair) on Thursdays and Sundays. He has four children aged 11, 8, 4, and 2 and they live in the Zona Villa Tunari Rio Seco in the City of El Alto.

The house in which they reside lacks a waste disposal system and this has become a very real problem for the entire family. The loan will be used to install a sewage system that will allow the family to have a better quality of life.

This is their first loan with IMPRO and our assessment allows us to approve Jose’s loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

José es artesano en metal mecánica, realiza bateas de metal para lavar ropa las cuales comercializa en toda la Ciudad de El Alto como vendedor ambulante callejero, la esposa colabora también con las ventas en su puesto de venta en la feria 16 de julio los días Jueves y Domingo; tiene cuatro hijos de 11, 8, 4 y 2 años de edad; vive en la Zona Villa Tunari Rio Seco de La Ciudad de El Alto.

La casa donde viven carece de sistema de desagüe y esto se ha convertido en un verdadero problema para toda la familia. El crédito requiere para la instalación de alcantarillados que ayudara a la familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por José.

loans.use: Installation of a home sewage system.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Lydia O. decided to start selling palm oil at the Obuasi Market. Since then she has become one of the most popular palm oil sellers at the market. She has good relationships with her customers. Palm oil is a red and flavorful cooking oil. It used in many traditional Ghanaian dishes, such as red-red, fu-fu soup, and palava sauce.

Lydia will be using the loan to purchase palm oil in bulk. This will decrease her costs significantly. Eventually Lydia hopes to build up enough capital to become a palm oil wholesaler.

Lydia is a member of the lending group in the Obuasi market. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To decrease costs by purchasing palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a merchant of food, clothes and medium-quality jewelry in private and public offices in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a public transportation driver and with their combined incomes, they are able to support their three sons. They live in the district Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. The credit she is seeking will be used to increase her merchandise. This way she will be able to increase her income. This is the fourth loan with Impro. She is an outstanding client and is recommended for another loan. She has been our client since 2004.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes es comerciante múltiple de comida, ropa y joyas de mediana calidad, productos que comercializa al crédito con pagos diario en las oficinas publicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja de transportista público y así complementan los ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos; vive en la Zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería y de esa forma poder generar mayores ingresos familiares. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le faculta para acceder a otro préstamo. Ella es nuestro cliente desde el año 2004.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Yulvania Miguelina

texts.en:
Yulvania is a very young entrepreneur who is striving for a better life. She lives with her partner and has no children. She is studying Computer Sciences in the public university of Santo Domingo, in the capital. For more than two years, Yulvania has been selling jewelry. She has different kinds of jewels in her inventory: gold-filled, silver-plated, acrylic jewels and plastic stones. When she started the business, she was just selling gold-filled jewelry. Six months ago, she obtained FSMA funds with which she could enlarge her inventory and attract more customers. This entrepreneur is very responsible and hard-working. Her discipline and sense of business helped her pay back the loan on time.

With profits from her sales activity, Yulvania pays transport to go to the university five days a week; she also helps her partner pay for their rented house, and she saves money for an emergency.

This entrepreneur hopes her business can grow so that she can have her own locale to operate her business, and that the store can get a lot of loyal customers. She has applied for a second loan to buy more goods to sell during the Christmas period. She thinks that it’s a great opportunity to increase her sales volume and thus her income. In the future, Yulvania says she will keep doing the business so that she can continue her university studies until she becomes a professional and has her own software company.

loans.use: Purchase more jewels to sell during the Christmas period.

loans.name: Pedrina De Los Santo

texts.en:
Pedrina is a 25-year-old mother of three sons, aged of 6, 5 and 2. The two eldest attend school. She sells sandwiches, fried salami, hamburgers, spicy sausage and milk shakes and natural juice. She started her business six months ago with funds she obtained from FSMA. She repaid the loan successfully. With that first loan, she bought all the kitchen utensils and some raw materials to prepare the food.

She says that her family’s living condition had changed dramatically since she opened that business. Not only can she now prepare breakfast for her children before they go to school, but she also gives them money for the lunch at school. This September, her sons began the new school year with brand-new shoes and uniforms.

Pedrina hopes her business can keep on growing so that she can continue providing a good education for her children. She has requested a second loan to buy raw materials for the business since she is short of some goods. Given this loan, the entrepreneur will be in a position to satisfy her customers and work for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to prepare and sell food.

loans.name: Virginia Yolanda

texts.es:
Virginia is a widow who started her business 60 years ago. She started with CS$20,000.00 (Cordobas) in capital which was in part savings she accumulated little by little with the intent of setting up her business, another part was her husband’s contribution, and the last third was from a loan.

Her locale when she started was in mediocre condition, it was closed with cinder blocks and wood and had a dirt floor. Today it is made of concrete with a brick floor and has display cases and enough tools to perform her work.

She’s worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and has a record of 16 credits. She says that “They have helped increase my inventory and improve my furnishings.”

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

VIRGINIA ES UNA SEÑORA VIUDA QUE COMIENZA SU NEGOCIO HACE 60 AÑOS, EMPEZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$20,000.00 (CÓRDOBAS) LOS CUALES PARTE ERAN AHORROS QUE RECOGIÓ POCO A POCO CON EL FIN DE INSTALAR SU NEGOCIO, OTRA PARTE ERA APORTE DE DE ESPOSO Y UNA TERCERA PARTE ERA PRESTADO.

SU LOCAL CUANDO INICIO TENIA CONDICIONES REGULARES ESTABA CERRADO CON BLOQUES Y MADERA Y EL SUELO ERA NATURAL (TIERRA). ACTUALMENTE EL LOCAL ES DE CONCRETO, CON PISO DE LADRILLO, Y CUENTA CON VITRINAS Y SUFICIENTES HERRAMIENTAS PARA REALIZAR SU TRABAJO.

TRABAJA CON CEPRODEL DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS Y SU RECORD ES DE 16 CREDITOS. ELLA EXPRESA QUE "LE HA AYUDADO A CRECER EN SU INVENTARIO Y A MEJORAR SU MOBILIARIO"

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (Retail sales of saddles, horseshoes, nails for horseshoes, stirrups, shoe soles, and bags)

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.en:
Luisa sells women’s clothing and shoes. She sells also plastic jewels. She has been operating this business for six months. Luisa has three children, two girls and a boy. Her husband is working as watchman.

Luisa says that business has been getting results. Even though she hopes she can improve the way she is doing business and increase her income. Currently, she has a weekly profit of USD 115.00.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase clothing in bulk and other goods in the capital. That way, she will reduce costs of trips she makes outside her town to get products. Luisa is very responsible and has a good credit history. She has already taken a loan from FSMA and she repaid it successfully.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es:
The inventiveness of Milagritos doesn't have any limits. She is always searching for the way to take care of her family's expenses. This energy let her start her own business five years ago, and she was always encouraged by her mother to learn the advantages and responsibilities of administering a business. Thanks to her effort, Milagritos and her small grocery store have been growing, and she keeps pushing forward because she wants to make it bigger and improve the store, with the objective of bettering the quality of life in her home. Because of these big dreams, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to improve her small grocery store. Let's show our support for this woman with unlimited strength so she can grow and make a good future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El ingenio de Milagritos no tiene limites, con su ayuda siempre está buscando la manera de solventar los gastos de su familia. Ese ímpetu la ha llevado a inaugurar su propio negocio hace cinco años ya que siempre fue animada por su mamá a aprender las ventajas y responsabilidades de la administración de un negocio. Gracias a su esfuerzo, Milagritos y su pequeña bodega han ido creciendo y sigue adelante porque quiere convertirla en la más grande y mejor implementada de su localidad, todo este esfuerzo lo hace por el bien y superación de sus dos hijos que la animan a seguir adelante con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.Por estos enormes deseos solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mercadería a fin de implementar su pequeña bodega. Solidaricémonos con una mujer de ilimitada fortaleza para crecer y forjar un buen futuro para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger variety and quantity of essential items to improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is very optimistic, despite the fact that he has been seriously ill during recent months and has had to undergo surgery. He has bounced back as if nothing happened, and he gets on with daily life, which he enjoys in the company (and under the watchful eye) of his dear wife.

After making a decision to bring up four children, they worked tirelessly to provide for their children so that they would get on well in their community, and attain each and every one of their goals. Now, in their senior years, they can take great satisfaction in seeing the fruits of their sacrifices and constant imparting of values - their children have grown into good men and women who in turn provide for the families that they have decided to create.

Now that his work as a father is completed, Juan’s strength has been renewed and he has a new goal: to continue working, alongside his wife, to enjoy his grandchildren and have a better quality of life and health. With this goal in mind, they decided two years ago to start raising guinea pigs. In earlier years they had practiced agriculture, but due to the physical effort involved and for health reasons, they had to give it up and sell all their plots of land, so that they could devote themselves entirely to this new business venture.

Day by day they wait for their guinea pigs to grow, watching the fruits of their investment with satisfaction. In order to house the new members of this small business, they plan to improve the facilities of their farm and become better prepared in order to obtain better results. That is why they are asking for a loan to invest in alfalfa and construction tools to start their expansion project as soon as possible. Let’s support this couple, who are a fine example of the family strength. Your contribution is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

Juan, es una persona muy optimista, a pesar de que su vida ha estado en riesgo durante estos meses por su estado de salud y tuvo que ser intervenido quirúrgicamente; se levanta como si nada hubiese pasado y ejerce sus actividades diarias porque tiene el gusto de hacerlas en compañía y bajo la fiel mirada de su querida esposa.

Desde que decidieron cobijar a cuatro hijos en el seno de su hogar han trabajado denodadamente a fin de brindarles lo necesario para que se desenvuelvan sin dificultad dentro de su sociedad y puedan alcanzar todas y cada una de las metas que se proponen.Ahora, ancianos observan con M. satisfacción los frutos de su sacrificio y constante comunicación de valores ya que se han convertido en hombres y mujeres de bien y además sostienen decorosamente a la familia que han decidido constituir.

Teniendo en cuenta que su labor de padre ha concluido, cada una de sus fuerzas se han renovado y tienen un nuevo propósito, continuar con su desempeño laboral al lado de su esposa para disfrutar de sus nietos y elevar su calidad de vida y salud. Con este propósito en mente se animaron hace dos años a dedicarse a la crianza de cuyes, años atrás se dedicaban a la agricultura pero por razones físicas y se salud tuvieron que abandonarlas y vender cada una de sus parcelas para dedicarse enteramente a esta nueva ocupación.

Día a día están pendientes del crecimiento de sus cuyes y con este nuevo oficio observan con satisfacción los frutos de su inversión.Y para albergar a los nuevos miembros de su pequeño negocio planean mejorar las instalaciones de su granja y capacitarse más a fin de obtener mejores resultados; es por ello que solicitan un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de alfalfa y demás implementos de construcción para poner en marcha su proyecto de expansión en corto tiempo.Apoyemos a esta pareja, ejemplo de la solidez familiar; tu aporte es muy importante.

loans.use: To buy food and refurbish facilities for rearing guinea pigs.

loans.name: Basilia Santana

texts.en:
Basilia is a 51-year-old assiduous woman who struggles to earn a living. She is single and has four children, two boys and two girls. For more than four years, Basilia has been selling sandwiches, toasted bread, milk shakes and juices. She runs the business within her house. Early in the morning, she prepares the sandwiches and starts to sell them to people going to school and to work. One of her daughter sometimes helps with the preparation and selling of the food. Currently, she has a lot of customers that she says are satisfied with her service and good character.

Basilia is thinking about enlarging her business with the intention to serve more people. With her loan, she will buy a large quantity of raw materials so as to sell more and increase her income. That way, she will have more opportunity to keep improving her family´s life quality.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to keep producing sandwiches and other food for a small cafeteria

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica is an ambitious woman, she has always found a way to support her home daily and her negotiation skills have placed her and her husband in a partnership. They invested the family savings in a small bus with the purpose of dedicating themselves to public transportation, associating themselves with a local transportation company to cover the route between Sicaya and Huancayo. Fifteen years have passed since they started this project and their hard work throughout that entire time has filled them with satisfaction as they’ve been able to fulfill the needs of their three dear children. Now Angelica would like to start a food selling business because during the past few years their income from the transportation business has decreased and she’s seen the need to create another source of income in order to continue supporting her family. Because the small bus is in urgent need of maintenance for improved daily living, she asks for a loan to cover this service and buy new tires. Lend your support to Angelica and her family, she thanks you for your valuable and important contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Angélica, es una mujer esforzada, siempre ha visto la manera de llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y las habilidades de negociación que posee han logrado que ella y su esposo lleguen a un acuerdo de trabajo en equipo e invirtieron los ahorros familiares en la compra de una movilidad con el propósito de dedicarse al transporte público asociándose a una línea local para cubrir la ruta de Sicaya a Huancayo. Ya han transcurrido quince años desde que iniciaron este proyecto y su desempeño durante todo este tiempo los han llenado de mucha satisfacción porque pueden satisfacer las necesidades de sus tres queridos hijos plenamente. Ahora, Angélica, tiene anhelos de implementar un negocio de venta de comidas porque en estos últimos años ha disminuido un poco los ingresos que perciben con su trabajo y a observado la necesidad de crear otro respaldo económico para seguir sosteniendo su familia.La urgente necesidad de otorgarle mantenimiento a su vehículo para un mejor desempeño diario la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para pagar este servicio y adquirir llantas nuevas.Solidarícese con Angélica y su familia, ella te agradece tu valioso e importante aporte.

loans.use: To purchase new tires and pay for maintenance on her only source of income.

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.en:
Santa is a 28-year-old mother of five children, four boys and a girl, all of whom attend the public school of the town. Her husband is a farmer. Santa dedicates herself to the sale of women´s clothing. She started that activity one year ago. Bi-weekly, she goes to the stores in Santo Domingo where she can acquire garments at very low prices. She sells the clothes in a much frequented public place.

The entrepreneur wants to significantly augment profits from the business. She plans to buy clothing in bulk so that she can reduce costs due to the number of trips she has to make to Santo Domingo to get the clothing. She thinks that she will increase her income and improve her margin profit.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia M. has been always working as a merchant in different areas. For the past four years she has worked selling cosmetics, toys, crystal-ware, house decor, and newborn baby clothes. She started with a capital of CS$50,0000.00 which were on savings.

Amelia started with a rented locale, which was made out of bricks and concrete. Currently, the conditions of her locale have improved and it now has display cabinets, displays and the floor is ceramic. Her hard work in this business is for the wellbeing and education of her son, because she wants to prepare him so he has a future with dignity.

CEPRODEL has supported Amelia for about a year now, with an average of 12 loans. Amelia feels satisfied and happy to work with CEPRODEL because this aid has helped her grow economically and as a person.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

AMELIA M. SIEMPRE SE HA DEDICADO AL COMERCIO EN SUS DIFERENTES RAMAS. DESDE HACE CUATRO AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS JUGUETES CRISTALERÍA, ADORNOS DE TODA OCASIÓN Y ROPA PARA RECIÉN NACIDOS. EMPEZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$50,0000.00 MISMOS QUE ERAN EN AHORRO.

INICIA CON UN LOCAL ALQUILADO, EL CUAL ERA DE LADRILLO Y CONCRETO. ACTUALMENTE LAS CONDICIONES DEL LOCAL HAN MEJORADO Y CONSTA DE VITRINAS, EXHIBIDORES Y EL PISO ES DE CERÁMICA. SU LUCHA EN ESTE NEGOCIO ES POR EL BIENESTAR Y EDUCACIÓN DE SU HIJO, YA QUE DESEA PREPARARLO PARA QUE TENGA UN FUTURO DIGNO.

CEPRODEL LE HA VENIDO APOYANDO DESDE HACE ALREDEDOR DE 1 AÑO CON UN PROMEDIO DE 12 CRÉDITOS. AMELIA SE SIENTE SATISFECHA Y CONTENTA DE TRABAJAR CON CEPRODEL, YA QUE ESTE APOYO BRINDADO LE HA AYUDADO A CRECER ECONÓMICAMENTE Y COMO PERSONA

loans.use: working capital - buying merchandise (cosmetics, toys, crystal ware, house decor, newborn baby clothing ) CAPITAL DE TRABAJO - COMPRA VENTA DE MERCADERÍA EN GENERAL (COSMETICOS JUGUETES  CRISTALERÍA, ADORNOS DE TODA OCASIÓN Y ROPA PARA RECIÉN NACIDOS)

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.es:
Mrs Eleodora, is a woman with great fortituD. to live. Previously she used to do agricultural work along with the partner of her whole life, who died not long ago. Now, she lives with one of her children who offers her his company, because the eldest have already left to look for their own happiness. Far from remaining sad from these events that happened consecutively, Eleodora shows us that life is beautiful and she works tirelessly at her small farm of guinea pigs that she installed a year ago. Her wish is to have a commercial place in downtown and sell her animals. Although she suffered a terrible accident one month ago and the recovery of the bone fracture she suffered is slow, she keeps on working because she wishes to remain useful and active. Eleodora is requesting the support of your noble heart to improve the facilities of her small farm. Support Eleodora, and be an important part of the construction of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Eleodora, es una mujer con mucha fortaleza para vivir, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo agrícola en compañía D. su compañero D. toda la vida, que partió a la eternidad hace poco. Ahora vive sólo con uno D. sus hijos que le brinda su compañía, debido a que los mayores partieron D. su hogar en búsqueda D. su felicidad. Lejos D. quedarse triste por estos acontecimientos que sucedieron consecutivamente, Eleodora, nos muestra que la vida es hermosa y trabaja incansablemente en su pequeña granja D. cuyes que instaló hace un año. Tiene anhelos que desea cumplir, entre ellos está el D. establecer un local comercial en el centro D. la ciudad y vender en este espacio sus hermosos y gorditos cuyes. A pesar D. que sufrió un terrible accidente hace un mes y la recuperación D. la fractura que sufrió es lenta, sigue trabajando porque desea verse útil y activa; Eleodora solicita el apoyo D. tu noble corazón para mejorar las instalaciones D. su pequeña granja. Apoya a Eleodora, y se parte importante D. la construcción D. sus anhelos.

loans.use: Improve facilities of her guinea pigs farm.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
"My wife and I worry about the safety of our house, especially during the night since there is very few light in the neighborhood where we live. We also have small children for this reason we decide to install a gate and a fence for protection of all of us". I’m asking for $500 to install the gate and fence in my house.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo estamos preocupados por la seguridad de nuestra casa, sobre todo en las noches ya que hay muy poca luz en el fraccionamiento en donde vivimos, también tenemos hijos pequeños así es que decidimos poner un portón y hacer una barda para protección de todos”.Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner un portón y una barda en mi vivienda.

loans.use: Install a gate and a fence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Extend the house at the front.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
" A few months ago, I finished construction of a couple of rooms in a lot that I bought, now I need to put the cement roof, but to tell you the truth, I run out of money. I need to put the roof as soon as possible so I can live there with my family ". I’m requesting $800 to put the concrete roof on the two rooms.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace algunos meces termine dos cuartos que hice en un terreno que compre, ahora necesito poner el techo de cemento pero la verdad me falto dinero, necesito ponérselo lo más pronto posible para poder habitarlos con mi familia”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para la poner el techo de concreto a dos cuartos.

loans.use: Put concrete roof on two rooms.

loans.name: Ayde Yboni

texts.es:
Mrs. Aide belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Valerosas II" (Courageous Women II). She lives in the Region San Martin, Province San Martin, Tarapoto district. Her home is in the Jr. Project Number 135, and her business is located in the Jr. Bolognesi Number 1055. She works on the production and sale of dairy products and juices, both wholesale and retail.

Ayde is associated with people who help her in this activity, both in the production and in the sales ends. Thanks to this support and to the loans from Manuela Ramos, Ayde has been able to increase her business which has allowed her to buy more merchandise and begin to expand her locale, since her clientele has increased and the business needs to produce more.

With the recent loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 1,000.00 (US $333.00), which will be paid back in 4 months, she bought products that will allow her to bottle larger quantities to satisfy the demand she has (sugar, milk, essences, produce, bottles, labels, etc.)

Mrs. Ayde is 33 years old and lives with her only child. She feels very strong to keep working. She likes what she does and is planning to put much more energy into it because she can see that this is an activity with a lot of future. She is currently building a new locale, larger and with all the installations necessary to produce more. Finishing the construction of this locale is her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ayde pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas II”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, su domicilio queda en el Jr. Proyecto Huallaga Nº 135 y su negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 1055. Se dedica a la producción y venta de lácteos y néctares al por mayor y menor.

Está asociada con personas quienes le ayudan en esta actividad tanto en la producción y la venta, gracias a este apoyo y a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado incrementar su negocio, le ha permitido comprar más insumos y empezar a ampliar el local ya que la clientela ha aumentado y necesitan producir más.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró productos que le permitirán envasar en más cantidad por la demanda que tiene (azúcar, leche, esencias, cultivo, envases, etiquetas, etc.)

La señora Aydé, tiene 33 años, vive con su único hijo, ella se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, le gusta lo que hace y piensa ponerle mucha más fuerza porque ve que es una actividad que tiene mucho futuro, actualmente se está construyendo un local más amplio y con todas las instalaciones necesarias para producir más, terminar de construir este local es su meta.

loans.use: Buying materials for the production and sale of diary and juice products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. Juana belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women). She lives in the San Martin region, the Bellavista district. Her business is located in the Hr. Huallaga Number 268, 1st floor. She has a general store where she sells basic needs products like milk, rice, sugar, fideos, etc.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her own effort, she was able to succeed, because at the beginning she only had a handful of products and she now has more variety. She has a great clientele.

With her recent loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, for S/. 1,500.00 (US$500.00), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy basic needs products to sell to the public, like sugar in 50kg. sacks, rice in 50kg. sacks, boxes of milk, gallons of oil, boxes of cookies, to stock up her store.

Mrs. Juana is 43 years old and lives with her children. Ever since her husband passed away she has been supporting her children and working so they lack nothing. She is a hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, vive en la Región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr: huallaga Nº 268 1er piso, y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como, leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y al esfuerzo de ella misma logró salir adelante, pues en sus inicios sólo tenía unos cuantos productos, actualmente cuenta con mas variedad. Tiene gran clientela.

Con el reciente crédito recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/1,500.00 ($500.00), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad para la venta al público, como azúcar en sacos de 50 kilos, arroz en sacos de 50 kilos cajas de leche, aceite en galones, cajas de galletas, para que su negocio esté mas surtido.

La señora Juana tiene 43 años, y vive con sus hijos, desde que falleció su esposo se hizo cargo de sus ellos y trabaja para que no les falte nada, es una mujer luchadora.

loans.use:
Buying assorted wholesale products (general store) 
(Compra de productos variados (bodega))

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Mrs. Luliana belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women). She lives in the San Martin region, the Bellavista district; her business is located in the Jr. Augusto B. Leguia 1st block. She sells spare parts for motorcycles, motorcars, bicycles, and others.

Thanks to her own effort and to the support of her husband, she was able to increase her sales. She currently carries all kinds of spare parts so that her clients are satisfied. She is also offering services going to people's homes.

With her recent loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, for S/. 2,500.00 (US$833.3), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy spare parts for motorcycles, cars, and more so that she can do well by her clients.

Mrs. Luliana is 22 years old and lives with her husband and her children. She works by consensus so that things turn out well. She demonstrates that we women can succeed in being able to offer a better future for our children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Luliana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, vive en la región san martín , provincia y distrito de Bellavista, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr:: Augusto B.Leguia 1ra. Cuadra S/N y se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos, motokars, bicicletas, y otros.

Gracias a su propio esfuerzo y al apoyo de su esposo logro incrementar sus ventas, actualmente tiene todo tipo de repuesto para que sus clientes queden satisfechos, y también está brindando brindan servicios a domicilio.

Con el reciente crédito recibido del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ($833.3), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará repuestos para motos, carros y otros para que así pueda quedar bien con sus clientes.

La señora Luliana tiene 22 años y vive con su esposo y sus hijos, trabaja en común acuerdo para que las cosas le salgan bien, demostrando así que las mujeres si podemos salir adelante, para poder brindarles un futuro mejor a nuestros hijos.

loans.use: Buying diverse spare parts. (Compra de repuestos diversos.)

loans.name: Julia Lilly

texts.es:
Eighteen years ago, Julia decided to start a business in the wholesale market of the city of Managua. She started with a capital of CS$2,000.00, fruit of her savings. Before that, she worked as a maid, but the work was hard and the pay very little. This is why she decided to save and take the risk to start her own business. Thanks to her vision of the future, Julia has been able to succeed. She is the only support of her household which if formed by her and her father.

She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years, time during which she feels that thanks to this support she has been able to grow, increasing her inventory and obtaining higher profits. Her record has 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

JULIA HACE 18 AÑOS DECIDIÓ PONER SU NEGOCIO EN EL MERCADO MAYOREO DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA. COMENZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$2,000.00 FRUTO DE SUS AHORROS. ANTERIORMENTE ELLA SE DEDICABA A TRABAJAR DE EMPLEADA DOMESTICA, SIN EMBARGO EL TRABAJO ERA MUY FUERTE Y LA PAGA POCA, RAZÓN POR LA CUAL DECIDIÓ AHORRAR Y SE ARRIESGO A PONER SU PROPIO NEGOCIO. GRACIAS A SU VISIÓN DE FUTURO JULIA HA LOGRADO SALIR ADELANTE. ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SOSTÉN DE SU HOGAR QUE ESTA CONFORMADO POR ELLA Y SU PADRE.

CON CEPRODEL LLEVA DOS AÑOS TRABAJANDO, TIEMPO EN EL QUE ELLA SIENTE QUE GRACIAS A ESTE APOYO HA LOGRADO CRECER, INCREMENTANDO SU INVENTARIO Y OBTENIENDO MAS GANANCIAS. SU RÉCORD ES DE 10 CRÉDITOS

loans.use: Buying merchandise (COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA)

loans.name: Mili

texts.es:
Mrs. Mili belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women). She lives in the San Martin region, the Bellavista district; her business is located in the Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Number 278, 1st floor. She sells edible products like rice, fideos, flour, milk, and more.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her family, she has been able to increase her business, which until now has grown, has more variety, a small store, and her clientele increases more every day.

With her recent loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, for S/.3,000.00 (US$1000.00), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy products such as oil, sodas, mineral water, and gasoline for her small store.

Mrs. Mili is 35 years old and lives with her husband, her children, and her mother. She feels very satisfied because thanks to the support of the Communal Bank, she has been able to succeed and she will not rest until she has made all her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Milí pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, su negocio está ubicado en el jr: Augusto. B. Leguia Nº 278 1er piso se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como, arroz fideos harina, leche y demás.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de su familia a logrado incrementar su negocio que a la fecha ha crecido, tiene más variedad y un estanquillo, su clientela va de aumento cada día mas.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Munela Ramos de S/ 3,000.00 ($1000.00), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos como, aceite en litros, gaseosas, agua mineral y gasolina para su estanquillo.

La señora Mili tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo, sus hijos y su mama, se siente muy satisfecha porque gracias al apoyo del Banco Comunal ha logrado salir adelante y no descansará hasta cumplir todos sus sueños.

loans.use:
Buying assorted products (general store)
(Compra de productos variados (bodega))

loans.name: Ofelia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Ofelia belongs to the Mientras Tanto Group "Mujeres Sobresalientes" (Outstanding Women). She lives in the Region San Martin, Province San Martin, Morales district. Her business is located in her home, in the Jr. Oxapampa Nº 185. She has a general store in which she sells basic needs products retail, such as rice, sugar, stew, cookies, fideos, among other things.

She has the support of her children. Thanks to this support and to the loans of Manuela Ramos, she has been able to begin and increase her business. In the beginning she only had the locale, and with the loan received for S./ 300 soles, they bought furniture (a table, shelves, and a scale) and some of the products with greater demand.

With the loan recently received from Manuela Ramos for S./ 1,000.00 ($333), which will be paid in 4 months, she bought rice, sugar (in sacks), milk, eggs, and other orders from her clients. She also sells beauty products from AVON and has come products in stock.

Mrs. Ofelia is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and children. She feels thankful for this support that came when she needed it the most, since her husband had an accident and she had to gather her strength to begin the business and be able to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ofelia pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Mujeres Sobresalientes”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio en el Jr. Oxapampa Nº 185 y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor tales como arroz, azúcar, menestras, galletas, fideos entre otros.

Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos, gracias a este apoyo y a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado iniciar e ir creciendo en este negocio, ya que al principio sólo tenía el local, con el préstamo recibido de S/. 300 soles, compraron los muebles (una mesa, andamio y balanza) y algunos productos que tienen mayor demanda.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.) el cual será pagado en 4 meses, compró, arroz, azúcar, (en sacos) leche, huevos y otros según los pedidos de su clientela, además también vende productos de belleza de la línea AVON y tiene productos en stock.

La señora Ofelia tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo e hijos, ella se siente agradecida por este apoyo que apareció cuando más lo necesitaba, ya que su esposo sufrió un accidente y ella tenía que sacar fuerzas para empezar el negocio y poder mantener su hogar.

loans.use: Buying assorted products. Buying beauty products. (Compra de productos variados.  Compra de productos de belleza.)

loans.name: Nicolaza

texts.es:
Nicolaza belongs to the Las Riojanitas ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. Her business is located in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living selling sweet and savory snacks made with bases of wheat and corn flour. She also makes "chiffles" (chips made from plantains) and "maduritos asados" (a local dish) that are distributed to dining rooms at varoius schools in the area.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles or about $268), to be repaid in 6 installments, Nicolaza will buy supplies, like wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, butter, plantains, cheese and other ingredients for making her snacks.

Nicolaza, 48, is married and has 2 children who no longer depend on her and her husband. She considers herself very dedicated and persistent in her work, organized and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nicolaza pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Riojanitas, tiene ubicado su negocio en el Mercado Central del distrito de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos dulces y salados preparados en base a harina de trigo y maíz, además de la preparación de chifles y maduritos asados para ser distribuidos en los comedores de distintos centros educativos de su distrito.
