Saat ini Kondri membutuhkan tambahan modal usaha sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.- yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli lebih banyak lagi bibit babi dan juga untuk biaya pakannya selama pemeliharaan. Dengan harapan bisa berkembang cepat dan juga bisa mendatangkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs and pigs' food

loans.name: Kimatai

texts.en:
Kimatai is one of the active clients of Microinvest. She became a client in 2003; since then, she has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and accurate person. Her business stall is located in J.Rasulov, in the Khujand region of Tajikistan. She said her place is crowded every day as it is situated in the first clothing row in a big market, and customers have a good opportunity to see her goods first.

Kimatai has 13 years of experience in trade, and she has learned the rules of market. She says that the quality of her products and polite service are the main laws of attracting new clients and holding them. She always tries to help them to choose clothes, and they stay very satisfied with her communication and quality of her goods. Kimatai has 3 children who are grown up enough to help their mother. Two of her sons have their own business and they are responsible for buying and bringing goods from the wholesale market to their mother. Her daughter often sells goods with her. Now Kimatai wants to have extra capital to purchase warm clothes for the winter season.

loans.use: Purchase of warm clothes.

loans.name: Kurvon

texts.en: Kurvon is 34 years old. She has 4 children and lives with her elderly parents. Kurvon has been engaged in trade for over 9 years. Her trade place is located in J. Rasulov, Khujand. Her business is to sell women's and children's clothes. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. During her partnership with this organization, she repaid her loans without any delay. Her business is going well, and she has a fast turnover of her goods. From Kiva, she hopes to receive a loan for purchasing winter clothes from Uzbekistan. Now the import duties are more expensive, and she really needs extra capital. Her current profit is not enough as she made big purchases for winter for her family. She purchased 4 tons of coal and food products.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: I Made Lotro

texts.id:
I Made Lotro is a gentlemen with high family dedication. His hard work is solely done for the well being of his wife and two school aged children. To fulfill his obligation, I Made Lotro opens a kiosk at his house. Although the kiosk is still small since his capital is limited, but his persistance made his business really well, and could provide enough for family needs. With a capital of Rp1,000,000 (about US$110), I Made Lotro could make profit of about Rp30,000 (about US$3.30) each day. From every profit he made, I Made Lotro also save a little to be used to expand other business of raising pigs, specifically mother pig that is done by his wife. So I Made Lotro is not by himself in obtaining family income, but also teaches his wife to take part in family well being. From Dinari's loan, I Made Lotro hopes that his kiosk business could be expanded, by adding variation to his sales, which initally consisted of light food, so that he could also sell other daily needs items.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

I Made Lotro seorang pria yang berdedikasi tinggi terhadap keluarganya. Kerja kerasnya selama ini semata-mata dilakukannya untuk mengusahakan kesejahteraan istri dan dua orang anaknya yang masih bersekolah. Untuk memenuhi kewajibannya ini I Made Lotro membuka usaha warung di rumahnya. Walaupun warungnya masih kecil karena modal yang dimilikinya terbatas tetapi keuletannya membuat usahanya ini benar-benar bermanfaat dan mendatangkan hasil yang cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan modal Rp. 1.000.000,- I Made Lotro bisa mendapat keuntungan sekitar Rp. 30.000,- per hari. Dari setiap keuntungan yang diperolehnya itu I Made Lotro juga menyisihkan sebagian kecil untuk di simpan dan kemudian dipakainya untuk mengembangkan usaha yang lain yaitu memelihara ternak babi khususnya babi penginduk yang dikelola oleh istrinya. Jadi I Made Lotro tidak hanya berusaha sendirian dalam mengelola keuangan rumah tangganya, tetapi juga mengajarkan istrinya untuk ambil bagian dalm mengusahakan kesejahteraan keluarga mereka. Dengan memperoleh pinjaman modal usaha dari DINARI I Made Lotro berharap usaha warungnya bisa dikembangkan dengan menambah variasi dagangannya yang semula hanya menjual makanan ringan saja, agar bisa menjual segala macam kebutuhan sehari-hari

loans.use:
To buy sales items for kiosk

Membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi warungnya

loans.name: Ugiljon

texts.en: Ugiljon is a young business lady who has three children and helps her husband to support her family. Her business is to sells different kind of candies and is located in J.Rasulov, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. Her current turnover is fast, and she has many constant clients who come from remote districts and purchase her goods in lots. She also received many orders for the coming New Year party. They prefer her candies because her goods are high quality and show her to be an accurate and honest partner. When she heard about the Kiva program, she decided to take part in it to expand her assortment by buying her goods in bulk.

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of chocolate, 20 boxes of fruit drops, and 30 boxes of fruit-paste sweets.

loans.name: Kumuhoy

texts.en: Kumushoy is a happy mother of 3 children. She loves them very much and tries to do all she can to see their happy faces. Her business is to sell perfumes and other cosmetic products, and she likes her activity. She says that she helps her clients to choose perfumes with great pleasure. Every day she has many customers near her stall. She has only high quality goods from different cosmetics firms such as Dove, Oriflame, Avon, and so on. At present she wants to purchase a big batch of goods as she hopes to have a profitable New Year.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and other cosmetic products to prepare presents for the New Year.

loans.name: Hanifa Abdula Babú

texts.pt:
Hanifa J. is married and mother of 3 children. She joined the credit program in June 2006 and her first loan was of 6.000mt. She works selling fish and charcoal in Corumana and in Malhapsswene. She is now in the second cycle of the program and requests a loan of 10.000mt to be repaid in 6 months. She plans on increasing her inventory of charcoal.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Hanifa J. é casada e mãe de 3 filhos. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vende peixe e carvão em Corumana e em Malhapsswene. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 10.000Mt para pagar em 6 meses. Pretende investir o empréstimo na compra e venda de carvão.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. owns a general store in the Elmina market. She has been at this market for eight years but has been in the business for over 20 years now. Her store is special because she draws many customers with the palm oil that she sells. Palm oil is red and flavorful oil that is a key ingredient in many traditional Ghanaian dishes.

With her loan, Nana Y. hopes to purchase more palm oil as well as expand her stock in onions, tin tomatoes, and groundnuts. She will use the profits to support her three children who are all in school. Two are in middle school and one is in preschool.

Nana Y. is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina. The group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer support provides the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they all work in the market.

loans.use: Nana would use her loan to increase her stock of palm oil and add vegetables (onions and tomatoes) and groundnuts.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo is not married and lives with her parents. She has been engaged in trade for over 4 years. Her business is to sell towels and tablecloths. Her stall is located in J.Rasulov in the district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She has a good turnover of her working capital, and her assets are increasing every month. She bought her goods from suppliers from China. In the future she wants to go China herself to choose a different assortment of goods. From the Kiva program, she is requesting $800US to purchase the next batch of goods. She hopes to see a profitable month of holiday trade.

loans.use: Purchase a big batch of goods.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. She is a very honest and punctual person. Her first loan was $100, and today she has $1000 in her working capital. Her business is located in the clothing market in J.Rasulov in the district of Khujand. Her business is going well, and she has a lot of customers. She has a wide assortment of goods, and her goods more competitive than others. She learns the styles of her customers while she sells and goes to purchase the goods herself so she can quickly adjust her assortment. She is requesting $525US to make her next purchase, and she hopes to have a profitable holiday month.

loans.use: Purchase of winter clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her current stock of tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar A.  is a 24-year-old married woman who breeds animals in the Bilasuvar region in the southern part of Azerbaijan, . She is an  internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She has 3 years of experience in animal breeding. Gulnar purchased a small calf, raised it and than sold for a higher price for meat production to the local bazaar traders.
The meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat every day in their homes and cafes.
Gulnar and her husband are unemployed and raising cattle is the only  source of income for their family. Gulnar has one son and one daughter. Covering family needs is getting harder and harder as the children grow up. She has applied for a 700 USD loan with a repayment term 15 month to purchase two calves and fodder. The estimated cost for one calf is 200-300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun S., 51, is a mother of six children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works making Khmer noodles and sells them to the people in her community. With this activity, she is able to earn profits of around $1.50 each day. Her husband is self-employed as a farmer growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables, making on average around $0.50/day. Two of her children are currently employed at a garment factory, while the others are unemployed or enrolled in school. Mrs. Thun S. is humbly requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase a car for one of her children to operate a taxi business. She is confident that this loan will enable her son to provide another source of income.

loans.use: To  purchase a car for one of her children to operate a taxi business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. owns a general store in the Elmina market. She has been at this market for eight years but has been in the business for over 20 years now. Her store is special because she draws many customers with the palm oil that she sells. Palm oil is a red and flavorful oil that is a key ingredient in many traditional Ghanaian dishes.

With her loan, Nana Y. hopes to purchase more palm oil as well as expand her stock of onions, tin tomatoes, and groundnuts. She will use the profits to support her three children who are all in school. Two are in middle school and one is in preschool.

Nana Y. is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina. The group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer supports provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they all work in the market.

loans.use: With the loan, Nana would buy more stock of the red palm oil she sells and add vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Madine

texts.en: Madine A.  is a 47-year old married woman who lives with her husband and six children in the Bilasuvar region, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Madine is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. In her large garden she raises vegetables such as aubergine (eggplant), tomatoes, and different types of fruit like apples, peaches and plums. She and her husband are unemployed and raising vegetables and fruits is the only source to feed the family. All members of the family help Madine to plant, look after and sell in the local bazaar. Every day Madine wakes up early in the morning to prepare her kids to go to the school and to water her garden. The oldest son left school as soon as he finished 9th grade to help his parents. During the autumn selling vegetables and fruits bring Madine and her family income for the rest seasons, but it is very hard to cover all the needs of so big a family . To improve their life conditions Madine has decided to expand her business and start planting potatoes, cucumbers and peppers. These vegetables are in very high demand in Azerbaijan, especially in summer when many people cook traditional meals using pepper, tomatoes and potatoes very often. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of 700USD with a repayment term of 15 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rachel Julio Dos San

texts.pt:
Rachel is married and mother of 8 children. She lives in the city of Maxixe, in the province of Inhambe. Rachel joined the credit program this years and this is her first loan request. Rachel wants to use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for the chicken she raises and sells. Her sons are studying except for the youngest that is too little to attend school. She wants to help her husband supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rachel é casada e é mãe de 8 filhos. Ela vive na Cidade de Maxixe, na provincia de Inhambane. Rachel entrou para o programa ainda neste ano. O valor que ela vai tomar é o 1º empréstimo. Rachel para além de fazer negocio ou negociante, ela é trabalhadora. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de ração e vacina dos seus fragos antes da venda. Os filhos da Rachel estão a estudar a excepção dos mais novos que ainda não tem idade. Ela pretende ajudar o seu marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: To buy foor and vaccines for chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more wood for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Bernardo A. is 47 years old, he is married and father of 8 children. He lives in Corumana in the district of Moamba in Maputo. He has a stand where he sells soft drinks and some groceries. He also fishes in Corumana. He joined the credit program in June 2007 and borrowed 6.000mt. He is requesting a loan of 15.000mt to be repaid in 6 months to increase his inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Qarash

texts.en: A. Qarash is 26-yers-old young man who runs his business consisting of raising sheep. Qarash lives with his wife and two sons in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. He is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He started his business in 2002 and for the first loan he borrowed from his friends he purchase two baby sheep. As they raised he paid back the debts and to the rest of money he purchased more animals.  Currently Qarash has a herd of ten sheep. The mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Most of traditional meals consist of mutton. As Qarash children grow up and prices are getting higher every year, the only one income is not enough to feed enough and cover family needs in the normal level. Nevember and December are high season months for weddings in Azerbaijan and meat at this are in high demand. Qarash decided to expand his business and increase number of sheep to 10.   The estimated cost for one sheep is 60 USD the reast 200 USD he will spend on fodder. For this purpose he applied for 800 USD with repayment term 15 month.

loans.use: Going to purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ming

texts.en: Mrs. Ming S. L., 34, is the mother of two school-aged children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household income, she works selling a variety of vegetables at a market, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together, they can earn around $4/day of profits. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a grinding mill so that they can provide this service to either the crop-growers or villagers whenever they need grinding. They believe this activity will enable them to generate additional profits for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill so that they provide this service to either the crop-growers or villagers whenever they need grinding.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu A. is a 41-year-old married woman who runs her small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Imishli region. Arzu lives with her husband and two sons in a small house. She breeds animals and sells them for meat to the local bazaar traders. She has thirteen years of experience in this field.

This business has always brought her a good income, but prices for everything rise every year. To keep two sons is getting harder and harder. Her husband got ill three years ago and is a disabled person. Arzu must cover all of the family's needs. Her sons are high school students, and Arzu's dream is to give them a good education. Arzu works from early morning to late at night. She decided to apply for a 700 USD loan with a repayment term of 15 months to expand her business and increase her income. With the loan, she is going to purchase two calves for 300 USD each and fodder for 100 USD.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru:
Kurbonali S. is 51 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 8 children. Kurbonali spent his whole life working as a driver at a collective farm, but as he is getting old he is now raising livestock for sale, which provides him with a source of income. He has almost 15 years of experience in this area. This loan will be used to purchase 3 large animals and 2 small animals and their feed.

Kurbonali plans to sell the smaller animals monthly and the large animals every 40-45 days. He will use a portion of the revenues to purchase new livestock and part of the revenues to pay back the loan, the rest will be used for family expenses as Kurbonali’s family is large and not everyone is earning money. He sells the livestock at the local market and it is then used to make meat and dairy products that are sold to local residents. Kurbonali plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сохибов Курбонали, возраст – 51 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Курбонали всю свою жизнь работал водителем в колхозе, но так как уже возраст не позволяет он занимается разведением крупного и мелкого рогатого скота и дальнейшей его продажей, что и является для него источником дохода. Он имеет почти 15-и лет опыт в разведение скота. Кредит, который он хочет получить будет направлен им на приобретение 3-х голов крупного рогатого скота и 2 голов мелкого рогатого скота, а также питания для них. Мелкий рогатый скот он планирует продавать ежемесячно, а крупный скот он будет продавать через каждые 40-45 дней после его откормки. Часть вырученных денег он будет направлять на приобретение молодняка, часть на погашение кредита, а оставшуюся часть будет использовать на семейно-бытовые расходы, так как семья у него большая и не все приносят деньги в дом. Скот он продаёт на местном рынке, который в дальнейшем используется на производство мясо-молочной продукции и дальнейшей её реализации жителям близлежащих районов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and Sale of Livestock

loans.name: Gulshemen

texts.en:
Gulshemen A. is a 52-year-old widow who keeps her sheep herd in the southern region of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar region. She is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She has fifteen years of experience in sheep breeding. Gulshemen lost her husband many years ago and raised her son alone. Now her son is a second year high school student, and her sheep herd is the only  source to cover her son's needs.
Gulshemen sells mutton to the local bazaar traders and it brings her good income. The mutton is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in their everyday cuisine. October-December are the weeding season months in Azerbaijan. During this time price for mutton rises and demand is getting very high. That’s why Gulshemen decided that it is her chance to improve her life conditions. She has applied for  800 USD with a repayment term of15 months. She is going to purchase ten sheep each for 60 USD and fodder for 200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Ashurmahmad

texts.ru:
Ashurmahmad E. is 57 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. Ashurmahmad has almost 20 years of experience in livestock raising which he learned from his father, who still helps him in these difficult times to support his family. Ashurmahmad needs to increase his working capital and will use the loan to purchase livestock to raise.

Ashurmahmad’s clients produce meat and dairy products and sometimes he does not even have to go to the market as his clients come to his house to purchase the animals. They supply their product to local markets. Ashurmahmad will pay the loan back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Эмомов Ашурмахмад, возраст – 57 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Ашурмахмад имеет почти 20 летний опыт в разведение крупного и мелкого рогатого скота, который он ещё перенял у своего отца и который помогает ему сегодня в непростое время содержать свою семью. Кредит клиент хочет использовать на приобретеение крупного и мелкого рогатого скота для откорма и перепродажи. У него имется слишком маленькая сумма оборотных средств, что не даёт ему возможность закупить сразу большое количество скота и потом постепенно продавать его. Получив кредит у него появится возможность это сделать. Его поcтоянные клиентами являются люди, которые занимаются производством мясо-молочных изделий и порой он не выгоняет скот на рынок, так как они приходят и покупают его прямо из дома Ашурмахмада. В дальнейшем они поставляют свою продукцию на рынки районов и близлежащих городов Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Livestock

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en: Solmaz A.  is a 51 yearold woman who grows vegetables in her garden in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in the Bilasuvar region. Solmaz is an  internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She lives with her husband, four sons and three daughters. Solmaz plants onions and her husband sells them  in the local bazaar. Solmaz has eleven years of experience in this field. As Solmaz and her husband are unemployed, selling onions is the only  source of income to cover their family needs. The onion in very high demand in Azerbaijan. It is used in every single meal. Solmaz has free land and she is going to expand her business and start planting potatoes. To start getting closer to her goal she has applied for a 600 USD  loan with a repayment term 15 month.

loans.use: To expand her planting business

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal B.  is a 37-year-old farmer who runs his small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar region. Kamal is an internally displaced person from occupied the Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Kamal lives with his wife and three sons. The oldest son is in the eighth grade. He is very proud to be the best students in his school. 
Kamal has eleven years of experience in cattle breeding. Currently he has one calf and one milker cow. He sells yogurt, milk and calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders and also sells dairy products to the neighbors. The dairy products and meat are in very high demand in Azerbaijan, and Kamal always had very good income, but the last two years covering family needs is getting harder. Sometimes income from selling dairy and meat is just not enough for normal nourishment. The children are growing up and their needs have increased also. Kamal has applied for 600 USD to purchase ten sheep and start sheep breeding. The estimated cost for one sheep is 60 USD with a repayment term of 15 months.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem V., 52, is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To help meet the financial needs of her family, she runs a stand at home selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average about $3/day in revenue. Moreover, two of her children are currently employed at a nearby garment factory, earning collectively around $160/month. Mrs. Sem V. hopes this loan will help her expand her inventory by adding more products to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to fulfill her clients' demands.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sem Voeun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
Shakhla B. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her two daughters in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. Shakhla is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.
She started her business in 2001 when hunger knocked on her door. 
In every Azerbaijani family you can find mattresses made of fleece. People find it healthy but it takes much time to sew a mattress of fleece. There are people who provide this service in every region and town. But before sewing the fleece, it needs to be washed three times, dried and fluff for a week. Shahkla has been providing  this particular service. She washes, dries and fluffs fleece. She has many orders every day and it brings her about six dollars for each order. When she started providing this service it wasn’t in very high demand but now orders increase every day and the number of people who provide this service has increased also. Shakhla took training in sewing and now she is qualified. She has expanded her activity and currently she also accepts orders to sew the mattresses. She does everything manually. It takes her a long time to finish one order, and she looses  money while orders are increase but time is limited. Shakhla has applied for 400 USD with a repayment term of 15 months  to purchase a sewing machine, quality needles and threads.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine,  quality needles and threads

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer F.  is a 64-year-old trader who lives and works in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imishli region. Azer is  married and has three children. He opened his small store on money he was saving for a long time. He sells cigarettes, tea, butter, various sorts of candies, shampoos, tooth paste and washing powders.  He has only one year of experience in trading but he already has a large numbers of customers. Sometimes he sells everything he has and has to close his store because it is quite empty. The income he has from selling is enough to cover family needs, but not enough to expand the number of products and to improve store conditions.  For this purpose Azer applied for 700 USD with repayment term 15 month to purchase extra goods and improve the conditions of his store.

loans.use: To expand the number of production and improve store conditions

loans.name: Naiba

texts.en: Naiba K. is a 65-year-old married woman who lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Imishli region. Naiba raises and sells cattle. She has fifteen years of experience in animal breeding. Local bazaar traders know Naiba very well and always come to purchase cattle.  Meat is in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people eat fresh meat at homes and in cafes.  As the result there is much competition in this business. Naiba works very hard to cover family needs. She has four children, two sons and two daughters. She is going to expand her business and purchase one cow. She is going to sell dairy products. It will improve her life conditions and bring her meaningful income.  Naiba has applied for 800 USD with a repayment term of 15 months. The estimated cost for one cow is 700-800 USD.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy  cow

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya Khamishova is a 33-year-old married woman who has her own sheep business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. She is an internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Ulviyya has seven years of experience in animal breeding. She sells mutton to the local bazaar traders. Mutton is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. Currently Ulviyya has a sheep herd consisting of five sheep. She and her husband are unemployed and selling mutton is the only source of income to cover family needs. Her one teenage son has learned how to help in keeping animals and also helps his parents in other ways. As their one son grows up and prices are getting higher Ulviyya has decided to expand her business and has applied for 800 USD with repayment term 15 month to purchase ten sheep and fodder. The estimated cost for one sheep is 60 USD and for two seasons fodder is 200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase ten sheep and fodder

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima H.  is 55-year-old married woman who owns her small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar region. She an is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Fatima started her business in 1994. She purchased her first calf, raised it and sold for a higher price. Fatima used to have a milking cow also and she sold dairy products such as milk and yoghurt to the local people  But the cow become ill and passed away. Recently Fatima purchased one calf, which soon will grow up to be a milking cow. 
Fatima has large family, two sons and one daughter. The level of their life is hard to call even normal. They are close to misery. Fatima is trying to find ways to change the situation and one decision was apply for a loan and expand her business. She applied for 800 USD with repayment term of 15 months to purchase three calves; two baby calves each for 250 USD and one middle size calf for 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en: Mikayil M. is a 46-year-old farmer. He lives with his wife and one daughter in the southern part of Azerbaijan, in Bilasuvar region. Mikayil is an internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He keeps poultry and sells it to the local bazaar traders and local people. His daughter is ten years old and she likes to help her father with poultry. Selling poultry is only  financial source in Mikayil`s family and nowadays, when prices are so high, it is not enough for a normal life. Mikayil is going to expand his business and purchase one calf, five sheep and fodder for winter. He applied to Aqroinvest CU for 700 USD with a repayment term of 15 months. The estimated cost for one calf is 300 USD, for sheep are 60 USD and 100 USD for fodder.

loans.use: Going to purchase one calf, five sheep and fodder

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen B. from the small city of Arifwala, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight. My husband and I sell cows and goats. I stay at home and take care of these animals while my husband sells them in a nearby livestock market. Last year, we acquired a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institution) and bought a few goats for our business. The profits increased substantially, and we constructed a house of our own. We now wish to expand our business further, so we require another loan. With this loan, we plan to buy a few additional goats for our business.

loans.use: Buy goats for the business.

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru:
Gulboy A. is 52 years old, he has a higher education and is an agricultural economist, he is married and has 3 children. Gulboy owns a farm where he grows a variety of products: wheat, corn, peas, etc. He is the director. At the start of the planting season he plans to plant 11 acres of wheat. He already has the seeds. He plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and petrol to work the land, as they are currently much cheaper then they will be in high season.

Gulboy will sell his harvest to local residents at a lower price then is available in the market. The local residents will use the wheat to make flour at the mills and then use it to bake bread for personal use. This will help them to save money. Gulboy plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Акрамов Гулбой, возраст – 52 года, образование высшее, по специальности – экономист в области сельского хозяйства, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Гулбой имеет собственное дехканско-фермерское хозяйство, которое занимается в основном посевом и выращиванием сельхозкультур разных видов таких как: пшеница, кукуруза, горох и др. Он занимает должность директора. В связи с началом посевного он планирует посеять на 11 га земли пшеницу. Семена пшеницы у него имеются. На полученный кредит Гулбой хочет приобрести удобрения и горюче-смазочные материалы для обработки земли, так как в настоящее время цена на них намного ниже, чем будет в сезон. Полученный урожай он будет продавать местным жителям по более низкой цене чем на базаре, из первых рук. Большее население данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельницах получают муку, из которой в дальнейшем изготовляют хлеб для личного пользования. Себистоимость муки производимой таким образом ниже цены на мешок привозной муки, что положительно отражается на семейном бюджете в сельской местности. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizier and petrol

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad M.  is a 47-year-old farmer who owns his small business in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imishli region. He lives with his four children and wife. 
Mahammad has fifteen years of experience in animal breeding. Currently Mahammad has two calves, which he will sell soon . He sells calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders and to the Baku (the capital city), traders. He is the one person who works in their family. His wife look safter children and the  kids are too small to help Mahammad. 
Life in small region is getting harder and there is much competition in this business. Mahammad works very hard to cover the family needs, but to keep 5 members of a family  in good condition, owning two calves is not enough. Also October-December are the wedding months in Azerbaijan and Mahammad wishes to have more cattle than he has now. And this wish is possible. That’s why he has applied for 900 USD with a repayment term 15 month to purchase three additional calves. The estimated cost for one calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase three calves

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
H. Nargiz is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan republic. She is 35 years old. She is single but she lives with her parents. Her parents are elderly. She is the only breadwinner of her family. She began her business with $200 in 1995. She keeps busy with retail trade. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs.

Nargiz needs $500 to expand her business. She wants to increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods and to buy additional sorts of goods.

loans.name: Shakhsuvar

texts.en: Shakhsuvar Q.  is a 65-year-old farmer who raises vegetables in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Bilasuvar.  He is internally displaced person from occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. He is married and has six children; three sons and three daughters. He started raising vegetables in 1992. Every year he sells his crop in the local bazaar and to the local people. His garden is very big but during these fourteen years the land needed treatment and got drained. And every year it is getting harder to raise a good quality crop. Shakhsuvar is going to improve his land and start raising such vegetables as potatoes, tomatoes,  peppers and onions. For this purpose Shakshsuvar has  applied for 800 USD with a repayment term of 15 months. He will spend this money to purchase fertilizer and to  buy seeds for the vegetable he wants to grow.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Minaver

texts.en: Minaver S. is 27-year-old single woman who lives in the southern region Imishli with her parents. She has six years of experience in animal breeding. Minaver covers all the family's needs. Her parents are very old and ill people. Half of the money she earns she spends on medicine and the rest for food. Minaver's father got ill when she was fifteen and she left school as soon as she finished ninth grade. She didn’t get a university degree and now she is unemployed. Keeping cattle is the only  financial source in her family. This is a very hard time for her and her family. She has applied for 800 USD with repayment term of 15 months. With this amount she is going to purchase one milking cow. Minaver is certain that a milking cow will bring her good income; she would be able to sell milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders and to the neighbors.  Owning the cow would allow her family to always have cheese, butter and yoghurt.

loans.use: To purchase one milking cow

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
S. Latifa is a 48-year-old married woman who runs her business in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar region. Latifa is an internally displaced person from the occupied Jabrail region who fled to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. She has ten years of experience in raising livestock. She sells calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders. This animal is in high demand all across Azerbaijan.

Latifa has three sons, two of whom are university students, and the youngest is a high school student. Her youngest son and husband help her a lot in raising and keeping the livestock. She would like to expand her business and purchase one milk cow. She believes that it will help her family improve their living conditions to always eat fresh cheese and butter and drink milk and yoghurt. She applied for 700 USD with a repayment term of 15 months.

loans.use: To purchase one milk cow.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
A. Tehran is 34 years old. He is from Azerbaijan in the Armenian conflict territory of the Fizuli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now he lives in Sumgayit city with his family. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He works in a café in the central market. He began his business 5 years ago.

He wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment for his cafe. He had already gathered some money for making repairs, but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money.

Tehran would like to receive a $500 loan in order to repair his café and to buy necessary tools and equipment. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes to expand his business eventually and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Wants to carry out repair work and to buy necessary tools and equipment.

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en: Shirkhan Q. is a 41 yearold businessman  who owns a small farm in the southern part of Azerbaijan in the Bilasuvar region. He sells dairy products to the local people and bazaar traders.He isan internally dislocated person who fled to Bilasuvar from Nagorny Karabakh during the  Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993. Shirkhan is married and has four children. He started his business in 2002 when he purchased is first cow and  a calf.  Animal breeding and his dairy business brought him good income, however last two years the prices for products increased two fold and life in villages is getting harder every  year.  He has a big family and growing children. Their needs increase every year also. Expenses in his family are great.  One way of solving the problem and normalizing the  financial side of their life is to expand the business. So Shirkhan has applied for 1200 USD to purchase 4 additional calves and fodder for winter. The estimated cost for calf is 300 USD.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has a business selling vinyl windows from a little office near the bus station in Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. There is a huge demand for these quality insulated windows in Novomoskovsk and throughout Ukraine. Aside from being used in new construction, many people are remodeling their apartments and homes with new windows which are much better at keeping the cold out and the heat in. Alexander has been in this business for about two years. His business is doing well and he has been able to help many excited customers replace their old wooden windows with new efficient ones.

Alexander would like to continue working hard to improve his business and support his family. He has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase a new computer that will help him work more efficiently and continue offering professional service.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two children – an 11-year-old daughter (she's in the picture with her Mom) and a 3-year-old son. She and her family live in Berdyansk, Ukraine. Alla owns a business selling men’s and women’s outer wear in the local Kamayevskyi market. Her business is well-known in the market for relatively low prices, the favorable locations of her vending kiosks, and her personal integrity. Presently, Alla has $1000 in inventory and about $1400 of turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is about $700.

Additional financial assistance will help Alla purchase more inventory at reasonable wholesale prices, sell at retail prices, and earn a profit. Generated income will be invested in further expansion of her small venture as well as in improvement of her living standards. One of Alla’s plans for the future is to open one more vending facility. This client can be characterized as a person who always achieves her set goals. We believe Alla’s personal strengths and the sustainability of her business will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase inventory for sale

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a nine-year-old son. She lives in the city of Zaporozhye and sells cosmetics in one of the local markets. Irina has been in the market for a long time. She has a rich experience working in the sphere of market trade. She owns a big vending stall and has a nice arrangement of inventory which catches the eye of every woman passing by her kiosk.

Irina’s business has grown a lot in the past six years. Today she has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is usually about $500. New items for sale have added to the success of her business. Irina would like to get a loan of $600 to increase her assortment of hair styling and manicure accessories before the big Christmas shopping season. Her responsible attitude and good credit history give us confidence that Irina will quickly repay this current loan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is divorced and lives with her son in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Mariya runs a clothing sales business in the Alexandrovskyi market selling men’s and women’s outer wear and footwear. Mariya has been in the shoe sale business for a while. She has an individual approach for each of her customers and has a fixed discount system too. Moreover, Mariya has a unique ability to choose the perfect new shoe models that always sells well because they are trendy.

Currently, Mariya has about $1800 in inventory and her net monthly profit is about $400. Mariya would like to get a loan of $600 to purchase new models of winter boots and shoes. This winter in Ukraine is expected to be cold and windy which is why Mariya is hoping to have good sales and profits as a result. We know this client is a very enterprising and determined lady which characterizes her as being capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with a 3-year-old daughter. They live in Berdyansk where Nataliya works in the big “Privoz” market. Nataliya owns two stores where she manufactures and sells women’s clothing – skirts, specifically. All her clothing items are characterized by exclusive quality fabric, original design, affordable prices, and honest customer service. At the moment, Nataliya has about $700 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1200. Her monthly net profit is about $500.

Nataliya is requesting a loan of $500 to modernize her facility with some necessary equipment. She believes quality equipment will improve the financial indicators of her business, allowing her to increase the living standards of her family and give her a chance to invest a portion of her profit into the remodeling of her apartment. Nataliya is a strong character, sincere and honest with her clients. We believe her zeal and good customer service will help her to succeed and generate additional income.

loans.use: To remodel her vending facility and increase assorted goods

loans.name: Crimilda Alberto

texts.pt:
Crimilda is single and mother of 3. She lives with her children. Crimilda joined the credit program this year, and this is the first loan she requested. She has a small stand in the local market. Crimilda is working to ensure her children are able to go to school when they reach the appropriate age. Crimilda dreams of building a home and is working hard to achieve that. She also wants to make her children proud.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Crimilda e solteira e mae de dois filhos. Ela vive apenas com os seus filhos. Ela nao tem marido. Ela entou para ao programa de credito este ano. este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar. Ela faz as suas vendas no mercado. Os filhos de Crimilda ainda nao vao a escola porque ainda nao tem idade. mas garante que logo que tiverem idade ela os matriculara. Um dos sonhos que Crimilda tem e a de construir uma casinha com material convencional. Assim ela promete trabalhar muito para conseguir isso. Ela quer que os seus filhos tenham orgulho dela.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchenware for sale

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two kids – a 10-year-old daughter and a 3-year-old son. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Oleg rents a bus and offers transportation services. His business is the only source of income for the family. Oleg’s usual itinerary is the Ivano-Frankivsk – Galych route. He usually has many passengers as there are no other bus drivers who take this route. Oleg has been in this business for 7 years. Currently, his daily profit is about $60.

Oleg’s bus needs maintenance. At the moment its running gear has to be fixed. That is why Oleg is requesting a loan of $800 to fix the problem. One of his long-term plans is to buy the bus and continue to be self-employed. Oleg is hoping to repay this loan in six months.

loans.use: To repair running gear of the bus

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is a hard-working entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk, Ukraine. He has operated his own car repair business for the past fifteen years. Vladimir has extensive experience in this field and his skills are very much in demand. Car ownership is increasing rapidly in Ukraine which means more business for repair technicians like Vladimir. Vladimir works hard to earn a good income and support his family. He and his wife Luda have two sons and two daughters. In a typical month, Vladimir earns about $1200 from his business.

Vladimir has requested a short term loan of $1000 to buy some tools that he needs for his business. Vladimir has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

loans.use: Purchase tools

loans.name: Kokou Bobo

texts.fr:
Mr G. Kokou Bobo is a young man of 25 years old, living in the village of Momé-Hounkpati. Very committed, he launched himself in business at an early age and today runs his own general foodstore. The revenue he gets from his business allow him to meet the needs of his family. However, he is lacking business capital and at times must resort to moneylenders or loansharks. To escape from the oppression, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to revitalize his shop and satisfy the needs of his clientele.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Kokou Bobo est un jeune de 25 ans résidant dans le village de Momé-Hounkpati. Très dévoué, il s’est très tôt lancé dans le commerce et aujourd’hui il gère sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale. Les revenus tirés lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Cependant, les fonds de commerce lui manquent et il est obligé de faire parfois recours aux usuriers. Pour sortir de ce joug, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ravitailler sa boutique et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Stocking of store

loans.name: Akessa

texts.fr:
At 28 years of age, Miss P. Akessa is a seamstress in training. She practices her trade at the house, because her means don't permit her to open a shop. She doesn't have enough clients and her revenue doesn't cover her needs. She is very dynamic, stylish and conscious of her future. She wants to launch herself into a business selling jewellery. With the approaching holiday at the end of the year, she wants to go and buy the latest trends in jewellery in Ghana, but her savings are very meager. To do this, she is asking for a loan of $400. This will increase her revenues and allow her a financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 28 ans, Mlle P. Akessa, est couturière de formation. Elle exerce son métier à la maison car les moyens ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir un atelier. Elle n’a pas de clientèle et les revenus de son activité n’arrivent pas à subvenir ses besoins. Très dynamique et soucieuse de son avenir, elle veut se lancer dans le commerce des bijoux mais de moyens non plus. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle veut aller acheter des nouveautés de bijoux au Ghana mais ses économies sont très maigres. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui donnera une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying and selling of jewellery

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Cacilda is a worker at the Water Supply Company in the City of Maxixe in the province of Inhambane. She's a single mother, and has 2 children. She joined the loan program in 2006. This loan that she will take is her fourth. She has used the loan money for the purchase of furniture for her residence. Cacilda's children are studying in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Cacilda e trabalhadora da Empresa de Abastecimento de Agua na Cidade da Maxixe na provincia de Inhambane. Ela e mae solteira, e tem 2 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o quarto. Ela tem usado o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de mobiliario para a sua residencia. os filhos de Cacilda estao a estudar no ensino basico.

loans.use: Cacilda wants to use the money to purchase furnishings for her home

loans.name: Dodji

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dodji H., 35 years old, is married and the mother of three (03) children. For the last 8 years she has specialized herself in cereal storage. This activity is paying off and the profit she is making allows her to contribute to the household expenses. It also must be said that this income is, for the most part, used up by the household. To increase and secure that income, she would like to stock up bigger quantities. To do this she is requesting a loan of $250.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame Dodji H. est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Depuis 8 ans elle s’est spécialisée dans le stockage de céréales. C’est une activité qui lui est rentable et le profit qu’elle tire lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Il faut dire aussi ce revenu est en grande partie consommé par le ménage. Pour améliorer et sécuriser ce revenu, elle veut faire des stocks beaucoup plus importants. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $250.

loans.use: Stocking up and sale of cereals

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dovi A., 44 years old is married and the mother of three (03) children. She is a children clothes retailer. It is a very flourishing business but her means are too limited to satisfy the demand on the market. The big selling season is approaching with the year end holidays. She is requesting a financial help of $300 to stock up accordingly and to avoid running out of stock which would have an effect on her income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame Dovi A. est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’habits d’enfants. C’est un commerce très florissant mais ses moyens sont très restreints pour satisfaire la demande sur le marché. La grande saison de vente approche avec les fêtes de fin d’année. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 pour s’approvisionner en conséquence afin d’éviter toute rupture de stock qui pourrait agir sur ses revenus.

loans.use: Stocking up on children clothing

loans.name: Amina Aniva Paulino

texts.pt:
Amina is divorced. Her husband abandoned her and went to live with another woman. Amina has 2 children. She lives with her children in the city of Inhambane, capital of the Province with the same name. She is joining the loan program for the first time. With the money, in addition to purchasing goats, she also wants to pay for their transportation from Inhassoro to Inhambane, since Inhassoro is about 100 km from Inhambane. Amina's children are studying. With the earnings, she wants to pay for her home expenses and her children's, but in the future she plans to build a home for herself and her children.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Amina e divorciada. O marido abandonou-a e foi viver com outra mulher. Amina tem 2 filhos. Ela vive com os seus filhos na cidade de Inhambane, capital da Provincia do mesmo nome. Ela esta entrando ela primeira vez no programa de credito. Com o dinheiro para alem de comprar cabritos quer tambem pagar o transporte dos cabritos de Inhassoro para Inhambane, pois que Inhassoro dista cerca de 100 Km de Inhambane. Os filhos de Amina estao a estudar. Com os rendimentos ela quer pagar as despesas da casa e dos filhos. mas no futuro pensa em construir uma casa para ela e para os seus filhos.

loans.use: Amina wants to use the loan money to purchase more goats in Inhassoro for sale

loans.name: Nonoussi

texts.fr:
Born in 1962 in Vo-Koutimé, Mrs. Nonoussi A. is married and the mother of seven (07) children, she lives in the village of Avégloédjigan. Very early on she embarked on the second-hand clothing business that she has been practicing for almost 30 years. She manages with her inadequate means and contributes to the expenses of the household with the little income she draws. To reinforce her business and increase her income, she is requesting a loan of $ 250. This will allow her to buy clothing of different styles and fulfill her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1962 à Vo-Koutimé, Madame A. Nonoussi est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants et vit dans le village d’Avégloédjigan. Elle s’est très tôt lancée dans le commerce de friperie qu’elle pratique depuis bientôt 30 ans. Elle se débrouille avec ses maigres moyens et arrive à participer à la gestion de son ménage avec le peu de revenu qu’elle en tire. Pour renforcer cette activité et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit de $250. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter plus d’habit de tout genre et satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of bale of used clothing

loans.name: Latifa

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Lomé, Mrs. Latifa A. is married and the mother of two (02) children. She owns a grocery store that is successful. With her income she manages to contribute to the family’s needs. Very ambitious, she would like to have a second store in another neighborhood. She is requesting a loan of $600 to stock up the shop,particularly for this year-end period when sales increase.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1967 à Lomé, Madame Latifa A. est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle détient une boutique d’alimentation générale qui lui réussit bien. Avec ses revenus, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges de sa famille. Très ambitieuse, elle veut avoir une seconde boutique dans un autre quartier mais. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour approvisionner sa boutique surtout en ses périodes de fin d’année où la vente augmente.

loans.use: Supplying a grocery store

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Mrs. Véronique Z. was born in 1969 in Afagnan and lives with her husband in the village of Ahonlogoé. She is a hairdesser and has had her salon for almost 25 years. Very ambitious, she added the sale of extensions and beauty products to her business. Because of her insufficient means she cannot fulfill her customers’ needs. She is requesting a loan of $150 to stock up on extensions and cosmetic products.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Z. Véronique est née en 1969 à Afagnan et vit actuellement avec son mari dans le village d’Ahonlogoé. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et elle a son atelier depuis bientôt 25 ans. Très ambitieuse, elle a ajouté à son activité la vente des mèches et de produits de beauté. Devant ses maigres moyens, elle n’arrive plus à satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $150 pour s’approvisionner en quantité de mèche et de produits cosmétique.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cosmetic products and extensions

loans.name: Dodzi Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Dodzi Kokou A. is 29 years old and still single. After completing a training in cooking and baked goods, he opened his own restaurant and cafeteria. A master of his work he has a good number of customers but his restaurant is becoming too small and he is running the risk of loosing his customers. Feeling worried about this problem, he is requesting a loan of $500 to rent a bigger space and fit it out. This will allow him to develop customer loyalty and increase the number of his customers. This will increase his income in order to be fully responsible for himself.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 29 ans, Monsieur Dodzi Kokou A. reste toujours célibataire. Après une formation en cuisine et pâtisserie, il a ouvert son propre restaurant cafétéria. Maîtrisant bien son métier, il a bon nombre de clientèle mais son restaurant devient de plus en plus restreint et il risque de perdre sa clientèle. Très soucieux de ce problème, il sollicite un crédit de $500 pour louer un local plus spacieux et bien l’aménager. Ceci lui permettra de fidéliser sa clientèle et d’en avoir d’autres. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus en vue de bien se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Opening of a restaurant and cafeteria

loans.name: Kokoudavi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokoudavi K. was born in 1981 in Ahonlogoé and he still lives in the same village. He is married and the father of three (03) children. He is a farmer and grows corn, manioc and sweet potatoes. The selling of his produces make up his principal income. This income, however, is not sufficient to provide for his family’s needs and to afford the schooling fees for his children. He is requesting a loan of $200 to buy fertilizers in order to improve his yield and increase his income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1981 à Ahonlogoé, Monsieur K. Kokoudavi réside actuellement dans ledit village. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il est agriculteur de profession et cultive du maïs, du manioc et des patates douces. La vente de ses produits constitue sa principale source de revenu. Mais ce revenu est insuffisant pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Ainsi il sollicite un crédit de $200 qui lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais afin d’améliorer son rendement et augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Bertin

texts.fr:
Mr. Bertin K. is a 35 years old very energetic cabinetmaker. Married and the father of two (02) children, he is a cabinetmaker and builds furniture that he exhibits. He also travels a lot in search of markets and building sites, which he always carries through successfully. Today, he is short of wood planks; he has furniture orders that he cannot fulfill. He is requesting a loan of $900 to buy wood planks and to fulfill the demand in furniture and to maintain his customer base. The accomplishment of this project will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur K. Bertin est un menuisier très dynamique de 35 ans. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, il est menuisier et fabrique des meubles qu’il expose. Il se déplace également beaucoup pour rechercher des marchés et chantiers qu’il réalise avec beaucoup de succès. Aujourd’hui, en pénurie de planches, il a des commandes de meubles qu’il n’a pas encore satisfait. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $900 pour acheter des planches afin de satisfaire la demande en meubles et maintenir sa clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of wood planks for furniture making and selling.

loans.name: Ahoéfa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ahoéfa K. was born on February 11, 1959 in Lomé, she is married and the mother of four (04) childen. She struggles enormously to help her husband, also a retailer, to provide for the needs of the family. Mrs. K.’s specialty is the sale of baskets, an activity she has been practicing for the past 18 years. Well known in her town, where the market gardeners have the lion’ s share, she buys baskets that she sells back to them. The demand often exceeds the offer and to satisfy the needs of her customers she is requesting a loan of $1000. She will go from village to village to buy baskets at a lesser cost, will stock them and will sale them back for a profit. The fulfillment of this project will allow her to have a financial autonomy and to assert herself in the community.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. Ahoéfa est née le 11 février 1959 à Lomé, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle se débat énormément pour aider son mari également revendeur à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. La spécialité de Madame K. est la vente de panier, activité qu’elle exerce il y a 18 ans. Reconnu dans sa localité où les maraîchers se taillent la part du lion, elle achète des paniers qu’elle leur revend. Les demandes dépassent souvent l’offre et c’est pour satisfaire tous les besoins de sa clientèle qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin d’aller de villages en villages acheter moins cher les paniers, les stocker et les revendre plus cher. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière et de s’affirmer dans la société.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of baskets

loans.name: Houndjénouko

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou in the county of Vo, Mrs. Houndjénouko K. is 45 years old, married and the mother of five (05) children. Her principal occupation is agriculture, she is one of the big farmers in her town. This activity is very profitable and provides just the minimum to sustain her family needs. But to do better, that is to increase her yield, she would like to buy fertilizers. Because she lacks the financial means, she is requesting a loan of $250. Once her goal is reached, the profit she will gain will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family, a source of blossoming for her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Tékponou dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame K. Houndjénouko âgée de 45 ans est mariée et est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Ayant comme activité principale l’agriculture, elle est l’une des grandes agricultrices de sa localité. Cette activité très rentable lui procure le minimum possible pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais pour mieux faire c'est-à-dire améliorer son rendement, elle voudrait acheter des engrais. Par manque de moyens financiers, elle vient solliciter un crédit $250. Ce but atteint lui permettra d’améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille par le profit qu’elle en tirera, source d’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Dianora Alberto

texts.pt:
Dianora is married and the mother of 3 children. Dianora's husband works for himself as a carpenter. Dianora wants to start a business selling chickens. That's why she joined the loan program. She lives in Maxixe with her family. She wants to help her husband with household expenses. Dianora is an employee at a State Institution. Her children are studying , one at a secondary school and the two younger ones at elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Dianora e casada e mae de 3 filhos. O marido de Dianora trabalha por conta propria. Ele e carpinteiro. Dianora quer iniciar o negocio da venda de frangos. Por isso ela entrou para o programa de credito. Ela vive na Maxixe com sua familia. Ela quer ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa. Dianora e funcionaria. Ela trabalha numa Instituicao Estatal. Os filhos de Dianora estao a estudar estando um no ensino secundario e os dois mais novos no ensino basico.

loans.use: Dianora wants to use the money to purchase roosters and feed

loans.name: Adassou

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in the prefecture of Vo, Adassou A. is a good, well-known farmer in his area. At 55 years of age, he is still very active, and is the father of nine (09) children. Due to the quality of his crops, his goods are sought after by the women in his area. To meet their needs, he wants to enlarge his farm and to buy fertiliser and pesticides.

Due to a lack of financial means, he is asking for $400. The achievement of this goal will bring him new customers, which will provide maximum income. Thus, he will be able to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo, A. Adassou est un brave cultivateur bien connu dans sa localité. Agé de 55 ans il est encore très actif, et père de neuf (9) enfants. De part la qualité de ses récoltes, il est sollicité par les bonnes dames de sa localité. Pour les satisfaire toutes, il a eu l’idée d’agrandir son champ et d’acheter des engrais et les produits phytosanitaire.

Faute de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $400. Ce but atteint, lui permettra d’avoir de nouvelles clientes source d’un revenu maximum. Ainsi il pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertiliser and pesticides

loans.name: Messan Azanlé

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Lomé, Mr. Messan Azanlé A., after his studies, began learning to be a pharmacist. At the end of this process, he opened his own village pharmacy selling generic products with his financial means. Very often, he is faced with shortages and thus risks losing his clientele. To fix this situation, he is asking for $1000 in financial support to stock his pharmacy and better satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1980 à Lomé, Monsieur A. Messan Azanlé, après ses études a suivi une formation en pharmacie au terme de laquelle, il a ouvert sa propre pharmacie villageoise de vente de produits génériques avec ses moyens de bord. Très souvent il est confronté à la rupture et risque de perdre sa clientèle. Pour palier à ce problème, il sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour approvisionner sa pharmacie et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To stock up on pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Belarmino

texts.pt:
Belarmino is not officially married, but he lives with a woman who has 8 children. He joined the loan program in 2006. This loan that he will take is the fourth. He wants to use this money to purchase more basic goods to stock his store. Belarmino's children are studying except for the 3 youngest, who are not yet old enough to go to school. Since he has many children, he plans to apply his business earnings to fix up his residence, since as the children grow, they will need more space. Belarmino's wife is not employed, and takes care of the home and works in the family field.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Belarmino nao esta casado oficialmente mas vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 8 filhos. Ele entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Este emprestimo que ele vai tomar e o quarto. Ele quer usar este dinheiro para comprar mais produtos de primeira necessidade para rechear a sua tenda. Os filhos de Belarmino estao a estudar exceptuando os 3 mais novos que ainda nao tem idade para ir a escola. Por ter muitos filhos ele pensa aplicar os rendimentos do negocio na reabilitacao da sua residencia uma vez que os miudos estao crescendo certamente que precisarao de mais espaco para se acomodarem. A mulher de Belarmino nao esta empregada, cuida dos afazeres domesticos e trabalha na machamba familiar.

loans.use: Belarmino wants to use the money to purchase more products for his store.

loans.name: Akayi

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1964, where she currently lives with her husband and her seven (7) children, Mrs. Akayi A. runs a small business and an animal farm. She earns her income from the sale of sheep. Currently, she would like to develop her farm. The construction of an animal pen, the setting up of a good feed mill, and the purchase of additional sheep - these are her dreams. To achieve this, she would like to use this opportunity to ask for a loan of $350. The income from this business will allow her to better meet the needs of her family, especially in the areas of health, education, and nutrition.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Tannou en 1964 où elle vit toujours avec son mari et ses sept (7) enfants, Madame A. Akayi exerce le petit commerce et l’élevage. Elle tire ses revenus de la vente de ses moutons. Aujourd’hui, elle espère développer cet élevage. Construire un enclos aux bêtes, disposer d’une bonne provenderie et acheter d’autres moutons, tel est son rêve. Pour cela, elle veut passer par ce canal pour solliciter $350. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille notamment en matière de santé, d’éducation scolaire et alimentaire.

loans.use: To buy a feed mill and additional sheep

loans.name: Raoul Komlan

texts.fr:
At 33 years of age, Mr. Raoul Komlan A. is married. After his studies ended with a BTS (a two-year employment-oriented technician qualification diploma) in Commerce and Sales, he did not have the chance to work in the field. Fortunately, he was able to find a place managing a beverage store. With 5 years of experience, he has found that this business is flourishing, and has decided to open his own store, but he sadly lacks the means. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $800. This will increase his income and allow him to better take care of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur Raoul Komlan A. est marié. Après ses études sanctionnées par un BTS Action Commercial et Force de Vente, il n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi du genre. Mais heureusement, il a pu trouver une place de gérant dans un dépôt de boissons. Avec 5 ans d’expérience, il trouve que c’est une activité très florissante et décide d’ouvrir son propre dépôt de boissons mais les moyens lui manquent cruellement. Pour ce faire il sollicite un crédit de $800. Ceci augmentera ses revenus en vue de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: To open a beverage store

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ablavi A. was born in Tannou in 1971. Married with eight (8) children, the production of gari (a type of cassava flour) is her chief business. It is with the income from this business that she meets the needs of her children. Well regarded in her area for the quality of her gari, she has recently received many orders. As a result, she is seizing this opportunity to ask for a loan of $350 in order to buy lots of manioc. The benefits derived from the sale of gari will allow her to better meet the needs of her children with regards to health and education.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Ablavi est née à Tannou en 1971. Mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants, la production du gari est son activité principale. C’est d’ailleurs de revenu de cette activité qu’elle subvient aux besoins de ses enfants. Bien appréciée dans la localité pour la qualité de son gari, elle a reçu à cette période beaucoup de commandes. Pour cela, elle saisi cette opportunité pour solliciter un crédit de $350 afin d’acheter beaucoup de manioc. Les bénéfices qui seront issus de la vente du gari, lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants en matière de santé et d’éducation.

loans.use: To buy cassava for the production of gari (cassava flour)

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr:
Mrs. Conforte Addissou, 43 years old, is married and mother of three children. She sells groceries in a market in Lomé. Her meager means do not permit her to satisfy the needs of her customers and sometimes she has to just stay at home because she has nothing more to sell. She is asking for a loan of $600 to expand her business, so that she can have a constant supply of goods in her inventory and better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Conforte ADDISSOU âgée de 43 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités dans un marché de Lomé. Ses maigres moyens ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire la demande du marché et dès fois elle reste à la maison par manque de stock. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour agrandir la taille de son commerce, faire un stock consistant de ses marchandises en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Expanding her inventory  Stockage de marchandises

loans.name: Tojigul

texts.ru:
Tojigul Z. is 44 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. She is a housewife and also raises livestock. She has been doing this for 20 years. Tojigul plans to use the loan to purchase 2 pieces of livestock which she plans to resell every 40-45 days, using her revenues to purchase new livestock.

At the end of the loan period, after repaying the loan, Tojigul plans to earn 2 pieces of livestock as profit which she will use to get milk for personal use and profit. She plans to repay the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Зиёева Таджигул, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Максуда домохозяйка и помимо домашнего хозяйства занимается разведением домашнего скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 20 лет. На полученный кредит Таджигул планирует приобрести 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, которого после откоормки каждые 40-45 дней будет продавать и на вырученные деньги приобретать молодняк. В конце кредитного срока, после погашения всей суммы кредита, Таджигул планирует получить в качестве прибыли 2 головы собственного домашнего скота, который в дальнейшем будет использовать для получения молока для личных нужд и для продажи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 2 pieces of livestock

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amivi A. was born in 1981 in Lomé; she is married and has no children. She has her own little grocery store and also sells personal care products. This income is not enough to allow her to contribute as needed to the family's expenses. To augment what she brings in, she would like to go to the markets in the country around the capital from time to time to buy such commodities as hot peppers, okra, corn, etc. that she can resell in Lomé. This is a very lucrative business, but in order to tap into it, she needs a loan of US$ 400.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Amivi A. est née en 1981 à Lomé, mariée et sans enfant. Elle gère sa propre boutique d’alimentation générale et de produits de beauté. Le seul revenu ne lui permet pas de contribuer aux charges du foyer. Pour augmenter ses revenus, elle pense aller temps en temps dans les marchés de l’intérieur s’approvisionner en produits de premières nécessités (piment, gombo, maïs etc.) et venir vendre à Lomé. C’est un commerce très florissant mais n’ayant pas de moyens suffisants, elle sollicite un crédit de $400.

loans.use: Stock up on groceries for resale  S'approvisionner en produits de première nécécité

loans.name: Ana Jose

texts.pt:
Ana is married and the mother of 4 children. She lives in Maxixe with her family. She works at a private company. She joined the loan program this year. She wants to use the money to buy some home appliances for her house. This is only the second loan that she is taking. The first one she used to purchase a freezer. Ana's husband is not employed.
