He lives from small jobs to support his family. For that reason, Ana joined the program in order to help her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Ana e casada e mae de 4 filhos. Ela vive na Maxixe com sua familia. Ela e trabalhadora numa empresa privada. Ela entrou para o programa de credito ainda este ano. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de alguns electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Este e so segundo emprestimo que ela toma. o promeiro ela usou para a compra de um congelador. O marido de Ana nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expediente para poder sustentar sua familia. por isso Ana entrou para o programa como forma de reforcar o seu vencimento que e baixo ara poder ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Ana wants to use the money to purchase home appliances

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo Y. is 24 years old and sells T-shirts, jeans, and other men's wear. He is very happy with this business and with his people skills, he could well attract additional clientele. Unfortunately, his present financial means do not allow him to meet all his customers' needs. If he does not remedy this situation, he risks losing that clientele. With this situation in mind, Mr. Yawo Y. is requesting a loan of US$ 300 so that he can expand his inventory, buying new styles and thus attracting and keeping a broader range of customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Agé de 24 ans, Monsieur Yawo Y. est revendeur de T-shirt, et Jean pantalon et autre habits d’homme. Il aime bien son commerce et avec son accueil il pu avoir plus de clientèle. Avec ses moyens de bord, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle. Si rien n’est fait il risque de les perdre. Très soucieux de sa situation, Monsieur Y. Yawo sollicite un crédit de $300 pour s’approvisionner en quantité et en nouveaux afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et de les fidéliser.

loans.use:
Expand his inventory of men's wear
S'approvisionner en marchandises

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra S. was born on January 7, 1954 in Kouvé (province of Yoto); she is married and mother of two children. She is a typist by training. Not being able to find work in this field, she used her small savings to open a little grocery store. To better serve her customers, she is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to expand her business. This amount will allow her to stock cooking oil, rice and such.

Madame S. Abra est née le 07 janvier 1954 à Kouvé (P/Yoto), mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Elle est dactylographe de formation. Ne trouvant pas d’emploi, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits alimentaires avec sa petite économie. Pour mieux répondre aux désirs de ses clients, elle sollicite un crédit de $300 pour agrandir son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de faire un stock d’huile, de riz et autres.

loans.use: Adding cooking oil, rice and such to her inventory  Stockage d'huile,de riz et autres

loans.name: Martha

texts.fr:
Miss Martha B., 24, sells grocery products. She is well versed in hygiene and careful to maintain a clean business which draws customers to her little shop. Unfortunately, she does not have the financial means to improve her business locale, however. She needs to have a display case built to protect her wares from dust and from flies. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 for this purpose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, Mlle B. Martha est revendeuse de denrée alimentaire. Elle a une bonne notion d’hygiène et la pratique aussi bien. Ce qui fait augmenter sa clientèle. Elle manque de fond nécessaire pour améliorer son activité. Faire confectionner une cage pour mettre ses aliments afin de les protéger de la poussière et des mouches. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $300.

loans.use:
selling groceries (having a display case built that will keep her wares clean)
Vente de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1970, Marie A. is married and the mother of six. Producing gari (granulated cassava root) is her primary work each day. It is her source of income. She buys fields of cassava, digs up the roots, and transforms them into gari, which she sells. Known by consumers for the quality of her product, she has now gotten a lot of orders to fill. And so she is requesting a loan of $350 to buy cassava in order to make gari. The income will enable her to meet her children's needs in terms of health and education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Tannou en 1970, Madame A. Marie est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. La production du gari est son activité quotidienne. C’est de cette activité qu’elle tire ses revenus. Elle achète les champs de manioc, les déterre, transforme le levain en gari qu’elle vend. Reconnue par les consommateurs par la qualité de son gari, aujourd’hui elle a reçu beaucoup de demande qu’elle doit satisfaire. Pour cela, elle sollicite ce crédit de $350 pour acheter du manioc afin de produire du gari. Les revenus lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants en matière de santé et d’éducation.

loans.use: To buy cassava for making gari

loans.name: Naka

texts.fr:
Naka P., age 45, is unmarried and a hairdresser by training. Often faced with competition, she really wants to renovate her salon to attract more customers and to sell beauty products, hair extensions, and braids. However, her means for fulfilling her plans fall far short. She is requesting a loan of $400 that will enable her to gain customers and also to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 45 ans, Mlle P. Naka est coiffeuse de formation. Très souvent confronté à la concurrence, elle veut plus aménager son salon de coiffure pour attirer plus de clientèle et vendre des produits de beauté et des mèches. Ses moyens sont très insuffisants pour la réalisation de ce projet. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir plus de clients et aussi augmenter ses revenus.

loans.use: To renovate a beauty salon

loans.name: Sessinou

texts.fr:
Born in Tannou in 1953, Sessinou S. is married and the father of eight. As a retired veterinarian, he possesses a lot of experience in raising livestock. Having become the major provider of animal protein in his area, he carefully manages his livestock. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to construct a pen to contain them and to buy other animals, such as pigs and chickens to raise. The profits will enable him to improve living conditions at home and his children's schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né à Tannou en 1953, Monsieur S. Sessinou est marié et père de huit (8) enfants. Vétérinaire de formation à la retraite, il possède une grande expérience en élevage. Devenu le grand fournisseur de protéine animale dans le milieu, Monsieur S. Séssinou gère ses animaux avec beaucoup de soins. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite ce crédit de $1000 pour construire un enclos aux bêtes et acheter d’autres animaux tels que le porc, les poules pour l’élevage. Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie et d’études de ses enfants.

loans.use: To build a pen for livestock and to buy other livestock

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh A., age 24, is a young graduate who has devoted himself to the business of market gardening to carve out a place for himself in the world. A very enterprising man, he is requesting a loan of $900 to initiate a new season of intense activity. While he is unmarried, he has three younger brothers as dependents. He needs funding to buy seeds and an effective motorized pump for his plan to enlarge his garden.

This funding will enable him to meet customer expectations at harvest time and thus achieve major profit margins for a successful life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Edoh est un jeune diplômé de 24 ans qui s’est donné à l’activité de maraîchage pour se tailler une place au soleil. Très entreprenant, il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour amorcer cette nouvelle saison d’intenses activités. Célibataire mais a en charge trois (3) petits frères. Il a besoin de ce fonds pour acheter de la semence et une motopompe performante dans le projet d’agrandissement de son jardin. Ce fonds lui permettra de satisfaire d’autres clients à la récolte et ainsi dégager une grande marge bénéficiaire pour son épanouissement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and a motorized pump

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr:
Komlavi A. was born in 1966 in Boko (Vo Prefecture). In his home in Kpémé, he takes care of three others. He is mastering his trade as a mechanic. In addition to this work, which brings in little money these days, he also drives taxi-trucks delivering gravel and beach sand to customers. This is his other business that allows him make up for the lack of income from his main work. As an energetic and enterprising man, he wants to rise toward independence for himself. Having acquired a used broken-down truck, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a new motor for it. With his own truck, he would fully be able to enjoy his new business, which will bring in more income to cover household costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Komlavi est né en 1966 à Boko (P/Vo). Domicilié à Kpémé, il vit avec trois (3) personnes à sa charge. Mécanicien, il maîtrise son métier. En plus de sa profession qui est peu rentable en ces temps ci, Monsieur A. conduit des camions taxi pour livrer du sable de mer et du gravier aux clients. Cette seconde activité lui permet de compenser le manque de revenu de sa principale activité. Dynamique et entreprenant, il veut sortir de la dépendance. Ayant acquérir un camion d’occasion en mauvais état, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter un moteur neuf afin d’avoir son propre camion qui lui permettra de jouir pleinement de sa nouvelle activité, qui de ce fait va lui procurer plus de revenus pour la couverture des charges du foyer.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his truck

loans.name: Léa Assoupi

texts.fr:
Born November 21, 1979, Ms. Léa Assoupi K. is single and takes care of her one child and two other people. She is a trained hairdresser, a career she chose after she left middle school. Unfortunately, she does not have the means necessary to open her own hair salon. She thus has to work out of her house, which, for better or for worse, allows her to get by. Her goal today is to open a hair salon in the Hédzranawoé market and also to sell cosmetics. To do so, she is requesting a loan of $1000. She is a dynamic young woman who has the qualities necessary to manage her own salon.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 21 novembre 1979, Madame Léa Assoupi K. est célibataire avec un enfant et deux autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est coiffeuse de formation. Ce métier, elle l’a choisi après avoir arrêté ses études au collège. Malheureusement, elle n’a pas suffisamment de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Elle est obligé de travailler à la maison ce qui lui permet tant bien que mal de s’en sortir. Son objectif aujourd’hui est d’ouvrir un atelier de coiffure dans le grand marché de Hédzranawoé et de vendre également des produits cosmétiques. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt de $1000. C’est une jeune femme très dynamique qui a les qualités de bien gérer son atelier.

loans.use: Opening a hair salon

loans.name: Apessi

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou, Ms. Apessi A. is a 45-year-old mother of five (5) children. She sells cola nuts and skillfully manages her income-generating business. To maximize her profit, she would like to go herself to production areas to buy the cola nuts. As she lacks the financial means to do so, she is requesting a loan of $200. Once she accomplishes this dream, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and in particular to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Tékponou, Madame A. Apessi est âgée de 45 ans et est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Vendeuse de cola, elle maîtrise très bien son activité génératrice de revenu. Pour maximiser son profit, elle veut aller elle-même s’approvisionner dans les zones de production. Nécessitant des moyens financiers, elle vient solliciter $200. une fois ce rêve réalisé, elle envisage améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cola nuts

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in the Vo prefecture, Mr. Kokouvi K. is a 25-year-old father of three (3) children. He specializes in growing tomatoes, which are in heavily sought after by the local women. To satisfy the demand, he would like to increase his production by buying plant-care products, which will give him a greater production yield. As he lacks the financial means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $800, which will allow him to buy fertilizer and thus to increase his production yield.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur K. Kokouvi est âgé de 25 ans et est père de trois (3) enfants. Spécialisé dans la culture de tomates, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes. Pour satisfaire toutes ses demandes, il voudrait augmenter sa production par l’achat des produits phytosanitaire qui lui permettront d’avoir de grands rendements. Par manque de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $800 qui lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais afin d’augmenter son rendement.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and plant-care products

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi K. is an active 26-year-old. He is a talented farmer, and his crops are sought after by many local women who would like to sell them. The income he earns from this business allows him to take care of his small family of four (4) people. He would like to increase his harvest in order to maximize his income, and to do so he needs to buy fertilizer. As he lacks the financial means to do so, he is requesting a loan of $500 to help him with this purchase.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Komi est un jeune très actif de 26 ans. Très doué dans la culture des produits vivriers, il est sollicité par beaucoup de bonnes femmes exerçant le commerce de ces produits. Le revenu de cette activité lui permet de s’occuper de sa petite famille de quatre (4) personnes. Dans le souci d’augmenter ses récoltes afin de maximiser son revenu, il voudrait acheter des engrais. Par manque de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter un apport financier de $500 pour l’achat des engrais.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Mr. Komi A., 40, was born in Djita, in the Vo prefecture. He is a father of three (3) children and is a very active jack of all trades. He repairs bicycles and used basins and also sells fuel. He would like to maximize his income from his diverse business activities, and to do so he needs to build a workshop and to buy fuel wholesale. As this project requires additional financial means, he is requesting a loan of $200. Meeting this goal will allow him to meet his family’s needs and in particular to send his children to school.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 40 ans, Monsieur A. Komi est née à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo. Père de trois (3) enfants, c’est un homme très actif et très à tout faire. Mécanicien à 2 roues, il répare les bassines usées et vend aussi du carburant. Dans le souci de maximiser son revenu à travers ses multiples activités, il voudrait construire un atelier, aller acheter lui-même le carburant en gros. La réalisation de ce projet nécessitant de moyens financiers, il vient solliciter $200 pour ce faire. Cet objectif atteint lui permettra d’assurer les besoins de sa famille surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To build a workshop and to buy and sell fuel

loans.name: Goka

texts.fr:
Mr Y. Goka is 35 years old and was born in Atsansi Djita. He is a father of six (6) children, and his main work consists of breeding sheep. This very remunerative activity enables him to provide for the needs of his family. A very ambitious man, he would like to buy a greater number of animals, and to build a farmhouse to house them in order to ensure their safety. Due to a lack of finances, he is asking for a loan of $200 for the realization of this project. When his dream is carried out, he will be able to have a greater source of revenue for his growing family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 35 ans, Monsieur Y. Goka est né à Atsansi Djita. Père de six (6) enfants, il a pour activité principale, l’élevage de moutons. Cette activité très rémunératrice lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aujourd’hui, très ambitieux d’avoir un grand nombre de bêtes et de mieux assurer leur sécurité, il voudrais construire un enclos et en acheter d’autres. Mais faute de moyens financiers il vient solliciter $200 pour la réalisation de ce projet. Ce rêve réalisé lui permettra d’avoir un revenu maximum source de l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Building a farmhouse for animals

loans.name: Kokou Omer

texts.fr:
Born in Afagnan on August 6, 1969, Mr D. Kokou Omer is married and a father of two (2) children. His wife is a seamstress who only slightly contributes to the household needs. Mr D. has a secondary education and is a computer maintenance technician who has just completed his training. He is asking for a loan of $800 in order to buy a workplace computer, a printer and a photocopier in order to open a text processing and printing center. From the income gained, he will be able to refund his loan and improve the living conditions of his children.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Afagnan, le 06 Août 1969, Monsieur D. Kokou Omer est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Sa femme est couturière qui contribue légèrement aux charges du ménage. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Monsieur D. est un informaticien maintenancier qui vient d’achever son apprentissage. Il compte saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit de $800 afin d’acheter un poste ordinateur, une imprimante et un photocopieur afin d’ouvrir un centre de traitement de texte. A partir des recettes il pourra rembourser son crédit et améliore les conditions de vie de ses enfants.

loans.use: Buying a computer, printer and copier

loans.name: Aziamayo

texts.fr:
Mrs K. Aziamayo was born in 1972 in Dagbati and lives with her husband in the village of Atséti in the Vo region. A mother of three (3) children, she works in production of palm oil from palm nuts. Her small business helps her gain a considerable income which helps her to provide for her needs and those of her family. To further grow her business, she is asking for a loan of $200 in order to buy a larger quantity of palm nuts.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Aziamayo est née en 1972 à Dagbati et vit avec son mari dans le village d’Atséti dans la préfecture de Vo. Mère de trois (3) enfants, elle est spécialisée dans la transformation des noix de palmes en huile. Cette activité lui procure un revenu non négligeable qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Pour redynamiser cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $200 afin d’acheter en quantité importante les noix de palme.

loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Sosa Basila

texts.fr:
Born in AGBETSIKO in 1979, Mister E. Sosa Basila is married and takes care of 4 people. With an elementary level education, he had to join the trades in order to support his family. Today, he has become a master mechanic / sheet metal worker, and has access to a small group of people with whom he works. He would like to take advantage of this opportunity to ask for a $200 credit in order buy high-quality work equipment so that he can be competitive in the region. The income from his trade will help him to reimburse the credit and satisfy the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à AGBETSIKO en 1979, Monsieur E. Sosa Basila est marié et compte à sa charge 4 personnes. Instruit de niveau primaire, il rejoint l’apprentissage très tôt pour faute de support. Aujourd’hui, devenu maître mécanicien-Tolier, il dispose d’un petit groupe dans lequel il travail. Il compte saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter ce crédit de $200 afin de d’acheter du matériel de travail pour être à la hauteur du travail et être compétitif dans la localité. Les revenus de métier lui serviront à rembourser le crédit et satisfaire les besoin de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying work equipment

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born on December 19, 1956 in Lomé, Madam Adjo K. lives in the neighborhood called Djidjolé. She sells second-hand bags. She is married and a mother of two children of whom she takes care. Her husband is retired, and does not manage to provide the necessary means for the family. She tries in every way to take care of the family, but her profits are always insufficient, and she is asking for a loan of $400 to buy a large quantity of bags which will allow her to make a greater profit and to be able to care for her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 19 décembre 1956 à Lomé, Madame Adjo K. réside dans le quartier djidjolé. Elle est revendeuse de sacs de friperies. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants qui sont à sa charge. Son mari, retraité, n’arrive pas à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle se bat dure pour prendre en charge la famille, mais étant toujours insuffisant, ce qu’elle réalise comme profit, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour acheter une grande quantité de sacs lui permettant de faire un peu plus de bénéfice afin de pouvoir bien prendre soins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying second-hand bags

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
Born in Kome on August 14, 1962, Mrs. Yvette K. lives with her husband in Afagnagan. She has eight persons in her care. Her daily work consists of producing food staples. Thanks to the income from this small business, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. Today she is asking for a loan of $200 to buy products for the small store she intends to open. Profits from sales will put Mrs. K. in a better position to look after her children’s health, nutrition and schooling. In this way the family can really flourish.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à KOME, le 14 Aoute 1962, Madame K. Yvette vit avec son mari à AFAGNAGAN. Elle compte à sa charge un total de 8 personnes. La production de durée alimentaire est son travail quotidien. C’est grâce aux revenus de cette petite activité qu’elle contribue aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $200 pour acheter les produits afin d’alimenter sa petite boutique qu’elle comte ouvrir. Les bénéfices issus de la vente serviront à Madame K. Yvette de mieux prendre en charge les enfants sur le plan sanitaire alimentaire et scolaire. Ainsi, elle pourra parvenir à un plein épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Komla Basile

texts.fr:
Born in Bénin in 1972, Mr. Komla Basile A. is married and has five people to look after. A mechanic by profession, he is much appreciated by his customers in Afagnan for the care he takes over his work. With five years’ experience already, Basile is well qualified to give a warm welcome to his customers and offer them good service. Overcome with the desire to own a motorcycle taxi, he is taking advantage of this opportunity to request a loan of $700 in order to achieve his dream. The money he makes from this work will allow him to repay the loan and look after his children’s health, nutrition and schooling, so that his family can flourish.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né au Bénin en 1972, Monsieur Komla Basile A. est marié et compte cinq personnes à sa charge. Mécanicien de profession il est très bien apprécié par sa clientèle d’Afagnan pour le soin qu’il accorde à son travail. Déjà cinq aux expérience, basile possède une expérience qui lui permet de bien accueillir et servir ses clients. Aujourd’hui dans un désir fou d’être propriétaire d’un taxi-moto, elle saisi de cette occasion pour solliciter $700 afin de réaliser sa rêve. Les recettes de ce travail lui permettra de rembourser le crédit, et bien s’occuper de ses enfants en matière de santé, d’alimentation, de scolarité afin de bien épanouir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Dopé Béatrice

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dopé Béatrice K. was born in Lomé on February 11, 1961. She sells vegetables and lives in the neighborhood of Djidjolé. Divorced from her husband, she has four children to look after. As she does not have the means to satisfy her customers and grow her income, she is asking for a loan of $600 to buy more vegetables directly from the market gardeners. This will enable her to make more profit and support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Dopé Béatrice K. est née le 11 février 1961 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse des légumes et réside dans le quartier de djidjolé. Divorcé de son mari, elle a 04 enfants à sa charge. Ses moyens ne lui permettant pas de satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter plus de légumes directement auprès des jardiniers. Ce qui lui permettra de faire plus de bénéfice et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: Kokou Bénoit

texts.fr:
Born in Attive in 1981, Mr. Kokou Bénoit T. is a young married man. He has five people in his care. After grade school he decided to learn carpentry as there was no financial support. Today he has become a master carpenter and has opened a studiowhere he works with two apprentices. Much sought after for the quality of his work, he needs financial help to buy wood in order to meet demand. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity to request a loan of $200 in order to buy wood. Profits from his business will enable him to change the living conditions of his family and in particular improve what they have to eat and the schooling of his children.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à ATTIVE en 1981, Monsieur T. Kokou Bénoit est un jeune homme marié. IL a à sa charge 5 personnes. Après ses études primaires il décida d’apprendre la menuiserie pour manque de support. Aujourd’hui devenu maitre menuisier il a ouvert un atelier et travaille avec 2 apprentis. Très sollicité par la finesse de son travail, il a besoin d’un appui financier pour acheter du bois afin de satisfaire les demandes. Il veut saisir de cette opportunité pour demander un crédit de $200 afin de s’acheter du bois. Les bénéfices de son travail lui permettra de changer la condition de vie de sa famille surtout améliorer l’alimentation, les condition d’étude de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Brada

texts.fr:
Mrs. Brada W. is a 38 year-old woman who lives in the village of Amégran. She is married and has three children. She is a seamstress by profession but also makes money from other activities, such as selling fruit juice and ice. The two secondhand freezers she has been using to date have broken down. This has caused a drop in business and also her income. She would like to buy a new freezer so that she can relaunch her business. She would also like to buy a sewing machine for dressmaking. To do this she is asking for a loan of $500. This will enable her to improve her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Brada W. est une dame de 38 ans qui vit dans le village d’Amégran. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Couturière de profession, elle mène d’autres activités génératrices de revenus comme par exemple la vente de jus de fruits et d’eau glacée. Les deux congélateurs d’occasion qu’elle utilise jusqu’alors sont en pane. Ce qui a fait chuter son activité ainsi que son revenu. Elle veut aujourd’hui acheter un congélateurs neuf afin de relancer ses activités. Egalement, elle veut acheter une machine à coudre pour sa couture. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $500. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer sa revenu

loans.use: To buy a freezer and a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chairs, tables etc.

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati is 35 years old and the mother of a 12-year-old daughter. She has a small shop where she sells some snacks and household goods. She earns up to $10 per day. Her husband, S., is a driver who earns $10 per week. She requests a loan of $125 to buy more goods for her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy threads and other materials she needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in many different products for retail

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
A married mother of four children, Mrs. Louise T.'s business is making clay pots. This is how she manages to contribute to the family income. Recognized by her clientele as a gentle, welcoming woman, Louise produces pots of excellent quality. With a great many interested customers, she barely manages to supply the needs of those who come to her looking for pots. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy raw materials for her business. With the added income her increased stocks of pots will provide, she will be able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, Madame T. Louise a pour activité la production des pots. C’est à partir de ces ressources qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux charges de son ménage. Reconnue par sa clientèle comme une femme douce et accueillante, elle produit des pots de très bonne qualité. Très envahie par ses clients, aujourd’hui elle produit assez de pots pour satisfaire la demande. Pour en arriver, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour acheter la matière première afin de produire ses pots. A partir du revenu, elle pourra améliores les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchasing raw materials for making clay pots
Achat de matière première pour la fabrication des pots

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 34 year old married woman. Her business is selling various food items. She can earn as much as $15 per day. Her husband, I.,  is a worker who earns a salary of $30 per month. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business and hopes that she could earn more income to cover their daily needs. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr:
Mr. Messan A. lives in Agomé -Glozou, Togo, where he was born in 1976. With God's help he has become an excellent supplier of vegetables for his community. He is responsible for 6 people and earns his family's living with his gardening. He knows all the ins and outs of this business in which he has 9 years of experience. His great trump is his production of vegetables in the off-season, however, in order to accomplish this, he needs a pump to provide water for his crops. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US$ 550 so as to supply enough cabbage, lettuce, peppers, beets, and carrots to meet the demand. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Messan A. vit à Agomé glozou où il est né en 1976. Devenu le vrai fournusseur des produits maraîchers par la grâce de Dieu, il est marié et dispose à sa charge 6 personnes. Le jardin est son activité quotidien. Neuf ans d’expérience déjà, il cerne tous les rouages de son activité. La production contre saison est sa réussite la plus admirable. Pour le faire, il a besoin d’une motopompe pour arroser les produits. Il veut saisi cette opportunité pour demander un crédit de $550 pour acheter la machine afin d’être à la hauteur des nombreuses demandes en choux, laitue, poivron, bétérave, carotte. Par activité, Monsieur Messan A. pourra améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a pump to provide water for his vegetable garden

Achat d'une motopompe

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Description of Business

Rosaura offers typical dishes from the coastal region of Ecuador in her small restaurant. She runs her business every day from 7am until 9pm.

Use of Loan

She is requesting the loan to make necessary repairs to her small restaurant, and to buy new utensils for her business. With this she will be able to provide better service to her customers and take advantage of the holiday season.

Personal Information

Rosaura is 36 years old and has 4 children, 3 of them are in school. Her husband is a traveling merchant and he he helps her with the restaurant. Her experience selling meals motivated her to open her own business 5 years ago, utilizing a space in her house to set up her restaurant. Her goal is to be able to grow her business and increase her income.

Descripción del Negocio

Rosaura en su negocio se dedica a la venta de almuerzos y platos de comida típica de la región costa del ecuador. La atención de su negocio lo realiza todos los días de 7am.a 9pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Rosaura solicita el crédito para realizar arreglos de su local y comprar nuevos implementos para su negocio. Para de esta manera mejorar la atención a sus clientes y aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

Información Personal

Rosaura tiene 36 años de edad, 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando. El esposo es comerciante ambulante y la apoya en su negocio de comedor. La experiencia en el comercio la animo en iniciar su propio negocio hace 5 años de venta de comida. Su local cual utiliza un espacio de su vivienda. Su aspiración es lograr crecer junto a su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS AND BUY UTENSILS NEEDED FOR HER RESTAURANT, IMPROVING THE SERVICE SHE CAN OFFER HER CUSTOMERS, GROWING HER BUSINESS, AND INCREASING HER INCOME.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Born in Agomé-Glozou in 1962, Mr. Kodjo A. is married and provides for a total of 10 people. His wife has a little store whose income also goes toward family expenses. Mr. Kodjo A. became a farmer by choice and is now referred to as "friend of the earth". His great experience makes him an excellent farmer. Currently, in order to cope with increased demand for his crops, he would like to improve the productivity of his fields. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to purchase fertilizer. The income from the sale of his harvest will permit him to save a bit, to improve living conditions for his family, and especially to provide for his children's education.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né à Agomé-glozou en 1962, Monsieur Kodjo A. est marié et a à sa charge un total de dix (10) personnes. Sa femme, petite revendeuse contribue aux charges du ménage. Devenu paysan à son gré, monsieur Kodjo A. est surnommé aujourd’hui « ami de la terre ». Ses nombreuses expériences lui confèrent le statut d’un grand paysan. Aujourd’hui, pour faire face à la demande élevée, il a besoin d’augmenter la productivité de ses champs. A cet effet, il sollicite ce crédit de $400 pour acheter des fertilisants afin d’enrichir ses champs. Les recettes tirées de la vente des récoltes lui permettront d’épargner son compte, et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en général et d’étude de ses enfants en particulier.

loans.use:
Purchase of fertilizer

Achat des fertilisants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: INCREASE HER INVENTORY IN HER SMALL STORE, BETTER PREPARING FOR THE HIGHER DEMAND OF THE HOLIDAY SEASON.  THIS SINGLE MOTHER WANTS TO CONTINUE GROWING HER BUSINESS SO THAT SHE CAN TAKE CARE OF HER CHILDREN.

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en: Nanah is 37 years old and a mother of a 13 year old daughter. She has a small shop from which sells some snacks. She usually earns $8 per day. Her husband J. is a driver who earns $2 income per day. She has to work to earn more income for the family and requests a $100 loan to buy more goods for her shop and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing and items that serve as Christmas gifts

loans.name: Sénadé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sénadé A. K. was born in 1972 in Agomé-Glozou where she is presently living. She is responsible for six persons. Her husband is a teacher and also helps earn the family's living. Unfortunately, Mrs. A. K. does not have enough business capital to be able to satisfy the demands of her customers. Her business is buying and selling bulk quantities of palm nuts for processing. She brings her baskets, bowls and sacks to the women who produce palm oil to purchase palm nuts and send them off to Lomé for resale. After 10 years of being in this business of which she knows all the ins and outs, she needs additional capital so that she can purchase and resell larger quantities. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500. The increased income will allow her to improve living conditions for her family and provide for her children's education.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Sénadé A. K. est née en 1972 à Agomé-glozou où elle vit encore avec six (06) personnes à sa charge. Son mari, instituteur contribue aux charges du ménage. Néanmoins, les fonds de commerce de Sénadé A. K. ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire sa clientèle. La vente des noix palmistes aux unités industrielles de transformation est son activité. Elle se promène, paniers, bols et sacs auprès des femmes productrices de l’huile de palme pour acheter ses noix et les achemine sur Lomé pour la vente. Connaissant aujourd’hui tous les rouages de cette activité après dix (10) ans d'expérience, elle nécessite les fonds afin d’augmenter sa capacité d’achat et de vente. Elle compte saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter un crédit de $500. Les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie et d’étude de ses enfants.

loans.use:
Bulk purchase and resale of palm nuts

Achat en quantité et vente de noix de palmistes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothes and other items for the holiday season

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr:
Mr. Ablam A., 49, is an experienced livestock breeder in the village of Atséti. He is responsible for his five children as well as various other family members. His main source of income is farming and raising livestock. In order to better manage his herds and increase productivity, he needs to build an enclosure for them and purchase mangers, etc. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300. This will allow him to make his livestock business more profitable so that he can better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 49 ans, monsieur Ablam A. est un éleveur expérimenté dans le village d’Atséti. Avec ses cinq (05) enfants, il a en charge d’autres membres de sa famille. Sa principale source de revenu reste l’agriculture à laquelle il associe l’élevage. Afin de maîtriser ses animaux et accroître leur rendement, il a voulu construire un enclos et acheter certains nécessaires comme mangeoire et autres. Pour réaliser ce projet, il sollicite un crédit de $300. Ceci lui permettra de rentabiliser son élevage et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Building an enclosure for his livestock

Construction d'enclos pour les bêtes

loans.name: Sadiah

texts.en: Sadiah is 34 years old and is a mother of a 12 year old daughter. She has a small shop which sells some snacks and household goods. She could earn $10 per day. Her husband E. is a laborer who earns a $2 salary per day. She requests a $125 loan to fill her shop with more goods and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her family and home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Replenish his inventory and perform maintenance on his copier

loans.name: Nonoussi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Nonoussi M. is married and mother of five children. She and her family live in the village of Atséti. Her business is farming and she raises primarily corn and hot peppers. The poor condition of her soil keeps her from having plentiful harvests the way she used to in years past. To improve the fertility of her land and enlarge the area she is able to cultivate, she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300. This will permit her to purchase fertilizer and rent a tractor for plowing. The success of these plans will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 40 ans, madame Nonoussi M. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille d’Atséti. L’agriculture est son domaine d’action et elle cultive essentiellement du maïs et du piment. Mais l’appauvrissement des sols ne lui permet plus de réaliser des moissons importantes comme c’est le cas quelques années plus tôt. Pour renforcer la fertilité des sols et agrandir les surfaces cultivables, elle sollicite un crédit de $300. cela lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais et de louer un tracteur pour la préparation du sol. La réussite de ce projet lui sera bénéfique, tant elle va améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
Buying fertilizer and renting a tractor

Achat d'engrais et location de tracteur

loans.name: Elida Cornelia

texts.es:
Elida D., a small business owner, is 35 years old and has 3 children.  Elida is a widow, and has run a business selling groceries for 8 years.   She works on credit to purchase wholesale, but the terms  are very short and the interest is high, so the gains she makes are not enough to develop the business.   For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to grow her business.  With the loan she will buy popular items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and ham, as well as canned sardines and sodas.   She can buy rice in bulk for $40, sugar for $27, ham for $22 and the sodas for $10.  


La microempresaria Elida D. tiene 35 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, tiene 3 hijos es viuda y se dedica a la venta de granos basicos desde hace 8 años. La señora D. obtiene creditos de negocios que venden al por mayor, sin embargo el plazo que le dan es muy poco y los intereses son elevados, por lo que la ganancia que le queda no le permite desarrollarse. Por este motiva es que solicita un prestamo para poder crecer en su negocio. Segun la microempresaria D. ella prioriza comprar productos que son bastantes consumidos por sus vecinos que son parte de sus clientes, entre estos los granos basicos principalmente el arroz, azucar, el aceite y jabon. Pero tambien manifiesta que en su sector vende bastante sardina enlatada y gasesosas (Pepsi y cocacola).
Ella compra el quintal de arroz a US$ 40 dolares cada quintal, a US$ 27 dolares el quintal de azucar, el bidon de aceite a US$ 23 dolares, cada caja de sardina la compra a US$ 15 dolares, la caja de jabon a US$ 22 dolares y la cajilla de gaseosa a US$ 10 dolares.

loans.use: TO STOCK HER STORE WITH RICE, SUGAR, COOKING OIL, HAM, CANNED SARDINES, ETC.  GROWING HER SMALL BUSINESS AND INCREASING HER PROFITS.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 26.27 dólares lo pago el 04 de febrero no se pudo notificar a tiempo porque uno de los promotores esta de vacaciones y el otro estaba de subsidio por presentar problemas de salud.
La cuota completa es de US$ 21.07. La cuota real es de US$ 23.67 pero por error el 07-Febrero-2,008 se reporto US$ 26.27
la cuota real de pago es de US$23.67
La cuota  real de pago es de $ 23.67 dólares.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dédé F. was born in Lomé on April 22, 1970. She sells food to her community and lives in the Djidjolé district. Married to a tailor, she is mother of four children. In order to expand her production, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 500 which will allow her to purchase ingredients in bulk (corn, fish, etc.). In this way she will be able to prepare more food to sell and better help her husband to support their family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dédé F. est née le 22 avril 1970 à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse des denrées alimentaires et réside dans le quartier de djidjolé. Mariée à un tailleur, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Pour agrandir son étalage, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 qui lui permettra l’achat en gros des produits (maïs, poissons etc.) pour accroître sa production afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use:
Bulk purchase of foods she sells

S'approvisionner en denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Tassi

texts.fr:
Married and mother of three children, Mrs. Tassi M. is 25 years old. She and her husband live in the village of Atséti. Her primary business is making the cassava (manioc) flour she sells. She buys the raw material, manioc, direct from farmers. Producing the flour is a very labor-intensive process: digging up and collecting the manioc, peeling and washing it, grating, pressing, and sieving before roasting it. This calls for a big input in capital for labor costs. Mrs. M. is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 400 to revitalize her business so as to make a reasonable profit from it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, madame Tassi M. est âgée de 25 ans et vit au côté de son mari dans le village d’Atséti. Sa principale activité est la production du gari qu’elle commercialise. La matière première étant le manioc, elle achète celui-ci chez les cultivateurs dans les champs. La chaîne de cette activité reste périlleuse (déterrer, amasser, peler, laver, râper, presser, tamiser puis torrifier) et nécessite une main d’œuvre importante ; ce qui rétrécit le gari. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour redynamiser l’activité et couvrir les charges afin de pouvoir dégager une marge acceptable de revenu.

loans.use:
Pay labor costs and for purchase of manioc for flour

Allouer des gens et achat de manioc

loans.name: Dede

texts.en: Dede is 31 years old and is a mother of a 13 year old daughter. She has been producing and selling cakes together with her husband. She goes around to various places to offer and sell her cakes and usually earns $4 per day. She needs $100 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her cake business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an assorted stock of second hand shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dovi A., 24, is married and mother of three children. She lives with her family in the village of Atséti where she makes palm oil. When plenty of palm nuts are available, she buys them up and produces palm oil which she then keeps to sell when it is in short supply. Unfortunately, the income from this business is not nearly enough to supply the basic needs of her family. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 300 so that she can purchase a sufficient quantity of palm nuts. This will allow her to make a greater profit so that she can better support herself and her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Dovi A. de 24 ans d’âge est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille dans le village d’Atséti où elle exerce son activité de production d’huile de palme. En temps d’abondance, elle achète les noix de palme avec lesquelles elle produit de l’huile qu’elle stocke pour revendre en période de pénurie. Cependant, le revenu tiré de cette activité reste insuffisant et elle est très loin de satisfaire ses besoins les plus élémentaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $300 afin d’acheter en quantité suffisante des noix. Ceci lui permettra de dégager une marge importante de revenu pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat en quantité de noix de palme et vente

loans.name: Folivi

texts.fr:
Mr. Folivi K. was born on December 31, 1950 in Anfoin, Togo. He is a retired electrician and lives in the Djidjolé district. His pension is not enough to support his household, so he has opened a little shop selling electrical supplies. In order to better stock his shop and improve his turnover, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000. This will permit him to cater for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Folivi K. est né le 31 décembre 1950 à anfoin. Electro-technicien de formation en retraite, il réside à djidjolé. Sa pension ne lui permettant pas de satisfaire le ménage, il a ouvert une boutique de vente des produits d’électricité. Pour approvisionner sa boutique et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, il sollicite un montant de $1000. Ceci lui permettra également de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use:
stocking electrical supplies for resale

S'approvisionner en produits d'electricité

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Aged 41, Mrs. Afi L., who originally comes from Tahonou, lives with her husband in Atséti in the Vo prefecture. Married with three children, she is totally involved in agriculture. She grows corn and chili peppers. However, the poor state of the soil does not give a good yield. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy fertilizers and rent a tractor to prepare her field.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, madame Afi L., originaire de Tahonou, vit avec son mari à Atséti dans la préfecture de Vo. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle s’est totalement adonnée à l’agriculture. Elle fait la culture de maïs et de piment. Mais l’appauvrissement des sols ne favorise pas un bon rendement. Elle sollicite un crédit de $200 pour acheter les fertilisants et de louer un tracteur pour la préparation de son champ.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a tractor

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a small entrepreneur owning a pharmacy shop. She is married to Fredrick Kaleme, who is a businessman, and she has two children ages 2 and 7. She is a very hard worker and has the ambition to become one of the best medicine sellers in the district. This is Maria's first loan request. She is asking for a loan of USD 525 to buy a used refrigerator. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a used refrigerator

loans.name: Houngnameto

texts.fr:
Mrs. Houngnameto A. is 40 years old and the mother of six children. With her husband, she works in agriculture and for the past several years has been involved in converting cassava into gari (a creamy-white, granular flour made from fermented, gelatinized fresh cassava tubers). She often buys cassava on credit from the fields. Once she has produced and sold the gari, she repays her loan. This system does not allow her any significant profit margin. This is why she is requesting a loan of $250 to buy cassava in bulk for the production of gari. This would give her financial independence.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Houngnameto A. est âgée de 40 ans et mère de six (06) enfants. Au côté de son mari, elle exerce l’agriculture et depuis quelques années, elle s’est attelée à transformer le manioc en gari. Elle achète souvent à crédit le manioc dans les champs. Après la production et la commercialisation du gari, elle rembourse son crédit. Ce système ne lui permet pas de dégager une marge de revenu importante. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $250 pour acheter en quantité du manioc pour la production du gari. Ceci lui permettra d’avoir une indépendance financière.

loans.use: To buy cassava in bulk for the production of gari

loans.name: Vigoumidé

texts.fr:
A store owner in her own neighborhood of Djidjolé, Mrs. Vigoumidé K. was born on November 5, 1962 in Anfoin. She has five children to look after as her husband is retired and can no longer provide for the family. Mrs. K. has a small general food store but does not have the means to satisfy the demands of her customers. To supply her store and meet customer demand, Vigoumidé is asking for a loan of $400.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Revendeuse à djidjolé où elle réside, Madame Vigoumidé K. est née le 05 novembre 1962 à anfoin. Elle a 05 enfants à sa charge car son mari en retraite n’arrivait plus à subvenir à tous les besoins de la famille. Madame K. a une boutique d’alimentation générale mais ses moyens ne lui permettent pas de satisfaire la demande des clients. Pour alimenter sa boutique et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle Vigoumidé sollicite un prêt de $400.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general food store

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a small entrepreneur owning a pharmacy shop. She is married to Hashimu Abdallah and has two children ages 4 and 6. Her husband works with the Tanzania Railways Authority. Aisha is one of the best entrepreneurs who is focusing in the Morden business. This is the third loan to request she has made to SELFINA. Aisha is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy an air conditioner for cooling the office. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy baking ingredients and improve the physical appearance of her business

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Miss Françoise A. was born on July 14, 1987 in Lomé. As she did not have the financial means to continue with her studies, she chose to become a hairdresser. Today she has finished her apprenticeship and wants to open her own hairdressing salon. She is single with one child and lives in Lomé’s Agbalépedogan neighborhood. She has to work with her friend, and for this reason she would like a loan of $600 to use to open her own hairdressing salon.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle Françoise A. est née le 14 Juillet 1987 à Lomé. Ne pouvant plus continuer ses études faute de moyens financiers, elle a préféré faire la coiffure. Aujourd’hui, elle a terminé son apprentissage et elle veut ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant et réside au quartier Agbalépedogan à Lomé. Elle est obligée d’aller travailler avec sa copine, c’est pour cela qu’elle voulait un prêt de $600 qui lui servira d’ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure.

loans.use: To open a hairdressing salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the business stall, and to purchase additional stock for shoes, including shoe soles, and leather

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a small entrepreneur owning a shop in the central market. She is not married and has two children ages 7 and 9 years. Anna is thirsty for development for the benefit of her family and society. This is Anna's second loan request with SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a refrigerator. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Amavi S. is a widow who was born on December 31, 1952 in Tado. A resident of the Djidjolé neighborhood, she is a dressmaker by profession and has five children in her care. Her small savings do not allow her to open her own studio, which has led to a loss in customers. She is asking for a loan of $400 to open a studio and buy sewing machines so that she can provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Veuve Amavi S. est née le 31 décembre 1952 à Tado. Résidante dans le quartier djidjolé, elle est couturière de profession, et a 05 enfants à sa charge. Ses maigres économies ne lui permettent pas d’ouvrir son atelier ce qui lui fait perdre sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de $400 pour ouvrir un atelier, acheter des machines afin de pouvoir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her general food store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a small entrepreneur that sells clothes in Dar es Salaam. She is married to Stephen Mandara and has two children ages 15 and 20. Mary is a very hard worker and really loves her job and being an entrepreneur. This is Mary's third loan request from SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a big show case and office furniture. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy big showcase and office furniture

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Hanou M. was born on March 11, 1960 in Aného in the lakes prefecture. She buys and sells children’s clothing at the large market in Lomé. She is married and looks after all six of her children. Mrs. M. is asking for a loan of $1,000 so she can get a consistent stock for the end-of-year holidays and satisfy her customers and grow her income.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Hanou M. est née le 11 Mars 1960 à Aného dans la préfecture des lacs. Elle est commerçante d’habits d’enfants et d’habits pour enfants au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Madame Hanou M. sollicite un prêt de $1000 pour faire un stock consistant pour les fêtes de fin d’année afin de bien satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus.

loans.use: To buy and sell children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO MAKE NECESSARY REPAIRS TO HER SHOP, AS WELL AS INCREASE HER STOCK TO BETTER SERVE HER CUSTOMERS.  AS A SINGLE MOTHER AND THE SOLE PROVIDER FOR HER TWO CHILDREN, SHE HOPES TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, Mrs. Akouvi T. was born on April 27, 1963 in Gapé Aloyi. Her husband is an electrician but is unable to meet all the family’s needs, so his wife has to help provide for their children. She sells clothing for babies and children, and beauty products at the large market in Lomé. As she lacks the means to buy her supplies from wholesalers, she is requesting financial support of $1,000 to make new purchases.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, madame Akouvi T. est née le 27 Avril 1963 à Gapé Aloyi. Etant électronicien, le mari n’arrive pas à satisfaire totalement les besoins de sa famille et ainsi la femme est obligée de l’aider à subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants. Elle est revendeuse d’habits pour enfants, de trousseaux bébé et de produits de beauté au grand marché de Lomé. Elle manque de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner chez les grossistes. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un apport financier de $1000 pour faire de nouveaux achats.

loans.use: To buy children's and baby clothing, and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HER SHOP AND PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Délali Kossivi

texts.fr:
Born on October 30, 1977 in Lomé, Mr. Délali Kossivi S. is a mechanic/metal turner and lives in Djidjolé. He is married and has one child. He has a studio that is not fully operational because does not have enough machinery. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy machinery so that his studio can operate efficiently and make a reasonable profit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 30 octobre 1977 à Lomé, Monsieur Délali Kossivi S. est mécanicien tourneur et réside à djidjolé. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a un atelier qui ne fonctionne pas bien par manque de machines. Il sollicite un crédit de $1000 afin d’acheter les machines pour un bon fonctionnement de son atelier et réaliser un profit raisonnable.

loans.use: To buy machinery

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a small entrepreneur dealing with livestock and owning chickens and cows. She is married to Christopher M. who works with Narco company and has four children ages 14, 15, 20, and 27 years. She loves her job dealing with animals. This is the second loan request Mariamu has brought to SELFINA. She is asking a loan of USD 875 to buy an incubator machine to hatch eggs. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy an incubator to hatch eggs and water containers

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera H. is 27 years old, and is single. Sera has three orphaned relatives aged 18, 12, and 6 years respectively, who she takes care of because there is no one else left in her family to take care of them. She has lived with them since they were toddlers. Sera lives in Kabete town, where she intends to operate her stall from. Sera was introduced to Action Now Kenya by her employer who saw her great potential in day care, after caring for her child as a nanny. 

Sera intends to open a stall in Kabete town on the outskirts of Nairobi where she will be selling children clothes and also she will have the opportunity of advertising her day care services, while selling the clothes.  She intends to open a day care business in the future, once she is well settled in business. Using her business, she will also use the opportunity to educate women on nutrition and the best way to feed their children.  Sera is therefore kindly requesting a loan for Ksh 20,000.  With this loan, Sera will be able to purchase a bale of second-hand clothes, hangers and stationeries, and she will also put up a notice board from which she will receive some income out of every advertisement put up by her clients. The repayment period for her loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase one bale of second hand clothes, hangers, and to put up a public notice board.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr:
Born November 11th, 1960, Mrs. Joséphine G. is a widow and mother of four children. She lives in the Adawlato neighborhood of Lomé and is a retailer of infant and children's clothing. She became and everywoman after the death of her husband in order to take care of her children. She is seeking a $1000 loan to stock clothing from wholesalers, which will increase her income.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 11 Novembre 1960, Madame Joséphine G. est veuve et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle réside au quartier d’Adawlato à Lomé et est revendeuse de trousseaux bébé et d’habits pour enfants. Elle est devenue la femme à tout faire après la mort de son mari, pour bien entretenir ses enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner en habits pour enfants et trousseaux chez les grossistes ce qui augmentera ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of infant and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Bessi Afiwa

texts.fr:
Widow and mother of two children, Mrs. Afiwa M. was born in Aného February 12th, 1965 and lives in the Adawlato neighborhood of Lomé. She is a retailer of infant and children's clothing at Lomé's central market. Since the death of her husband, she has been struggling to provide for her children alone. As the year-end holidays approach, she is seeking a $1000 loan to stock new clothing and infant supplies in order to satisfy customer demand and improve her income.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Veuve et mère de deux (02) enfants, madame Bessi Afiwa M. est née à Aného le 12 février 1965 et réside dans le quartier d’Adawlato à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse d’habits pour enfants et de trousseaux bébé au grand marché de Lomé. Après la mort de son mari, elle se démerde seule afin de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants. A l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour s’approvisionner en nouveautés d’habits et trousseaux afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et d’améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of children's clothing

loans.name: Assiba Amélé

texts.fr:
Ms. Assiba Amélé G. was born October 31st, 1971 in Lomé. Trained as a judge, she also supports herself with secondary activities such as trade. She lives in Djidjolé neighborhood and is seeking a $1000 loan to extend her retail activities buying and selling products imported from France.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Mademoiselle Assiba Amélé G. est née le 31 octobre 1971 à Lomé. Juriste de formation, elle fait aussi d’autres activités parallèles comme le commerce. Elle habite à Djidjolé et sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour l’extension de ses activités d’achat et vente des produits divers qu’on lui envoie de la France.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of retail goods

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abla A. was born May 31, 1977 in Lomé. She lives in the Djidjolé district of Lomé, where she has a bar/restaurant and specializes in serving “foufou” (mashed yams). She is a married mother who is alone responsible for taking care of her two (02) children. She is requesting a loan of $200 for the wholesale purchase of cassava, yams and corn from local farmers. This will allow her to expand her business and to develop a loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Abla A. est née le 31 Mai 1977 à Lomé. Demeurant dans le quartier de Djidjolé à Lomé, elle est gérante d’un restaurant-bar de foufou (igname pilée). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants qui sont à sa charge. Elle sollicite une somme de $200 pour acheter chez les paysans les maniocs, les ignames, le maïs en gros. Ceci lui permettra d’agrandir son commerce et de fidéliser sa clientèle.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of yams, cassava and corn

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is small entrepreneur who sells charcoal. She is married to Bryson Kamde, who works with the Tanzania Civil Aviation Authority, and has two children ages 2 and 3. Sophia is a very hard worker and now she wants to open another business to deal with tailoring. She really loves to be an entrepreneur. This is the fourth loan request she has made to SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a scale and sewing machines for the new business. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy scale and sewing machines for new shop

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a small entrepreneur who owns a stationary shop in Dar es Salaam. She is married to Phines Kalema, who is retired from the civil service, and has five children ages 2, 10, 13, 15, and 17 years old. Leticia loves her job (it has been a dream to her when she decided to be an entrepreneur) and provides for her family. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a new computer set. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a new computer set

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr:
Born August 14, 1936, Ms. Kanlé K. lives in Djidjolé, where she has founded a school. She is married to a retired journalist and takes care of one child. This year the number of students in her school increased, but there are not enough classrooms for all of them. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to build classrooms in order to provide her students with a good learning environment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 14 août 1936 Madame Kanlé K. est fondatrice d’école et réside à Djidjolé. Elle est mariée à un journaliste en retraite et a à sa charge un enfant. Cette année son effectif a augmenté et les salles de classe sont insuffisantes. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour la construction des salles de classes afin d’offrir une bonne condition d’étude à ses élèves.

loans.use: Building classrooms

loans.name: Winifrida

texts.en:
Winfrida is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling soft drinks and mineral water. She is not married and has one child aged 5 years. She really enjoys her job and dreams to become a successful entrepreneur. This is her second loan request to SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 875 to buy a big showcase, chairs, tables, and improve her stock . She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a big showcase, chairs, tables, and improve her stock

loans.name: Asumini

texts.en:
Asumini is a small entrepreneur who owns a pharmacy shop selling all types of human medicine. She is married to Juma Kiongozi and has four children ages 15, 23, 25 and 27. Asumini is a very hard working woman and really struggles for her family. This is her second loan request from SELFINA. She is asking for a loan of USD 525 to buy a used small refrigerator and improve her stock. She is proposing to repay in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a used refrigerator and improve her stock

loans.name: Abravi Djigbodi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abravi Djigbodi G. was born December 19, 1967 in Kpalimé. When she found herself unemployed, she decided to open a general food store. She is a married mother of two (02) children and lives in the Adidogomé district. She is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase items for her store. This will allow her to expand her business and to meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Abravi Djigbodi G. est née le 19 Décembre 1967 à Kpalimé. Etant en chômage, elle a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle réside dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Elle sollicite un montant de $600 pour approvisionner sa boutique. Ce qui lui permettra d’agrandir la taille de son commerce et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products to compliment the ones he's already selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.es:
Martha is one of many mothers that are alone in raising their children due to the fact that her husband went to the United States to work. She has to struggle to raise her children well. Since there are long periods of time where her husband can not find a stable job in the U.S. She does not recieve enough money to pay for the needs of her children. That is how she began to sell cosmetic supplies to her friends and neighbors by catalog. Later she began to sell shoes and crafts. Presently she has more clients.

However, she has taken a special liking to the selling of clothing products and for that reason, she has decided to buy winter clothing, that way she can offer them to her clients. This is why she is asking for a loan of $650 that she will repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to buy clothing to sell, like jackets, jeans, and sweaters. With your help Martha will support her children even though her husband is so far away.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Martha es una de tantas mujeres mexicanas que se quedan a cargo de sus hijos puesto que su esposo de fue a Estados Unidos a trabajar, y ella tiene que luchar por sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ya que hay largas temporadas en que su esposo no consigue trabajo en Estados Unidos no recibe tan rápido dinero que le manda y los gastos de sus dos hijos no esperan, fue así como comenzó por ofrecerles a sus amigas y vecinas cosméticos por catálogo, y después empezó a vender zapatos y manualidades. Actualmente tiene más clientas.

Sin embargo ya le tomó un cariño muy especial a la venta de productos, y es por esto que está decidida a comprar ropa de temporada de invierno para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $650 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar ropa, como chamarras, pantalones, y suéteres. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos a pesar de que su esposo se encuentra tan lejos.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to boost her supply of products.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
