Josefina needed to start a business to be able to pay for the expenses of her home, due to the fact that her husband was the only one in family who worked outside of the home. The family’s expenses grew greater than his income was able to cover. The family was unable to pay their bills and experienced very hard economic times. However, Josefina was determined to save her family and she thought of a business that would allow her to earn enough to pay for the expenses of her family and that also didn’t take away so much time that she would leave her children unattended. That is how she began her business of selling used clothing. She started by asking her father, who worked in the United States, to send her used clothing so that she could sell it to her neighbors and friends.

Little by little, she began getting more and more customers and she needed to buy larger quantities of clothing. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of $500 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to go to Reynosa to buy large quantities of winter clothing which she will sell to her customers. With your help, Josefina and her family will be able to improve their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Josefina tuvo que obtener un negocio para poder ayudar en los gastos del hogar, puesto que su esposo quien era el único que trabajaba, no supo administrar el dinero que ganaba y los gastos cada vez se iban haciendo más grandes de lo que ganaba y poco a poco con los recibos de luz agua, y los gastos que tenían sus hijos fueron entrando en una crisis. Sin embargo la lucha por salir adelante hizo que Josefina pudiera pensar con claridad en un negocio que les dejara lo suficiente para poder completar con los gastos del hogar, y no le quitara tanto tiempo como para descuidar el crecimiento de sus hijos. Fue así como comenzó a pedirle a su papá quien trabaja en Estados Unidos que le mandara ropa usada para ella poder ofrecérselas a sus vecinas y amigas.

Poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientas y está teniendo la necesidad de comprar por más cantidades la ropa. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá ir a Reynosa a comprar por mayoreo ropa usada de invierno para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Josefina y su familia podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy winter clothes

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Amanda is 61 years old. She was widowed many years ago and then began a relationship with Isidro who is 60 years old and she's lived with him for more than 12 years now.

Amanda has had a well stocked pantry-store in her house for approximately the last ten years. She told us that she worked as a seamstress for 16 years in a well-known shop in Asunción, the capital of Paraguay, until one day she decided to return to her home-town, Itá, and this was when she established her grocery store, which today is one of the best known in the area.

She now needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, drinks etc. as the end-of-year festivities are already approaching when there is more money circulating, which means that demand for these products rises.

Translated by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Amada tiene 61 años. Enviudó hace muchos años y volvió a juntarse con Isidro que tiene 60 años y con quien convive hace ya más de 12 años.

Amada tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa desde hace 10 años aproximadamente. Ella nos cuenta que trabajó como costurera durante 16 años en una conocida tienda de Asunción, (capital del Paraguay) hasta que un día decidió volver a su ciudad natal, Itá, y fue cuando montó su despensa que hoy día es una de las más concurridas del barrio.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para comprar más mercaderías como harina, azúcar, arroz, fideo, bebidas, etc. ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y es cuando hay más circulación de dinero, lo que ocasiona que la demanda de estos productos aumenta.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, noodles, soft drinks, rice etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 30 years old, he is separated and has a 1 year old daughter who is cared for by his ex-wife.

Antonio is a photographer: he began to work with his father in the business from when he was very small, until he managed to establish himself independently 7 years ago. He acquired the knowledge, skills and techniques of the profession when he used to accompany his father to social evens where they required his services.

Toady he has managed to establish his own business and he has very good clientèle: he recounts that all is going well and he is very happy with his profession. Antonio, thanks to his work, is also managing to meet all the expenses of university, where he in the third year of a law degree.

He needs a loan to buy film for his camera, photo alums and also blank CDs, which he already uses to record different social and family events such as weddings, birthdays, end-of-year celebrations etc.

Translated by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio tiene 30 años, es separado y tiene una hija de 1 año que quedó al cuidado de su ex-esposa.

Antonio es fotógrafo, empezó a trabajar con su padre en la profesión desde muy pequeño, hasta que logró independizarse hace 7 años. Adquirió los conocimientos y las técnicas de la profesión cuando acompañaba a su padre a los eventos sociales en donde requerían de sus servicios.

Hoy día ha logrado montar su propio negocio y tiene muy buena clientela, él cuenta que le va muy bien y que está muy feliz con su profesión. Antonio además, gracias a su trabajo, está logrando costear todos los gastos que demanda la universidad, en donde está estudiando el 3er. Año de la carrera de Derecho (Leyes).

Necesita el crédito para la compra de películas para su cámara fotográfica, álbumes de fotografías, además de CD vírgenes, ya que también realiza filmaciones de diferentes acontecimientos sociales y familiares, tales como bodas, cumpleaños, clausuras de fin de año, etc.

loans.use: Purchase camera film, albums, blank CDs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her eatery

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Business Description

Jorge has 20 years experience selling clothes such as skirts, blouses and t-shirts. He was able to obtained some cash from some of his friends to be able to open up his own business. His products varied according to the seasons. His work hours are from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. His wife helps him by selling fish throughout the week.

Loan Use

He will use the loan to purchase a variety of products to add to his merchandise. His products are in high demand and he has a lot of orders. He will also use the loan to purchase more fish so that his wife can sell from home.

Personal Information

Jorge is 47 years old. He's married and he has a baby. His house is made out of reed, and he lives near a creek. He hopes that his income will improve so that he can fix his house little by little. Most importantly to give him peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jorge tiene una experiencia de 20 años con su actividad en la venta de prendas de vestir, faldas, blusas, camisas. Por medio de unos amigos pudo conseguir capital y comenzar a trabajar. Sus productos son variados de acuerdo a la temporada en la cual se encuentra. Su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. Además su esposa le ayuda con la venta de pescado salado todos los días de la semana.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de mercadería variada. Tiene bastantes pedidos. Además de compra de pescado para que su esposa venda en el portal de su domicilio.

Información Personal

Jorge tiene 47 años. Es casado y tiene 1 bebe. Su casita es de caña y vive a la orilla del estero. Espera poder mejorar sus ingresos para poco a poco ir adecuando su domicilio. Mas que todo darle seguridad.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and to help his wife with her business as well

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is 39 years old and for the last four years he has lived as a couple with Gladys who is 25 years old. Together they have a three-year old daughter who is adored by the young couple.

Jorge tells us that he started in the hairdressing profession 18 years ago: he is a professional hairdresser who has studied to achieve this professional qualification and is one of the most well-known in his town, Ita. His salon is completely equipped and his clientèle consists of boys, teenagers and men of all ages.

Thanks to his work he has managed to build his own house and also owns his own car. According to Jorge, the weekends are when he has the largest number of clients.

He needs a loan to buy creams, shampoo, hair conditioner, gel etc. that he uses in his salon.

Translated by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge tiene 39 años y vive en pareja desde hace 4 años con Gladys que tiene 25 años. Juntos tienen una hija de 3 años y que es la adoración de la joven pareja.

Jorge cuenta que se inició en la profesión de peluquero hace 18 años, es peluquero profesional ya que estudió para adquirir dicha profesión y es uno de los más conocidos de su ciudad (Itá). Cuenta con un local totalmente equipado y su clientela está constituida por niños, adolescentes y hombres de todas las edades.

Gracias a su trabajo logró edificar su casa propia y también cuenta con vehiculo propio. Según comentó, los fines de semana es cuando tiene mayor afluencia de clientela.

Necesita de un crédito para la compra de cremas, shampoo, acondicionadores para el cabello, gel, etc. que utiliza en su peluquería.

loans.use: Purchase shampoos, creams, talcum powder, hair conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Laureana

texts.es:
Laurena, aged 53, cohabited for 15 years until the day when she and her partner separated, and since then she has been in charge of caring for her two daughters from the relationship. These daughters now are 25 and 17 years old respectively. While the elder has finished her teacher training, the younger is still in secondary school. Although the elder daughter now has a profession, she helps her mother in the haberdashers’ shop she has set-up in the Ita town market, because she still doesn’t have a place in which to practice her career.

Laureana remarks that twenty years ago she started selling food until one day, as a result of ill-health and as a result of medical advice, she had to change her field of business, so in this way started to sell all types of clothes and shoes.

Today, she can count on a well-established customer base and she doesn’t have any days off: she can be found in her workplace every day, offering her merchandise

Laureana needs a loan to buy more T-Shirts, jeans, sports shoes etc. due to the fact that the end-of-year holidays are approaching and this is the time when there is most demand.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Laureana de 53 años vivió en pareja durante 15 años hasta que un día se separó y desde entonces se ha encargado de cuidar a sus dos hijas frutos de dicha unión. Las mismas actualmente tienen 25 y 17 años respectivamente. Mientras la mayor ha terminado la carrera de docente, la menor aún sigue con sus estudios en la secundaria. Aunque la hija mayor ya cuenta con una profesión, ayuda a su madre en la mercería que tiene montada en el mercado de la ciudad de Itá, debido a que aún no cuenta con un rubro para ejercer su profesión.

Laureana comenta que hace 20 años inició un negocio de ventas de comidas hasta que un día, por problemas de salud y por recomendación médica, tuvo que cambiar de rubro iniciándose de dicha manera en la venta de prendas y calzados de vestir de todo tipo.

Hoy día cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada y no conoce de días de lluvia ni descanso debido a que todos los días se encuentra firme en su puesto de trabajo ofreciendo sus mercaderías.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de más remeras, jeans, calzados deportivos, blusas, etc. debido a que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y es cuando mayor demanda tiene.

loans.use: Purcahse of t-shirts, jeans, sandals, sport shoes etc.

loans.name: Chikuwa Group

texts.es:
The clients of the ComUnity (the term used by Friendship Bridge for their communal banks) Chikuwa have an astute and patient attitude, a combination that helps them to be the great business women that they currently are. The clients of ComUnity Chikuwa are models of micro-entrepreneurial women.

Several members of the group started selling huipiles (traditional Guatamalan dresses) and shoes in the streets of San Juan la Laguna, Sololá. However, with their current loan many of them have become successful business owners. For example, Susan U. now has ten artisans working for her during the high season such as Christmas. Clara P. is a micro-entrepreneur who began with a small business raising animals and who is now buying 100 chickens per month in order to fatten them and resell them 21 days later. Cecilia U. decided to move into an unexplored field for many micro-entrepreneurs. She has a honey bee business. In addition, she has a windmill that she rents for grinding corn (an essential component for the preparation of corn tortillas).

The loans will be used in different ways. Many women are going to buy thread in order to make huipiles and embroidery. Clara P. is going to use her loan to purchase more chickens, while María M. is going to buy another windmill. María Y. is going to invest her money in her diner. She needs a loan in order to purchase glasses, plates, benches and tables.

María M.’s dream is that her business will prosper so that she will be able to open a hammock store and sell hanging beds in natural colors typical of the region. Elena C. dreams of opening a successful knitting store. In that way she would be able to purchase more work from her providers and thereby have a positive impact on their lives. These business women are very important for Friendship Bridge and Guatemala. They only need some initial help in order to move forward, and you could be the one to give them that aid.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Las clientas de la ComUnidad (término que Friendship Bridge usa para nombrar a un banco comunal) Chikuwa tienen una actitud astuta y paciente, una combinación que las ayuda a ser las grandes empresarias que actualmente son. Las clientas la ComUnidad Chikuwa son ejemplares micro empreasarias.

Varias clientas empezaron vendiendo huipiles (trajes tradicionales de Guatemala) y zapatos en las calles de San Juan la Laguna, Sololá. Sin embargo, con el préstamo recibido ahora muchas de ellas se han vuelto clientas exitosas. Por ejemplo, Susana U. ya tiene diez artesanas trabajando para ella durante las temporadas altas, como Navidad. Clara P., es una empresaria que empezó con un pequeño negocio de crianza de animales y ahora está comprando 100 pollos al mes para engordarlos y revenderlos 21 días después. Cecilia U., decidió incursionar en un campo inexplorado por muchas microempresarias. Ella tiene un negocio de miel de abejas. Además, tienen un molino el cual lo alquila para moler el maíz (componente esencial para la preparación de tortillas de maíz).

Los préstamos van a ser utilizado de distintas maneras. Muchas señoras van a comprar hilos para tejer huipiles y para bordados. Clara P., va a usar su préstamo para comprar más pollos, mientras que María M. va a comprar otro molino. María Y. va ha invertir su crédito en su comedor. Ella necesita el crédito para comprar vasos, platos, bancos y mesas.

El sueño de María M. es que su negocio prospere para que así ella pueda abrir una tienda de hamacas y cubre camas teñidas a base de tintes naturales típicos de la región. Elena C. sueña con abrir una tienda de tejidos exitosa. Como consecuencia ella podría pedir más tejidos a sus proveedoras y causar un impacto importante en la vida de ellas. Estás empresarias son muy importantes para Friendship Bridge y Guatemala, ellas sólo necesitan un apoyo inicial para que puedan destacar, y ese apoyo lo puedes brindar tú.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for making traditional dresses.  Resale of traditional clothing.  Raising of animals.  Expansion of a diner.  The purchase of a windmill for corn.

payments.comment: Because of technical problems the amount repaid could not be posted. The trust bank Chikuwa is doing great they are paying on time, and the clients are saving a portion of their income

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
At the market, Araba sells cassava, plantains, and palm nut on a table stand. Plantains are used in a very popular and common Ghanaian dish called fufu. When you walk down the streets in Ghana, you can see and hear the noise of people pounding plantains, cassava, and yam to make fufu. Cassava and palm nuts are also very popular in traditional Ghanaian dishes.

Araba is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba (meaning "God will come") of Elmina. The group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer support provides the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of this group have known each other for many years and provide a lot of support for each other as they all work inside the Elmina market.

One challenge that Araba faces is the fact that cassava becomes rotten in a relatively short period of time. So, Araba has become a very good saleswoman in order to sell all of her all stock. As a result, Araba now needs a loan to purchase even more plantains, cassava, and palm nuts. She wants to maintain these three products because they are the most profitable for her to sell.

Right now her youngest child just graduated from high school and is waiting for his exam scores to see if he’s going to university. Araba is saving her profits to enable her to send her son to the university when he gets the results.

loans.use: Araba will use to loan to increase her stock of goods and get more profits to support her family.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is 45 years old. She co-habited with Miguel for 24 years, until she was widowed three years ago, leaving her in charge of their business that they started together when the began their relationship.

Mercedes owns a butcher’s shop, she recounts with much sadness that when her partner died, she had many difficulties in taking over this and the grocery store which they managed together, as it was he who had largely taken care of the businesses. Despite this, she managed to continue forward alone, with the help of her 5 children aged 28, 24, 22, 19 and 13 years-old respectively. Today only the youngest of them lives with her, while the rest are already married and have established their own homes although they continue to help her with the family business.

Today her business continues to function well, with a well-established customer base, and she struggles day-by-day to advance.

Mercedes needs a loan in order to buy livestock which she will then farm in order to sell the meat in her butcher’s shop.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Mercedes tiene 45 años. Vivió en pareja durante 24 años con Miguel hasta que enviudó hace 3 años quedándose a cargo del negocio que montaron juntos cuando comenzaron la relación.

Mercedes posee una carnicería, cuenta con mucha tristeza que cuando falleció su pareja tuvo muchas dificultades para retomar el negocio de la carnicería y la despensa que manejaban juntos, debido a que él se ocupaba mayormente de dichos negocios. No obstante logró salir adelante sola con la ayuda de sus cinco hijos de 28, 24, 22, 19 y 13 años respectivamente. Hoy día solamente la menor de todos vive con ella, mientras que los demás ya están casados y han formado sus propios hogares aunque continúan ayudando en el negocio familiar.

Hoy día su negocio continúa bastante bien, cuenta con clientela bien formada y ella lucha día a día por salir adelante.

Necesita de un crédito para la compra de animales vivos que luego faena para vender la carne en su carnicería.

loans.use: Purcahse Livestock

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina is 37 years old, she has cohabited with Luis, aged 41, for the last seventeen years . The couple have managed to raise five children who today are 20, 17, 15, 13 and 8 years old respectively. The eldest of her children has already found a job, while the four youngest are still studying.

Regina occupies herself buying and selling of meat and other off-cuts, which she does from her own house. She comments that previously she used to undertake the same activity in the capital city until one day she was mugged and this was when she decided to return to Ita, which is where she has her home, in order to establish her own business.

She remarks that business is going well, she has a well-established clientele and her principal wish is to continue to expand her small business.

Regina needs a loan in order to buy more meat and other off-cuts and offal such as liver, kidneys, tongue etc., as there is a lot of demand for these products at the end of the year.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Regina tiene 37 años, vive en pareja hace 17 años con Luis que tiene 41 años de edad. La pareja ha logrado criar a 5 hijos que hoy día tienen 20, 17, 15, 13 y 8 años respectivamente. El mayor de sus hijos ya ha conseguido un trabajo, mientras que los cuatro últimos aún siguen estudiando.

Regina se dedica a la compra y venta de carnes y menudencias que comercializa en su propia casa. Comenta que anteriormente desempeñaba la misma actividad en la ciudad capital hasta que un día la asaltaron y fue cuando decidió volver a Itá, que es donde tiene su casa propia, a fin de montar dicho negocio.

Comenta que le va muy bien, cuenta con una clientela muy bien formada y su principal deseo es acrecentar cada vez más su pequeño negocio.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un préstamo para comprar más carnes y menudencias vacunas como hígado, riñón, lengua etc., debido a que tiene mucha demanda de estos productos en fin de año.

loans.use: Purcahse of meat and offal

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia is 57 years old and is married to Antonio, aged 60 who is a salesman. They have three children, all adults, who thanks to the effort made by the couple have managed to access higher education and thus to train for a profession.

She owns a grocery store in which she stocks all the basic store cupboard items for the home. She remarks that she was living in Argentina where she worked as a domestic for five years, until she decided to return to her own country and establish her own business. From then on she has always kept a well-stocked pantry and she comments that she has very little competition and as a result her business is going very well.

She always turned to the Foundation’s loans, as they invested in her store. Now she needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as sugar, flour, oils etc., as these are in high demand at this time of year.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Flavia de 57 años está casada con Antonio de 60 años de profesión comerciante y tienen 3 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad, que gracias al esfuerzo de la pareja han logrado tener acceso a estudios superiores y así hacerse de una profesión.

Posee una despensa donde cuenta con todos los artículos básicos para el hogar. Comenta que estuvo viviendo en la Argentina donde trabajó como empleada doméstica durante 5 años, hasta que un día decidió volver al país y montar su propio negocio. Desde ese entonces cuenta con una despensa muy bien surtida y según comentó tiene muy poca competencia por lo que le va muy bien en su negocio.

Siempre recurrió a los préstamos de la Fundación, los cuales invierte en su despensa. En esta oportunidad necesita del crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, harina, aceites, etc. debido a que tiene mucha demanda en esta época del año.

loans.use: Purcahse of oil, rice, dulce de leche, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Ana Luisa Reynoso

texts.en:
Ana is a young businesswoman from Yamasá. She has three children that attend school. With her husband’s help, she started a grocery last year. She remodeled a locale and fitted out the space so that she could show the goods. People go to her general store to obtain different kinds of products such as vegetables, spaghetti, a box of matches, toilet paper, rice, milk and other foodstuffs.

Ana wants to supply her business with products which are running low. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks such as beer, juice, and energy drinks like Cyclon, Monster, and Toro which are much demanded by the customers. Ana will also acquire some sacks of rice and beans, and vegetable oil. She wants to obtain the products at the wholesale market in order to have them at very low cost. That way, the businesswoman will increase her sales volume and her income.

This will be the second loan Ana will take from our FSMA. Her first loan was used wisely and repaid on time.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to supply a grocery store

loans.name: Herma

texts.es:
Herma is 61 years old, and has been married for 31 years to Eladio; they have three children, all of whom are now adults. Herma works making cigars from tobacco leaves (which resemble Cuban cigars).

When she was very young she began working as a domestic employee and at the same time she used to help her mother to roll cigars, as these skills were passed from generation to generation. This is how she learnt the profession.

She relates that she had to emigrate to Argentina (Paraguay’s neighbouring country), where she worked eight years as a domestic employee. Then she returned to her country, where she married and had a family, which was when she decided to work rolling cigars.

Herma tells us that she always has been a hardworking mother, from a humble family and with her husband she has worked very hard to be able to build their home, from where her small cigar factory operates today . She now has various employees and the cigars are marketed wholesale, taking their products to different towns.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Herma de 61 años está casada hace 31 años con Eladio y tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad. Herma se dedica a la elaboración de cigarros de hojas de tabaco (parecido al habano).

Desde muy joven comenzó trabajando de empleada doméstica y al mismo tiempo ayudaba a su madre en la fabricación de los cigarros ya que dicha actividad provenía de generación en generación. Es así como aprendió el oficio.

Comenta que tuvo que emigrar a la Argentina (país limítrofe con Paraguay) en donde trabajó durante 8 años como empleada doméstica. Luego volvió al país, en donde se casó y formó su familia, fue allí que se decidió a trabajar en la elaboración de los cigarros.

Herma comenta que siempre fue una mujer trabajadora, de familia humilde y que con su esposo trabajaron muy duro para poder construir su hogar, en donde hoy día funciona su pequeña fábrica de cigarros. Hoy cuenta con varios empleados ya que se dedican a la venta al por mayor llevando sus productos a diferentes ciudades.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale bundles of tobacco leaves

loans.name: Damasa Martinez

texts.en:
Damasa has been selling curtains and sets of bedding for more than eighteen years. She has learned the rules of the market and is now a very experienced businesswoman with extraordinary abilities to attract people to her business and hold them. She has four sons who are married; her two daughters go to the university in Santo Domingo, the capital.

Damasa wants to push her business forward. She is requesting a loan to rent a locale where she can run the business. In fact, the entrepreneur is getting elderly and can’t walk along the streets to sell the products as she did before. She is also thinking about introducing tablecloths in the business so as to diversify the offering to the customers and thus attract more people.

Damasa is a very punctual and truthful woman. She has already obtained a loan from FSMA and she repaid successfully. This second loan will help the 50-year-old entrepreneur to reach her economic goals and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To rent a small locale for her business and buy curtains, tablecloths and bed spreads for resale

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Argentina sells natural juices and pica pollo (fried chicken). She is 42 years old and has four children. Her daughters are aged 15, 14 and 12; her only son is 19. Argentina’s husband is a professor in a college.

Argentina used to run the same business in the past. She had to close it because of illness. Fortunately, she was able to start her business up again recently when she took a loan from FSMA to invest in materials needed for the preparation of the food. After a period of hard work and some advertizing, she was able to get back a large part of her old clientele.

The entrepreneur explains that the probationary period of the business has been successful and she thinks she can invest more money to make it grow. She is requesting funds to rent a small locale where she can operate the business so that she can attend to her customers ‘more decently’, as she put it. She also hopes that in future her little business can turn into a big cafeteria which would be well known and considered one of the best in her community.

Argentina says as long as she lives, she will do her best for the sake of her family.

loans.use: To rent a small locale to run a fried chicken business

loans.name: Georgista

texts.en:
Georgista defines herself as a woman with innate abilities for business. She started her first business when she was eighteen. Six years later, she opened a grocery store which she is still running. Georgina is 42 years old and is a single mother of five children. One of them is a professional and the others attend secondary school.

Georgista thinks it’s time to give to her store a facelift. She wants to remodel the old locale where she is operating the business and make it more attractive so she can attract more customers. With the funds requested, she will also buy a lot of goods to supply her business. Georgista says that the products in the most demand are milk, flour, rice and ripe fruits.

The entrepreneur has a good credit history. She has already taken loans from other organizations and from FSMA, and she always had repaid them on time. Given the loan, Georgista will be in a position to keep on satisfying her customers’ needs and remodel her locale so that she can run her business in the most hygienic conditions and attract new customers.

loans.use: Remodel the locale where her business is operated and to buy goods to supply the grocery store

loans.name: Blasina De La Cruz

texts.en:
Blasina is 45 years old, married, with eleven children. She dedicates herself to the sale of the Avon products, specializing in makeup, hair care, and skin care products. Avon is a global company with a very large range of products such as fragrance, bath and body products, as well as the products that Blasina sells.

Blasina started her business because her husband’s income is not enough to support the family. Blasina sells her goods in the afternoon, since she works in the morning as a housekeeper. She says she doesn’t feel bad about doing these jobs since the most important thing for her is to assure the well-being of her offspring.

A few months ago, Blasina took a loan from our organization which she invested in a large amount of products. With her daughter’s help, she was able to sell off all the goods and made great profits. She said with the additional income, it was easier for her to pay the tuition for her children’s school, pay the rent for her house, and now she is able to prepare meals in the morning before the children go to school.

Blasina hopes her business can keep on growing so that she can increase her sales volume and thus her income. She is requesting a second loan to invest in the purchase of a larger amount of goods to sell. She hopes she can attract new customers and hold them. Blasina’s family is very needy. Obtaining the loan will help her to save her children from poverty.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of beauty products to supply her store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana married Juan Carlos aged 24: he is 37 years old and is a public transport driver.

Juliana, when she was very young, began working in the family business, then she suggested studying a trade in order to begin working independently. It was in this way she undertook various courses including: hairdressing, manicure and pedicure treatments and artistic decoration, but it was artesenal embroidery that she liked the best, and so today she spends her time on this work.

Little by little she attracted customers by making promotional offers among family and friends: this is how today she sends blouses embroidered in aó po´í (traditional Paraguayan weaving technique) to different parts of the country and even exports them to Argentina (Paraguay’s neighbouring country).

The loan she is asking for will be used to buy fabric and threads used in the making of her blouses, as there is a lot of demand.

Translated for the Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Katy Long

Juliana se casó a los 24 años con Juan Carlos que tiene 37 años, el mismo es chofer de transporte público.

Juliana desde muy joven empezó trabajando en un negocio familiar, luego se propuso estudiar una profesión para lograr trabajar en forma independiente. Fue así como realizó varios estudios como: peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, decoración artística, pero fue el bordado artesanal el que más le gustó por lo que hoy día se dedica a dicha profesión.

Poco a poco iba ganando clientes realizando promociones entre familiares y vecinos, es así que hoy día envía camisas bordadas en aó po´í (tejido tradicional del Paraguay) a diferentes puntos del país y hasta los exporta a la Argentina (país limítrofe del Paraguay).

El crédito que está solicitando lo destinará a la compra de telas e hilos empleados en sus confecciones de camisas debido a que tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Alicia De La Cruz

texts.en:
Alicia became a client of FSMA six months ago, when she took her first loan which she invested to enlarge a small business she had started seven months before that. She sells ‘longaniza’ (spicy sausage), fried bananas, potatoes and some pâtés and natural juice.

Alicia is 32 years old and is a single mother of five children. On her own, she has to provide food and educate them; she also has to pay the rent for her house and be prepared for any emergency situation. At this time, her fried food business is her only source of income.

Alicia hopes her business can keep growing and she can have her own locale where she can run her business. With the loan requested, she will purchase raw materials in order to keep producing food and preparing and selling juice. That way, she will continue saving money and improve her large family’s living conditions. Alicia will also be closer to achieving her goal which is to have a cafeteria one of these days.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in order to keep on producing food for her fried food business

loans.name: Luisa Magina Bonilla

texts.en:
Luisa is an honest and happy mother who sells women’s shoes and slippers. Her stall is located in a crowded public place in the region of Yamasá. Her three boys and one girl attend school.

Luisa started her business almost two years ago and says that she has learned the rules of the market and she has gained the ability to make her business progress. Currently, she has a lot of customers who are very satisfied with the quality of the products and the personalized service she offers each of them.

The entrepreneur thinks that December is a very suitable moment to make things happen. She wants to purchase goods from the wholesale market so that she can sell them at inexpensive prices and attract new customers and hold them. Luisa says that for that occasion she will also buy men’s shoes in order to offer a larger variety of products to the customers.

In the past, Luisa has proved to be a punctual and truthful person. She has already taken a loan from FSMA which she reimbursed without difficulty.

loans.use: Purchase of women's shoes and slippers to supply her business

loans.name: Sully

texts.es:
Sully is 32 years old. She was born and raised in Ita, Paraguay. Sully is married to Juan Alberto and they have 2 kids. She has always worked in sales, she used to sell door-to-door.

Sully and her husband began by selling all kinds of merchandise door-to-door, until they saved enough money to set up a small grocery store at home.

First they sold meat, and then they increased the merchandise little by little with domestic staples such as sugar, oil, bread, rice, etc. Today their business has grown and they have a steady clientele.

They need a loan to buy an electronic scale that comes in handy in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Sully de 32 años, nacida y criada en la ciudad de Itá, está casada con Juan Alberto y tienen dos hijos. Siempre se dedicó al comercio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de puerta en puerta.

Comenta que junto con su esposo primeramente se dedicaron a la venta ambulante de mercaderías de todo tipo hasta que lograron ahorrar dinero y decidieron montar una pequeña despensa en su casa.

En un principio se dedicaron exclusivamente a la venta de carne y luego fueron surtiendo poco a poco con productos básicos para el hogar como ser: azúcar, aceite, panificados, arroz, etc. Hoy día su negocio ha crecido bastante y ya cuentan con una gran clientela.

Necesitan de un préstamo para la compra de una balanza electrónica debido a la practicidad de la misma.

loans.use: To get an electronic scale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco P. is 44 years old, he was born in Spain. Sr. P. has been Paraguayan resident for many years. He is married to Judith Alarcón and they have 5 children ages: 17, 14, 12, 11, 9 and 1. And another one is coming. The elder is finishing high school and all the others are studying.

Francisco has told us that one of his brothers came to Paraguay before him. He built a school in Guarambaré -15 kilometres away from the capital city. Today the school has 300 students in elementary level.

Francisco used to come on vacation to visit his brother. On one occasion he met Judith, his wife now, and decided to come to live permanently in Paraguay.

He set up a cybercafe that, as you know, is a place were clients come and use the computers, and Francisco started renting computer time.

Francisco says that he is very pleased to have his own micro business. He is asking for a loan to invest in consumables such as: ink for printers, headsets, web cams, microphones, paper and others.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Francisco P., tiene 44 años de edad, es de nacionalidad española, pero reside en nuestro país hace ya varios años, está casado con la Sra. Judith Alarcón con quien tiene 5 hijos de 17, 14 ,12 ,11 ,9 y1 año respectivamente; además de uno que viene en camino. La mayor de sus hijos está terminando el colegio, y los demás están en la escuela.

El Sr. Francisco, nos cuenta que tiene un hermano que había venido a vivir a Paraguay antes que él, y que construyó una escuela donde actualmente cuenta con 300 alumnos de nivel primario, en una ciudad denominada Guarambaré (ciudad que queda a unos 15 km. de la capital).

Al principio, Francisco venía de vacaciones a Paraguay, y en una de esas oportunidades conoció a quien actualmente es su esposa, por lo que decidió venir a vivir definitivamente a Paraguay.

Abrió un Cyber, para poder tener medios de ingresos. Un Cyber es un negocio que se dedica al alquiler de computadoras para el uso de Internet, cobrando una tarifa por el tiempo del uso que le dan a las máquinas.

Hoy día cuenta que está muy contento de poder contar con su propia micro-empresa. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos como tinta para impresoras, audífonos, web cam, micrófonos, papel, etc.

loans.use: To buy consumables such as: ink for printers, headsets, webcams, microphones paper, and others.

loans.name: Norma Elia

texts.es:
I have been selling women’s clothes for the last 3 years. This is the only source of income that we have, since my husband and I work together in it. We would like to get winter and men’s clothes without running out of money. So we are asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 for this purpose. Thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 3 años en la venta de ropa para dama. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Que remos comprar mercancía para frió y para caballero sin descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To get more merchandise

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mrs. Roth M., 42, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a vendor at market selling grocery products, while her husband works on a plot of land raising ducks. They can earn collectively around $7/day in revenue. Furthermore, two of her children are employed at a garment factory, making around $2.50/day each and another one is enrolled in school. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more ducks to expand their poultry.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to expand their livestock

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis saw that in his home his family was lacking money to pay all the household expenses and the school costs of his four children. For this reason he decided to become independent and form his own business. At first he worked with his father for a laundry-mat, but over time he saw that having his own business would give him more earnings and this is why he came to be independent. He started a little laundry-mat and added a repair service since many of his clients come in to the store without hems on their pants.

Nevertheless, each time more, his clients bring their clothes to him, and his few washing machines are insufficient to clean his orders with the rapidness that they deserve. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $375 that he is willing to pay back in a period of five months. With this money Jorge will be able to buy a second-hand washer that will help him finish his orders in less time. With your help Jorge will be able to improve his business and at the same time benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Jorge Luis vio que en su casa estaba faltando dinero para pagar lodos los gastos de la casa y para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus cuatro hijos. Es por esto que decide independizarse y formar su propio negocio. En un inicio trabajaba con su papá con una lavandería, sin embargo al paso del tiempo vio que tener el negocio él solo le dejaría más rendimiento y fue así como consiguió poder independizarse. Y puso una pequeña lavandería en dónde agregó el servicio de reparación, puesto que mucho clientes van con pantalones sin vastillas.

Sin embargo cada vez más, los clientes van llevando ropa y las pocas lavadoras que tienen no rinden lo suficiente como para tener sus pedidos con la rapidez que se merecen. Por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Jorge podrá comprar una lavadora de segunda mano que le servirá para poder terminar sus pedidos en menor tiempo. Con tu ayuda Jorge podrá sacar adelante su negocio y al mismo tiempo a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase a second-hand washing machine.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhorn Y., 40, is married with six married children and lives in a part of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To supplement her family, she runs a stand at home selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, earning on average around $2.40/day in revenue. Her husband works purchasing rice crops from growers or farmers and he then grinds it for the outputs to sell to a broker. Mrs. Chhorn Y. hopes a loan will help her to expand her inventory by adding more products to meet her client needs and the remainder is to buy more rice seeds for her husband to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more products to meet her client's needs and the remainder to buy more rice seeds for her husband to help in the expansion of his business

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria de Los Angeles is a woman that has struggled all of her life to make a better life for her children. Her husband spends most of his time away from the home because he is a truck driver. However, Maria has tried to not let this problem affect her or her family neither emotionally or economically. Since her husband is most often away, she does not have the financial security she needs. If she need to pay for something, but he is away, she and her family are left stranded. This is why she began to look for a job as a salesperson for standing fans in a furniture store. As time went by she realized that she could increase her earnings if she invested in buying her own standing fans to sell. That way she could cut out the middle man. That is the way she did it, she saved some money and bought several standing fans and began to sell them. Now she has several clients and she keeps looking for more so that she will earn more money. She also sells shoes from a catalog to her friends and clients. In the picture above she is shown showing her shoe catalog.

Recently she has many orders that she has not been able to fill because of a lack of money. That is the reason why she is asking for a loan of $475 that she will repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to but more merchandise to offer to her dear clients. With your help Maria will be able to improve her economic situation and celebrate a Christmas holiday united with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

María de los Ángeles es una mujer que a luchado siempre por sacar a sus hijos adelante a pesar de que su esposo trabaja la mayor parte del tiempo fuera de su casa, puesto que es chofer de un camión, sin embargo María a tratado de que este problema no le afecte a la familia tanto en el aspecto emocional como en el aspecto económico puesto que el tener al esposo fuera de la ciudad no le brinda la seguridad de que en cualquier incidente que se requiera dinero poder apoyarla. Es por esto que comenzó a buscar trabajo como vendedora de avanicos de pedestal en una mueblería, y al paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que las ganancias se le incrementarían si ella invierte una cantidad al comprar los avanicos y se quita del centro el presupuesto que gana la mueblería, y así lo hizo, juntó un poco de dinero, compró vario abanicos y comenzó a ofrecerlos, hoy ya tiene varios clientes y sigue buscando más para poder tener mayores ganancias. Aunado a esto María ofrece zapatos por catálogo entre sus amios y clientes.Así como en la fotografía muestra su catálogo de zapatos.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de dinero y es por esto que María está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María y su familia podrán salir adelante y festejar una navidad en familia.

loans.use: Fill her shoe orders

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha is a woman whose hope is that her children will never have to live through what has happened to her, since when she was little her parents had no money for her to go to school. It is for that reason the she began to sell jewelry through catalogues among her family members so she can pay for the cost of her children's school and so they can continue studying until they have a professional degree.

However her struggle continues because her small business on occasion has good times and in others she has bad times; December is the good times. She is requesting a credit of US $475 that she will pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Martha will be able to buy more merchandise to offer her clients. In the photograph shown, Martha has a Jewelry catalog that she uses to offer her products. With your help Martha can succeed and have her kids finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Cody, Ari, Katelyn, and Carl of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Martha es una mujer que tiene la esperanza de que sus hijos no vivan lo que ella a pasado gracias a que cuando ella era pequeña sus papás no tuvieron dinero para que ella estudiara y es por eso que comenzó a vender joyería por catálogo entre sus familiares para poder completar con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, y para que estos continuen estudiando hasta tener una carrera.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue puesto que su pequeño comercio en ocasiones tiene temporadas buenas y en otras malas, y Diciembre es la temporada buena, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener qué ofrecerles a sus clientes. En la fotografía que se muestra de este caso Martha tiene en sus manos un catálogo de joyería y es así como comienza a ofrecer sus productos. Con tu ayuda Martha podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana is a woman who likes food and has made use of her talents to produce foods and sell these products. She prepares her chorizo sausage with much passion and experience, since she started her business 8 years ago, because her children were small and her husband wasn't doing so well; he was laid off of work for long periods of time and had to stay in the house with unpaid expenses.

However, now that her daughters are grown her expenses are growing. Since San Juana is convinced that education is the way to get ahead, she is struggling so that her kids will study and be productive people in society. For that reason San Juana is asking for a loan of $475.00 to be repaid in 6 months. With this money San Juana will be able to buy the materials to make the cheese that she just learned how to make. With the cheese she will have yet another product to sell. With your help San Juana and her children will be able to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Margaux, Micah, Marvae, and Dennis of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

San Juana es una mujer que le gusta la comida y a sabido aprovechar los dones que tiene para elaborar sus comidas, vendiendo productos que ella elabora, tal es el caso del chorizo que lo prepara con muchas ganas y ya experiencia puesto que este negocio lo comenzó hace 8 años, desde que sus hijas estaban pequeñas y a su esposo no le iba tan bien, puesto que en el trabajo que tenía lo desempleaban por largas temporadas y su casa se quedaba con los gastos detenidos.

Sin embargo actualmente que sus hijas ya son mayores, los gastos van incrementando, puesto que San Juana está convencida que el estudio es la base para salir adelante y por eso está luchando para que sus hijos estudien y sean unas personas de provecho. Por lo tanto San Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar material para elaborar quesos que acaba de aprender a elaborar, y así tendrá otro producto que vender. Con tu ayuda San Juana y sus hijos podrán salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy materials to make cheeses

loans.name: Sri

texts.id:
This business is run by Sri since 2006. She runs her business by renting her kiosk. At this moment her husband income is sufficient for her and their one child. As an employee in the private industry, with an income of Rp2000,000 (about US$220), and daily expense of Rp15,000 (about US$1.65), and child's education expense of Rp60,000 (about US$6.60)/month could be fulfilled. However, Sri is running the business in anticipation that daily expenses will increase. Sri's consumers are people around her kiosk. In that area Sri is not the only kiosk. This needs their own strategy. Competition in that area are quite stiff/positive. Pushed by increasing consumer's needs, she needs more capital. Her daily profit so far is about Rp40,000 (US$4.40).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usaha ini telah dijalani Sri sejak tahun 2006. Dia menjalankan usahanya dengan cara mengontrak warung. Saat ini memang penghasilan suaminya sudah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup dirinya dan seorang anak mereka, sebagai pegawai swasta dengan penghasilan per bulan Rp 2.000.000,00, biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000.00 dan biaya pendidikan anak per bulan Rp 60.000,00 mampu dipenuhinya. Namun Sri menekuni usaha ini mengingat bahwa kebutuhan hidup mereka nantinya akan bertambah. Konsumennya Sri adalah masyarakat di sekitar warungnya. Di daerah tersebut Sri tidak jualan sendiri. Hal ini tentu memerlukan strategi tersendiri. Persaingan usaha di daerah tersebut cukup positif. Didorong oleh kebutuhan konsumen yang meningkat, maka dia membutuhkan modal usaha yang lebih besar. Setiap hari keuntungan yang diperoleh selama ini Rp 40.000,00.

loans.use:
To buy items for sale

Membeli barang-barang yang akan dijual.

loans.name: Renn

texts.en:
Mrs. Renn M., 63, is a widow and lives with her three-children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To meet her family’s needs, Mrs. Renn M. works as a broker buying bananas from growers and then reselling them up for moderately for about $7.10/day in revenue. One of her children is employed as a taxi-driver, making about $5.50 each day, and the rest of her children are married.

Mrs. Renn M. has currently applied for a loan amount of $1000 to expand and reinvest in her business and the leftover of the loan is to fix her son’s car. She is appreciative of the power of the loan and is thankful for your trust and support. ( Mrs Renn M. is pictured with her son, who is a taxi-driver)

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for her business expansion.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long M., age 37, works on her plot of land raising pigs, earning around $1 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and also works growing cucumbers, making around $2 each day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a water pump to draw water from their well to more efficiently water their crops. This will allow them to make more productive use of their land and earn extra income from selling the crops in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati is 27 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces some cakes and sells them at the small shop or local market. Her husband, Pepen, is a driver who earns $2 income per day. She requests a loan of $125 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various cakes.

loans.name: Isna

texts.en: Isna is 27 years old and the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces and sells various fried snacks and usually earns $5 per day. Her husband, Enjum, sells sandals and usually earns $1.5 per day. She requests $100 loan to expand her business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various snacks.

loans.name: Suryanah

texts.en: Suryanah is 28 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old daughter. She produces and sells some fried snacks at her house. She can earn up to $3 per day. Her husband, Misja, is a driver who earns $2 per day. She has to work hard to earn more income for her family. She requests a loan of $125 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To produce more various snacks

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan is 28 years old and is the mother of an 8-year-old son. She keeps chickens at her house. She raises and sells them at the market. She also sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks in the morning. She usually earns $10 per day. Her husband sells vegetables at the market and usually earns $2 per day. She requests a loan of $100 to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sutarmi

texts.id:
With a capital of Rp6000,000 (about US$650), Ni Putu Sutarmi raise 2 mother cows. She raised them for about one year, and made a simple bamboo stall at the back of her home. One mother cow is pregnant and will soon bore a calf. The other is still being raised. Every day she feed them pre mixed feed and grass, in the afternoon alternative feed like cocoa shells and leaves. Usually Ni Putu Sutarmi is helped by her husband I Nengah Suardika to find grass in the fields. They help each other, since received profit is good for daily household expenses, and expenses of 2 school aged children.In one year profit are about Rp1,500,000 (about US$160) from sales of 5 months old cow. Dinari's loan is very helpful to Ni Putu Sutarmi to assist in business increase. For the future Ni Putu Sutarmi plans to buy a calf to be raised, so that profit could increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan Modal Rp.6.000.000,- Ni Putu Sutarmi memelihara 2 induk sapi. Induk sapi ini sudah dipelihara selama satu tahun. dan dibuatkan kandang sederhana dari bambu yang berlokasi dibelakang rumahnya. Salah satu induk sapinya sedang hamil dan akan segera melahirkan. Induk yang satu masih dipelihara dengan baik. Setiap pagi diberi makan pakan olahan dan rumput, pada siang hari diberi makanan selingan seperti kulit kakao dan dedaunan. Biasanya Ni Putu Sutarmi dibantu oleh suaminya, I Nengah Suardika, untuk mencari rumput dikebun. Mereka saling bantu dalam memelihara sapi, karena untung yang diterima sangat lumayan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya dan biaya 2 orang anak yang masih sekolah. Dalam 1 tahun keuntungan yang diterima sebesar Rp.1.500.000,- dengan penjualan 1 anak sapi yang berumur 5 bulan. Pinjaman yang didapat dari Dinari sangat membantu Ni Putu Sutarmi dalam menunjang peningkatan usahanya. Untuk kedepan Ni Putu Sutarmi berencana membeli anak sapi untuk penggemukkan, agar bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak.

loans.use:
To buy calf for raising

Membeli anak sapi untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru:
Nurmahmad S. is 40 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 5 children. Nurmahmad’s main occupation is repair and construction of houses. In addition he raises livestock, as he has spent his whole life living in a village. He has taken care of livestock since childhood.

Nurmahmad will use the loan to purchase 3 small bulls and plans to sell them after feeding them. He sells his livestock at the local market where local residents come. After the credit cycle and full repayment of the loan, Nurmahmad will earn 2 pieces of livestock in profit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Самадов Нурмахмад, возраст – 40 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Основным видом деятельности, которым заниамается Нурмахмад это ремонт и строительство домов, помимо этого он дополнительно занимается разведением и домашнего крупного рогатого скота, так как всю свою жизнь он прожил в кишлаке Мингчинор Яванского района и с детства ухаживал за домашним скотом своего отца, а затем и своим собственным. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 3 небольших бычка, который собирается после откормки продать. Скот он продает на местном рынке, где в торговый день съезжаются жители города Явана и близлежащих районов. В конце кредитного цикла после полного погашения суммы кредита клиенту в качестве прибыли остается 2 головы крупного домашнего скота. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 bulls

loans.name: Ni Made Sekar

texts.id:
At harvest time, Ni Made Sekar starts to get busy in his rice fields. Besides looking after her children, she also needs to look after their workers to harvest their rice. Rice harvest is once a year. Loan from Dinari is used to buy fertilizers so that the rice could grow better and well at harvest time to receive maximal results. Income received of Rp4000,000 (about US$420) not yet subtracted by fertilizer cost anf worker's salary. After calculated the nett profit is Rp 2000,000 (about US$210). This profit is used as addition to houshold expenses, since only these rice fields are the main income of Ni Made Sekar , and her husband I Ketut Sudamia. The upcoming loan will be used to buy superior rice seeds, so that the results are more maximal.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bila masa panen tiba, Ni Made Sekar mulai sibuk disawah. Selain mengurus anak-anaknya, Ni Made Sekar juga mengawasi pekerja atau buruh yang dibayar untuk memanen padinya. Panen padi terjadi 1 tahun sekali. Modal pinjaman yang didapat dari Dinari digunakan untuk membeli pupuk, agar padi yang dipelihara bisa tumbuh dengan baik dan subur sehingga pada saat panen Ni Made Sekar bisa menerima hasil yang maksimal. Keuntungan yang diterima sebesar Rp. 4.000.000.- belum dikurangi pembelian pupuk dan ongkos pekerja. Setelah dihitung keuntungan bersih Rp.2.000.000,-. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk tambahan dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, karena hanya sawah yang menjadi mata pencaharian Ni Made Sekar dan suaminya, I Ketut Sudamia. Pinjaman yang akan datang akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit padi unggul, agar hasilnya lebih maksimal.

loans.use:
To buy fertilizer

Membeli pupuk

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
Tolib K. is 28 years old, he graduated from high school, is married and has 2 children. Tolib owns an internet cafe where people can use internet, play video games and work on computers. He rents a small office on the ground floor of a housing complex. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. When Tolib receives credit, he plans to restore several computer systems that are currently out of order. This will provide him with an opportunity to increase the number of working computers in his cafe. This credit will help people who do not have home access to a computer to come and work at the cafe; some can improve their computer skills and others can make new friends through internet and gain necessary educational information from different sites. The client plans to repay the credit within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Кадыров Толиб, возраст – 28 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Толиб имеет интернет-кафе, где каждый желающий может воспользоваться услугами интернета, поиграть в компьютерные игры или поработать на компьютере. Для этого он арендует небольшое помещение находящееся на первом этаже жилого комплекса. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на восстановление нескольких системных блоков находящихся в неисправном состояние. Это даст ему возможность увеличить число работающих компьютеров в своем кафе. Данный кредит поможет людям не имеющим дома компьютер прийти и поработоть в кафе, другим даст возможность повысить свои компьютерные навыки и знания, третьим даст возможность найти себе новых друзей через интернет и получить необходимую инфориацию с познавательных сайтов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Ttechnical renovation of computers

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru:
Husan S. is 53 years old, he has a college degree in economics, is married and has 4 children. Currently, he is retired and his business is to rear and sells cattle. Husan has almost 15 years of experience in this. When he receives credit, Husan plans to buy two young cows to feed and resell. Husan feeds his cattle for 40-45 days and then sells it on a local market. With the profits received he plans to purchase new animals. The rest of the money will be spent on family needs of his wife and 4 children. The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Султанов Хусан, возраст – 53 года, образование высшее, специальность – экономист, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Султанов Хусан в настоящее время находится на пенсии и заниамется разведением и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он имеет почти 15 летний опыт в этом виде деятельности. На полученный кредит Хусан планирует приобрести 2 бычка для откормки и продажи. Скот он откармливает в течение 40-45 дней, после чего продает его на местном рынке. На вырученные деньги он приобретает новый молодняк, а оставшуюся сумму денег использует на семейно-бытовые расходы, так как в семье у него имеется помимо его самого жена и четверо детей. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of 2 cows

loans.name: Sotiboldi

texts.ru:
Sotiboldi T. is 37 years old, has graduated from high school, is married and has 3 children. He grows and sells farm animals. He has been working in this business for the past 5 years. When Sotiboldi receives credit, he plans to purchase several cows in order to resell them in 40-45 days. With the money gained he will purchase more young cattle for feeding and sale. He will use the profit to purchase animal feed and to support his family. His main customers are meat shop owners from the region. After purchasing the cattle, they produce milk and meat products that are then sold on nearby markets. The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Тошматов Сотиболди, возраст – 37 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Сотиболди занимается разведением и продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести сразу несколько голов крупного роагтого скота, для того чтобы через каждые 40-45 днейтакже продавать его, а на вырученные деньги приобретать еще несколько молодых бычков для откормки. Полученную прибыль он будет получать на приобретение корма для скота, а также на семейно – бытовые расходы. Основными его покупателями являются мясники местного района, которые после приобретение скота используют его на производство мясо-молочной продукции, которую потом поставляют на местнрые рынки близлежащих районов. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase 3 cows to feed and resell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S., age 26, sells fish at a market, earning around $2 per day of profit. Her husband, age 30, works as a fisherman to supply the fish his wife sells at the market. He also climbs palm trees to tap the sap to make palm sugar. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional firewood in order to boil the palm sap to make palm sugar to sell in the market. Previously, they sold the sap to someone else to make the sugar, making a very small margin of profit. With the firewood, they can move up the production line and receive retail prices for the palm sugar themselves, earning an additional $2 per day.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to make palm sugar.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung B., age 53, is a widow and works selling Khmer noodles to customers, making around $2 each day in profit. She has four children, two who work as English interpreters, earning $100 per month each, one who works as a hairdresser earning $50, and one who is married and lives away from home. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase piglets to raise and sell at a profit in the market.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell for a profit.

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell for a profit.

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You S., age 54, sells Khmer noodles to customers, making around $1 each day in profit. Her husband, age 59, works making and selling traditional medicines, making around $2 each day. They have three children. One is a garment worker making $80 per month, one is a construction worker making $50 per month, and one is a student. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to invest in her business by buying more noodle supplies and also buy rice crops from the farmers to resell in the market for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make noodles and purchase rice crops.

payments.comment:
Congratulation to Mrs. Sek Mey!!!!!!!!

Now She is able to pay off her loan very early. On behalf of Mrs Sek Mey, we would like to say greatly thank to all the lenders who always support and help to our poor entrepreneurs. your loan can make different. 

we will provide the Journal update of Sek Mey family as soon as we could so that you will understand what different your loan make on her and her family. 

Many Thanks again

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Mrs. Eam H., age 63, works with her husband, age 73, on their plot of farmland growing rice crops, making about $2 each day. They have two children who live at home and work as carpenters, earning together $200 per month. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase one cow to work plowing on her farm and also to buy more carpentry tools for her sons to expand their shop and help support the family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for farming and carpentry tools.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea K. S., age 35, runs a butchery stand selling pork and beef, earning around $7 per day of profit. Her husband is a farmer making around $1 per day. They have two children who live at home, one who is a student and another one who is unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a cow for her butchery business. This will expand her inventory to meet customer demand and raise the income level of the family.

loans.use: To purchase meat for her butchery business.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin M., age 38, works selling biscuits and foodstuffs, earning about $5 per day in revenue. She has no children. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a trailer for her husband to attach to his motor-bike to start a transportation business. They expect he can earn up to $10 per day in revenue by transporting passengers. He is pictured in the photo on his motor-bike.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach to a motor-bike to start a passenger transportation business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Shoe-repair businesses are quite common in Uganda. Often times --  when riding down the road -- one sees a shoe-repair business set up under a shade tree with just a tarp, a bench and lots of old shoes and new soles. Shoe -epair persons not only repair shoes for clients, they often buy bulk quantities of old shoes, repair them and resell them. So, you see, repairing soles is not just the domain of the church. (Forgive our agent, it was late and he'd been writing a lot of stories!)

Moses has had his business for three years and does well at his location. He is able to employ and assistant. Moses is 30 years old and married with three children. He and his wife also care for two orphans. 

Moses dreams of buying a plot of land, building his own house where he can continue doing his shoe repair business and raise his family. He is requesting a loan of $550 so he can purchase more more soles. He wants to buy soles in larger quantities at wholesale, so that he can resell them to other shoe repair people. He has a keen sense of business, and one can tell he is a self promoter who gives his clients excellent service. He lee[s benches around his business so people can visit with each other while they get their shoes repaired. Sometimes they just stop by for the company.

loans.use: To stock more soles for shoe-repair business.

loans.name: Jamada

texts.en:
The next “evolution” in construction of buildings in villages after mud and twig construction was baked adobe brick and then concrete. One sees all types in Uganda, but in the outskirts of Kampala, adobe and concrete have replaced mud and twig. Jamada’s business, Bright Classic Dobbi (Dobbi means "washing" or "cleaning"), is a typical village building made of concrete with either a wood or metal door large enough to open across the entire front, in order to be more welcoming to customers. Often people will live in the back with their families using only by a simple curtain to separate the living space from the business space. The roof is usually corrugated steel. There are no windows.
Jamada has a cleaning business. He washes the clothes in a plastic basin that he sets out front. Water is carried from the well in five gallon plastic jerry cans which were originally used for cooking oil. After the clothes are dried, he heats a heavily weighted iron over the charcoal stove and presses the garments.
Jamada is married with five children. He and his wife also care for an additional three orphans. He has been in business for eight years, and he dreams buying a small plot and building his own home. He is requesting a loan of $250 to buy supplies for his business and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um Y., age 54, works selling foodstuffs and provisions, earning only $1 per day of profit. Her husband, age 56, works as a farmer, making about $1 each day. They have seven children, two who are mechanics, two who are students, three who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $300 in order to purchase piglets to raise for additional profits. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and resell at the market for a profit.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a young 23-year-old retail shop owner. She has operated her business for one year. She takes great care in her appearance as well as the neatness of her business. Her business is located in the Kyebando District of Kampala. Like many districts surrounding Kampala, there is a blend of economic conditions. Within sight of Kyebando on the hillside are million-dollar homes owned by government officials, people running NGO’s, and expat’s. (This is a topic which is absolutely fascinating, very much misunderstood, but is beyond the scope of this article).

In Kyebando there are no paved streets, buildings are poorly-constructed, and people navigate along pathways with the occasional whiff of open sewage. It should be noted that there is a very wonderful spirit in these districts. There is vitality to the “street scene” that is lacking in communities of more affluence. In Kyebando, everyone knows their neighbors, and mothers watch after their children as they play openly and relatively safely along the paths. As most people are without jobs, much time is spent visiting, laughing and telling stories. There are many small businesses. One reason for this is that starting your own business is the only chance you have to get a job. You may not make much, but you will make something, if you start a business.

At Ester's store, she sells soap, toilet paper, candles, dry cells, and soft drinks. She also has a scale where she weighs dry staples from 50kg sacks. From the sacks, she sells rice, flour, salt, etc. With her loan, she plans to expand her inventory of the items she sells.

loans.use: Ester plans to use her loan to buy more soap, soft drinks, and sacks of rice and flour for her retail store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet’s business is located in an old charcoal corral. In these shantytowns, everyone uses charcoal. It is interesting how charcoal is made. It is not mined, it is made. Trees are cut in the forests, and an open pit is dug and a smoldering fire is started in it. Banana leaves are placed over the fire and the logs from the trees--which have now been chopped into small pieces--are thrown into the pit. Banana leaves cover the logs, and dirt is placed over everything. It is important not to suffocate the smoldering fire. Three days later, all is dug up and the chopped up pieces of tree are now blackened charcoal. 
Charcoal is sold by the cup. Most people can only afford enough charcoal for one day, so they regularly visit charcoal sellers each day and buy a couple cups. Annet also sells produce, such as cabbage, matooke, tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Annet is 25 years old and married with two children. She also cares for two orphans. Her dream is to be able to educate her children build a home. She is requesting a loan of $550 so she can buy more charcoal and matooke stock.

loans.use: Too buy more bags of charcoal and to stock more matooke.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang D., age 29, works selling bread at a market, making $5 per day. Her husband is a soldier making $2 per day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more bread for her inventory to meet growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase bread.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mrs. Khuon S. N., age 29, works selling grocery products at her home, making on average about $8 each day in revenue. Her husband is a soldier making $3 per day. They have two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more grocery products to diversify her inventory to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Khakverdi

texts.en: Khakverdi Q. is a 46 years old farmer who keeps a sheep herd in a  small southern village of Azerbaijan. He has twelve years of experience in animal breeding and sales. He sells sheep to the local bazaar traders for meat production. He is married and has two children. Everything is going well in his business and it brings him good enough money to keep his family in good condition. However to keep animals in a good herd is impossible because of the shortage of income. Khakverdi has applied for a 1200 USD loan. He is going to expand his sheep herd and purchase 15 sheep for estimated price 60 USD each, and for the rest of the amount, 300 USD, he will build a good shed to keep the  animals safe and warm during the  winter season.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and build a sheep shed

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Hoeun S., age 34, works selling medicine, earning about $2.50 each day. Her husband works in a hospital, making on average around $8.20 each day. They have three children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $400 in order to purchase more medicines to expand her store and meet her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To expand her store and meet her customers’ needs.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
